The biggest standout is the staff, everyone is extremely meticulous, thoughtful, helpful and lovely to be around.  In particular, Kit, Denzel and Jonathan are some of the best hotel staff, actually best staff anywhere, that I have been lucky enough to experience.  To say they went above and beyond, as well as made me (and my dog!) feel special, well cared for and the most important VIP/important person in the world, is generally a rarity these days.  As a salesperson myself, I would hire all three of them:). Thank you and looking forward to staying with you again!

title: Best Midtown Hotel Gem
text: We ❤️ the Melia Family! Just spent 5 days at the Innside Melia in Midtown NYC and it was an amazing family stay from the time we checked in to when we left. The staff: Christina, Leslie, Kima & Justin were so friendly, attentive, professional & knowledgeable and gave  this precious hip hotel a boutique feel.  Complimentary water and vino were a nice touch. The rooms were spacious for NYC with all the amenities and contemporary decor. It has a restaurant & bar, a rise garden & workout facility. No pool. Location is centrally located & near Madison Square Garden & approx $25 cab ride to Times Sq. & $24 to 911 Memorial & WTC. I definitely recommend & will return.

title: This place is awesome and has great ambiance
text:
My name is Josh. I come to NYC a lot for business and usually i stay in hotels that are close to the venue i am booked for. Recently i have had more misses than hits with hotels in NYC but INNSIDE was a HIT!!!.

First off my king size bed and room was spacious and clean with modern accoutrements such as chromecast for the television and reliable fast internet that has the router in the room. I love the little style touch's such as a color led strip next to a fake plant that really gives this place a home away from home vibe.

But really blew me away and made me extend my 3 day stay was the customer service. All were great but Leslie, Denzel and Dirmarys really made my stay special and gave great information and answered all of my questions regarding the hotel adroitly without making me feel like an idiot.

All in all i never write reviews unless things are bad and i am very happy that Leslie, Denzel and Dirmarys were able to change that habit as this is to recognize their exceptional devotion to customer service that has ensured i will be calling INNSide my home away from home for many years to come.

title: Security deposit scam
text: I stayed at Innside Melia Nomad for 1 night to celebrate my daughter’s birthday on  March 25th (checked out on the 26th).  The room was not bad but could have used some better lighting…or any lighting for that matter.  There was no actual lamp or light fixture in the room.  Although it was inconvenient, it wasn’t the end of the world as we literally only slept there for several hours before checking out.  The staff at front desk were extremely pleasant and professional.  When we arrived, we were advised that their “system was down” and they could not process my payment at the time of check-in. They took a copy of my card and said that they would “bill me later”.   They did mention that there would be a $100USD security deposit (hold) which would be released within 3-5 business days after checkout.  When I checked out the following morning, I went to the front desk to confirm re: the security hold. Was given the same response (3-5 business days). After leaving the hotel, we spent the rest of the afternoon in NYC. I checked my account a few hours later and found that the charges for the room had been applied but there were 2 identical transactions for security deposits ($100 USD x2). I called the hotel and someone at the front desk told me “this happens sometimes. It’s a glitch. One of the charges will drop off automatically”. I asked when the other security charge would be released  as  it had been, by this time, hours since checkout and they would have confirmed no damage to the room. Same answer 3-5 days.  The duplicate charge did, in fact, drop off (not to be confused with “refunded”…it simply disappeared; that transaction is no longer visible in my account).  I called the hotel the following week and, again, the week after to inquire about the other deposit…always getting the same response. I emailed several times. The did not respond to my email. It has now been more than 2 months and my deposit has not been returned. I have opened a dispute with my bank  for this charge as it seems as though I won’t have my funds returned otherwise. I have read various reviews by other travellers in the same situation re: security deposit at Innside Melia NoMad. Unfortunately, as a result of this, I cannot recommend this hotel. Nor would I consider staying at any of the other Melia locations.

title: Unique and perfect place in every way.
text:
If you don’t want to read a long review here’s what you need to know:  INNside is in a great location, has exceptional service, is very unique and luxurious for the moderate cost, has a wonderful restaurant and several colorful, comfortable outside lounging areas.  I highly recommend it. 
It is located Midtown in the Chelsea/Nomad area on 27th between 6th and 7th Avenues. It’s right down the street from the Fashion Institute, an easy walk to PennStation and around the corner from MadisonSquare Park. I’m a woman almost 80 years old and I felt safe walking everywhere, even late in the evening, and especially safe since the elevator access was with my room key. 
There were always friendly and accommodating staff in the lobby. Leslie and Kima were especially kind and thoughtful. They offered me perks…a free breakfast…and an upgrade for my next stay. There was a frig in the room that’s stocked with water and juices that were free and refilled as needed. Also, when I arrived I called down to request a tea pot, robe and slippers.  I’m not a coffee drinker but there was full coffee service in the room. I left the room immediately to go out and was met at the elevator with these items already heading for my room. 
I loved the decor.  It was simple and smart. the room was bright and white with great natural light…calming with hip retro touches. There was no carpet so it felt very clean but the floors were soft and warm. There was an excellent multi-head shower. 
The outside spaces were perfect.  There was a Rose Garden for lounging and enjoying refreshments. It had a wall of roses and a swing for selfies and there were colorful umbrellas overhead!  There was also a courtyard at the entrance perfect for relaxing, socializing or people watching.  
Finally, the restaurant had seating inside and outside. It was very comfortable and the food was excellent. They went above and beyond even letting me talk to the chef who told me how to make his unique and delicious breakfast potatoes. On the second morning as soon as I sat down for breakfast the waiter came right over with the tea I’d had the day before. 
I couldn’t have had a more perfect stay and look forward to my next visit!

title: Si volvemos, nuestro hotel será el mismo.
text: Mi mujer y yo estuvimos de luna de miel una semana. Todo el personal fue súper amable y en especial Leslie que viendo que nuestro inglés es regular, nos habló en español y nos ayudó en todo momento. Nos tocó una habitación en la planta 20 con unas vistas geniales al One World Trade Center. Tanto la habitación como el baño súper limpio y ordenado.

title: Don't look any further!
text: I'm sitting at the airport waiting to board and I miss New York already! What a great holiday we've just had and how lucky we were to find such a great hotel! Staff were amazing, Denzel and Hector always welcomed us with a big smile and were incredibly professional. Same for staff at the  restaurant, by far the best food we had in NY over the last week! Had to ask the chef to give me the recipe of the salad's dressing...never liked a salad so much!!! Rooms are very clean and NO carpet!! Mybe a bit small but it's a fair compromise given other options in Manhattan. All in all I fully recommend this hotel. Central location, friendly staff and inside restaurant...what else could you wish for? Arrivederci Innside, hopefully see you soon NY!! Ciao!

title: Lovely hotel with great staff!
text: Lovely hotel right in the heart of the city and close to three major train lines. The room was clean and perfect as a home base for my adventures. The hotel staff was also kind and welcoming. Denzel and Gia are the dream team and made my stay perfect. Would recommend staying here!

title: Best hotel stay
text: Staying at this hotel was such an amazing experience. Words can’t even describe the experience. I can’t wait to come back. The customer service was amazing, the hotel stay was amazing 10 out of 10. Definitely recommend.

title: 10/10 - Highly Recommend
text: We had such a great relaxing stay! Denzel was a great host and the customer service from all of the staff that we encountered was AMAZING. We are definitely looking forward to coming back, Godwilling!

title: Excelente en todo !!
text:
Hacía tiempo no recibía un servicio tan excelente en una estadía. Aquí te tratan como en casa. El agua es gratuita, algo que deberían tomar en cuenta los demás hoteles. El café es Nesspreso, para mi eso es un a+++, también gratuito. Queda cerca de todo, puedes ir a pie o tomar el tren, ya q tiene la estación bien cercana (en la 28st). 
Hace tiempo no veía un personal tan amable. 
La limpieza fue impecable y además tiene un buen ambiente. 
Si vuelvo a NY aquí me quedo.

title: Very Welcoming and Friendly
text: Denzel was so welcoming as soon as we arrived! He treated us to wine and chocolate. 🥰 His demeanor was so kind and thoughtful. Hotel was really nice and clean. Complimentary drinks  were included!! 😍

title: Nueva York como en casa.
text: El hotel está muy bien ubicado. Nada más llegar, el excelente trato por parte de Leslie y Christina, hacen sentirte muy cómodo y bien atendido. La habitación está muy bien y sobre todo silenciosa. Perfecta la limpieza. La terraza del bar a pie de calle, está genial para compartir un espacio de diversión. El restaurante tiene una muy alta calidad en productos del mar, ostras, camarones; tanto barra fría como caliente. Otro trato excelente por parte de Liliana en el restaurante; te hacen sentir como en casa. Muy recomendable.

title: Perfect Oasis
text: I love this hotel so much ! Clean spacious rooms, fabulous people working there. I come to NY often and I will only be staying here from now on! The room and view was so nice, I looked forward to returning to it each day.

title: Gorgeous clean hotel, small inconveniences for a quick trip.
text:
Denzel and Dirmarys were amazing and made check out a breeze. Ref in the suite with free sodas. Steamer in room. Spacious clean bathroom!. Accessible shower. Incredible proximity to attractions in Manhattan. Beautiful amenities. Gorgeous places to hang out. We felt very comfy and will be staying here again. 

Only annoyances were that the room lamps did not work. Phone in room doesn’t operate which is a big safety concern. We had to go downstairs to request waters but unfortunately they forgot to bring them up. Had to come back down. The bed is quite uncomfortable— old and sagging— disappointing. The panel to connect HDMI/Bluetooth to TVs didn’t work. These would’ve been bigger issues but we were only staying 1 night.

title: Excellent Hotel in Chelsea Location
text: This was our first time staying at the INNsiDE New York Nomad. This hotel was conveniently located around multiple subway stations and Penn Station. 6 min walk to Koreatown and other shops. Jon and Jestin from the front desk were very nice and made us feel welcome right off the bat. Excellent customer service all around. We were given a small bottle of wine to enjoy and extra pods for the Nespresso. We booked the King bed. It was spacious with a large sitting area. The water and sparkling juices were a plus! Jon wasn't kidding when he said "welcome to our family" as we were treated like family. Can't wait to go back! Thank you for a wonderful experience.

title: Prime Location
text: Great location.  Fast check in.  Free soft drinks in room is a great touch.  Very comfortable hotel in great spot for exploring the city.   Felt extremely safe walking around here at night.  Easy walk to Brooklyn Bridge, Chelsea market, The Highline and Times Square

title: Jestin and Alyssa
text: Jestin, the front desk manager was the best.. his manner was utmost professional.  Alyssa, our waitress in the restaurant was great.. she made sure our drinks were full 😂 and our meal was satisfactory.

title: Great experience
text: My best friend and I went on a trip together to New York and loved our stay here. It was reasonably priced, modern, clean, and the staff were super helpful. Shout out to Denzel, Jestin, and Leslie for being so accommodating, enthusiastic, and understanding.

title: My new go to quick solo stay in nyc.
text:
Probably one of the better hotels you will find in Manhattan that is not overly pricey. I have stayed here twice already and I just love the accessibility.
Front desk staff : Leslie (not sure if this is the spelling of her name) is one top notch hospitality professional, very personable, knowledgeable and just a delight from check in to check out. Honestly all the front desk staff is vey helpful and they absolutely keep it cool under pressure. Overall a great experience. Jonathan, the Concierge? Not sure but also wonderful and vibrantly hospitable.
Restaurant: I have some mixed feelings but it's overall good.
The first time I stayed here I had room service/ate the restaurant once and it was great, hummus, burger, some veggie side, Salad, all the things. Pretty good.
Second time I stayed there I ate at brunch with friends and everything was just off the food was not great, coffee was so bad we went to a coffee shop after to get coffee. Obviously when the server came to check on us my friends and I were like "everything is great". We ate as much as we could, paid for it over tipped and left because we were service people/cripplingly non-confrontational, but yea it wasn't great.
Restaurant staff : A mix bag of people who work there and people in uniform wishing they were somewhere else, which is literally every nyc restaurant. (shrug emoji)
overall though I really like this hotel.

title: Stay Here!
text: This is the absolute best place to stay in NYC!  From the moment you walk in, you are greeted by friendly staff who make you feel welcome. The front desk manager, Jestin ensures that guests are made to feel at home. You are family! He is very accommodating and quick to respond if you need to contact him. In addition, Christina was extremely helpful upon my departure. She arranged transportation to the airport so I did not have to worry about calling a cab. The room was immaculate, spacious, and comfortable. The cleaning staff do a great job, and they are also very friendly. The environment at this hotel is very inviting. It is also very secure. I like the added feature of needing a room key to operate the elevator to the floor you are staying. This is now my favorite place to stay. The only place you should stay! I guarantee you will like it here!

title: Great Stay at a Great Hotel
text: I had a wonderful three night stay. The check in process was smooth. Denzel Hamilton was friendly and professional.  All the staff that I encountered was very professional and always asked if they could help you with anything.  The room was very nice, but small, and that could be because I am not a New Yorker and use to more space. The breakfast served in the restaurant was delicious.

title: Nice Hotel, be aware off "facility fee"
text:
We had a nice stay. However upon departure we were charged a previously undisclosed "facility fee" of 40 dollars per night.
The hotel is well located and within walking distance to many attractions. We stayed on the 15th floor and were not bothered by noise. Fine cardio fitness facilities with bicycles, treadmills and cross trainers.

title: Great boutique in NYC
text: Spent one night here. Staff are great. Location convenient for everything . Comfortable and chic hotel.  Great value for a hotel of this quality in the heart of NYC.  Normally I stay at big chain hotels when I’m in NYC, but this boutique is much better

title: Best hotel ever !
text:
I am currently staying at this hotel 
with my family and we were greeted politely by Denzel, Liz and Gia. They also gave us a free bottle of wine. Everyone is so nice and the hotel is beautiful. Totally recommend staying here !

title: Heart of Lower Manhattan
text: Beds are super comfy, Keema at the front desk and all the staff were very helpful.  Conveniently located in Chelsea, easy to get to anywhere in lower Manhattan (it's right in the middle).  Bar was nice food at the Wilson was very good.  Rooms were quiet.  I loved it and would stay there again.

title: Great hotel, unbelievable staff.
text: Had an incredible experience. Hotel was nice, clean, and comfortable; what really separated the experience was the staff. By far the nicest staff I’ve experienced at a hotel in a long time. It was my graduation and my wife is 8 months pregnant, so needless to say it was a bit hectic and they were constantly flexible and helpful to us. To shout out a few people in particular: we arrived late at night (Tuesday, May 16th) and was greeted by a man who hails from Maryland (I forget his name). Incredibly nice person and it set the tone for the rest of our stay. My Wife and I walked away that night already astounded by how nice he was. The next day, while my graduation went longer than expected, my wife not being able to move the bags on her own, and us being super late for check out. We had the privilege of dealing with Leslie and Christina who were nothing short of an absolute pleasure to work with. They were nice, sweet, accommodating, and funny. I won’t go into all the details (let’s just say there were a lot of moving parts), but they made the experience not only less stressful, but enjoyable. Fantastic, fantastic staff all around. Well done- I cannot say how pleasant it was to deal with the people that work there.

title: RECOMENDABLE
text: El hotel esta muy bien y la situación estupenda. La habitación correcta de tamaño, la cama grande y cómoda.el baño grande y bien equipado. El hotel se encuentra en la calle  27, entre la séptima y la sexta avenida .El metro al lado del hotel,  linea roja 1, con la cual podrás recorrer todo manhattan de arriba a abajo. Yo lo recomendaría por todo lo anterior y por el servicio del personal de recepción, dispuestos a ayudarte en todo lo preciso.

title: Dirty and old
text: The room wasn't clean enough, especially bathroom floor. The room was very old and need to be refreshed. The location is amazing both for my work place and after work hours, time-square is few minutes walk

title: Weekend away
text: Exceptional. Good vibe. Good location. Excellent breakfast. Great Staff. Would stay here again in a heartbeat. Would recommend to anyone.Hopefully return one day soon, to experience the delights of Manhattan

title: The best service!!
text: INNside by melia New York was an excellent experience. The location was great as it is just a few blocks away from Penn station. Plenty of shopping near by. The rooms are very spacious. Christina at the front desk is amazing!!! The most professional and friendly customer service I have received from a hotel in many years. She helped us upgrade to a family suite and then when there was a minor issue with our room it was rectified seamlessly. They made up for it and in the end the issue only added to our pleasant experience! Will be staying here again soon!!

title: Fantastic stay!
text: Great location. Convenient and clean!! Would stay here every time I come to New York!! The restaurants vibe was great and I love the modern cleanliness of the rooms. Definitely would recommend! Loved it

title: Perfect experience
text:
Hotel muy cuidado, habitaciones grandes y limpias y personal muy atento. Leslie y Christine un 10!! 
Es un hotel muy tranquilo, en las habitaciones no se oye nada del exterior. La terraza del restaurante es ideal y muy acogedora.

title: Wonderful Hotel!
text: I loved my stay at Innside so much I had trouble leaving my room! It was the perfect treat after babysitting my elderly dad. The room was spotless and spacious. The view was excellent and I enjoyed drinking my coffee looking out the giant window each morning. This is my new favorite NYC hotel. Im going back next month! I got the king room with a  city view.

title: Very satisfied
text: Had a wonderful stay for our first time in New York. From the the moment we arrive to the moment we left. eveyone was ver welcoming and made our stay a very good experience. I enjoyed the atmosphere and the room is very very clean.

title: Thank you Denzel💙
text: We chose the Melià for our stay in New-York. My luggage had been lost at the airport so I wasn't in the best mood for the beginning of our trip. BUT, Denzel was at the reception desk this night and his smile and his wittiness was SO comforting. Throughout my stay, he was so kind, empathic and helpful (he even called the airport for me and tried to have an update for my situation). He called our room when he personally took delivery of my baggage. The Melià is beautiful and have a great location, great staff (everybody was nice). But Denzel is the ace of this hotel.You will be warmly welcomed. Thank you Denzel.

title: Great customer service
text: Excellent location, rooms are clean and have everything you need. However for me the best part was the service from the staff - complimentary drinks, super helpful in answering my questions, went out of their way to find me an umbrella when it rained all day and they were running low. Special thanks to Denzel, Leslie and Jestin for their care and attention.

title: Phenomenal!!! phenomenal
text: they have an amazing customer service in this hotel; if you’re sitting down saying to yourself, this is what I need in a hotel they have it do you want to be in the center of everything in Manhattan isn’t it? It’s a phenomenal hotel.!!! if you’re sitting down saying to yourself, this is what I need in a hotel they have it do you want to be in the center of everything in Manhattan isn’t it? It’s a phenomenal hotel when you get to the hotel. when you get to the hotel, just asked for Denzel or Jonathan  Unbelievab!!!  Unbelievable.

title: Mother's Day Celebration 🍾 💕
text:
Beautiful hotel in Chelsea!  I took my 81 year old mother and Aunt to this hotel. I was so nervous about bringing  my elderly mom on this trip but Denzel at the front desk made my family and I feel so comfortable. I voiced my feelings to Denzel and he told me not to worry about anything."Welcome Home".
 Everyone at this hotel was so friendly and helpful.  I absolutely love this hotel.

title: A Hidden Gem
text:
What a wonderful hotel. The decor is creative, happy and the staff seem to genuinely enjoy their jobs and went out of their way to be helpful. We were celebrating my son's wedding and the wait staff provided an additional bottle of Prosecco to our table. A special thank you to Leslie, Christina and Dirmarys whose cheerful and helpful demeanor really added to the enjoyment of our stay. 
Thanks again everyone!

title: Want to be trendy hotel - doesn't live up to the pretty pictures
text:
I will admit, that the marketing got me.  The photos of this hotel look amazing, but in-person it just doesn't live up to the images.

The good:
*Location - we found this a great spot for getting around Manhattan.  You can walk out the door and get just about everything you'd hope for.  
*Nice staff - we didn't have too many interactions, but the limited ones we had were kind and helpful.  
*Modern design - the rooms and environment are modern and appealing in appearance

The bad:
*Extra fees - we paid extra for "city views."  I guess this meant we got to look out our window and see some element of New York City - or the wall of the building across the street.  We did NOT have views of Manhattan similar to the pictures on their website.  They also charge a daily "resort fee," which many hotels do now, but there was nothing on the property remotely related to a resort
*Low quality execution - the property felt like it was put together with the cheapest materials possible.  It reminded me of a lower-budget version of an Ace Hotel.  There was some mold on the floor of our shower, the entry key component kept falling off and you could hear doors open and close.
*No hair conditioner and empty bottles of body wash - YAY! to getting rid of single use plastic bottles of shampoo, but please refill them and don't eliminate hair conditioner.  At the price per night, conditioner should be provided.

This was our first stay at a Melia property and will likely be my last.

title: Overnight in Chelsea
text: Checkin experience was great. Denzel at the front desk made me feel welcome and was very pleasant. The Hotel is modern, clean, and the room was plenty roomy with a king bed and plenty of places to spread out

title: Excellent stay!
text: Our stay at the Innside by Melia was nothing short of a WONDERFUL experience! The staff are extremely knowledgeable, helpful, and kind. Christina at the front desk was absolutely amazing! She was very welcoming and made our stay at this hotel a very memorable experience. We would definitely stay here again!!

title: Long weekend stay
text: Value for money in mid town NY. For a Manhattan hotel, the room size was great. Walking distance to many places you want to see when visiting Manhattan. Nice restaurant and cool vibe. Very nice and helpful staff. I will stay there every time I travel there.

title: Great experience, highly recommend
text: Checkin with Denzel was fast, friendly, efficient and he immediately introduced himself and other team members. Room and bathroom very clean, windows crack open for fresh air, comfortable bed, great shower, and my daughter and I were amazed at how quiet it was at night even though the hotel was fully booked.

title: DECEPCIONANTE Y PÉSIMO
text:
El hotel no está a la altura de lo que pagas para nada de nada. Nuestra llegada ya fue mal. Ninguna de nuestras peticiones solicitadas con antelación y con respuesta por parte del hotel que estarían todas preparadas, ninguna estaba y nadie sabía nada y tampoco nos dieron solución para ello.

Viajábamos 3 adultos y el espacio de la habitación era más que minimalista. Se supone que teníamos una cama de matrimonio y un sofá cama convertible.

La cama de matrimonio era súper blanda, incómoda para dormir.

El sofá cama no estaba hecho y tuvimos que reclamar que nos lo hicieran. Cuando era súper tarde y veníamos exhaustos del viaje y del control de pasaportes de más de 3 horas.

El sofà cama, al abrirlo, la habitación aún era más pequeña, incómoda, si cabe. Era indormible dormir allí para un adulto.

Debéis de tener en cuenta que era una suite con terraza y que pagamos un dineral por ella diariamente.

La habitación estaba preparada sólo para dos personas, en cuanto a enseres, tuvimos que reclamar, casi a diario, que éramos 3 adultos  en la habitación.

Intenté hablar con la persona que me había escrito los emails con mis peticiones y que me había dado la confirmación. Prácticamente no abrió la boca ni se disculpó y los otros dos empleados de recepción se reían, creo que de mí.

No teníamos los adaptadores de corriente solicitados. Nos dijeron que se les había acabado. Tuvimos que reclamarlos a diario y al tercer día nos los trajeron.

Habíamos pedido también un microondas, que hasta el tercer o cuarto día de reclamar no nos lo trajeron.

Estuvimos como indigentes en esa habitación. Sin espacio en el armario ni en el baño. Teníamos que tener las maletas abiertas en el suelo y con mucha dificultad para movernos dentro de la habitación.

No os fieis de las fotos son tremendamente engañosas.

La pica del lavabo estaba medio obstruida, tragaba con dificultad, hasta q	ue en 2 o 3 días que quedó embozada completamente. Hasta 2 veces tuve que llamar a recepción para que subiera alguien a arreglarla, pues imposible de lavarse, una guarrería.

La información que nos dieron las distintas personas que atienden en recepción fueron equívocas e inexactas. Suerte de google maps y de espabilarnos por nuestra cuenta. Tanto en tema de desplazamientos como de cualquier cosa en general.

La limpieza de la habitación aunque pongas el “no molestar”, pasan súper pronto, como a las 8h de la mañana, te dejan un papel bajo la puerta, que con el caos de la habitación ni lo ves, diciendo que ya han pasado y no la han podido hacer. Si no das aviso en recepción cuando te vas, no vuelven a pasar, inaudito!!

Muchos días teníamos que reclamar, tazas, toallas, café, leche…etc ...cuando me habían dicho por escrito que diariamente repondrian y que podía pedir la cantidad que quisiese.

El primer día pedimos desayuno en el Wilson, tardaron mucho en traerlo. Se ve que subieron dos veces y que no les abrimos la puerta. Lo lógico hubiera sido que nos llamasen por teléfono desde recepción, y nada. Viendo que pasaba mucho rato llamamos de nuevo y nos dijeron que estaba abajo para recoger. Nuestra sorpresa aún fue mayor, cuando vimos que lo que pedimos estaba incompleto, faltaba el huevo por encima que debía llevar.

Es un hotel que no está a la altura en nada. Es muy de postureo. Lo único que tiene de bueno es que está bien situado.

Queridos viajeros de Tripadvisor… buscaros cualquier otro hotel.

Habíamos estado en otros Meliá y la verdad, este hotel decepcionante!!!!

title: Clean and Central
text: Overall a good hotel in a good location just downtown of Times Sq so none of the crazy amounts of people. Good food and coffee options nearby and close to a few different subway options. Hotel staff are helpful and rooms clean.

title: Perfecta atención
text: El hotel está perfectamente ubicado, sobre todo destacar la atención de Jonathan el recepcionista que desde el primer momento nos ha ayudado con todo lo relacionado con nuestra habitación y nos ha recomendado actividades. Todo ha sido mucho más fácil gracias a él. Este tipo de personas son las que de verdad dan valor a un hotel.

title: La garantía de la hosteleria española y de la cadena Meliá
text: Buscábamos una cadena hotelera española en New York y elegimos Meliá porque somos miembros Rewards. Celebrábamos dos fechas especiales con nuestro primer viaje a New York, junto a nuestros hijos adolescentes. La reserva en el Call Center fue muy cómoda. La relación por correo con el hotel muy resolutiva. Queremos agradecer a D. Miguel Candelario que nos asignara una habitación espectacular en el piso 20, de cuyas vistas nos maravillábamos continuamente. El personal de limpieza de la habitación la dejaba impecable todos los días. El personal de recepción amabilísimo. Las instalaciones comunes y el ambiente en la planta baja muy agradable y moderno. El hotel está muy céntrico, a pocos pasos del Empire State. Sin duda el hotel ha sido gran parte del éxito de nuestro viaje. Volveremos sin dudarlo la próxima vez.

title: Chic Minimalist Hotel with Great Customer Service
text: As soon as I walked in, I was greeted by Denzel! He was the kindest and sweetest human! Made sure I was well taken care of and made sure my room was ready. He made me feel so warm and welcomed after a long day of travel! The rooms are spacious and have great amenities! The restaurant looks amazing as well and I hope to try it during my stay! Thank you for the incredible hospitality, Denzel! You’re truly a light and thank you for kicking off my trip to nyc with such joy!

title: Hotel in a good location, also a great staff
text: Once in NYC, try to be at Innside New York NoMad hotel, especially because of your staff (Chrstina in specific). She was very professional and paying attention to our (my wife’s birthday and I) needs. I would return to be this hotel’guest again. Thanks Chrstina and all the Innside staff.

title: Paid for city view, appalling view.
text:
Arrived to first room which was a street view, paid for city view. Called reception and they said its because more buildings have gone up since the hotel was built!  This was untrue as it was clearly a street view room. 
Agreed to move us,  said 1701 had a good view. This was not true either the view was appalling. We didn't request to move again as it was the start of a trip of a lifetime and didn't want to waste anymore time.

title: Not returning
text:
We stayed one night. Checkout is 12pm. We put the Do Not Disturb sign on our door and husband made sure as he was closing the door that it was facing the correct way since it would swing. Housekeeping, at 10:45am, knocked once and attempted to open the door without waiting for a response. We were not dressed but luckily positioned the door stop so she could not open the door fully. Manager said that the housekeeper thought the sign was positioned to clean room. If we are checking out that day, why would be put the clean room sign out? Do the housekeeping staff not have a list of who is checking out vs staying in this day and age? 
Also, so done with the NYC hotels that charge a resort fee. Innside’s resort fee is $41. For WiFi and water. They used to provide juice and soda too but no longer. Get rid of the resort fee.

title: Extraordinaria atención  y ambiente en el hotel y en el restaurante Wilson
text:
Hemos recomendado el Hotel Innside by Melia New York NOMAD a nuestras amistades. El personal de recepción en el check-in, durante la estancia y en el check-out extremadamente atentos, amables  y eficientes. Especialmente Justin y Elizabeth.
En el comedor, restaurante Wilson, igualmente muy atentos y amables, especialmente Zach y Leandro. 
Además el servicio de ventajas de fidelidad por tener la tarjeta Melia platinum funciona muy bien.
Muchas gracias.

title: Ask for a high floor
text: I was given a room on a lower floor right over the garbage bins. I didn’t notice at first. The trucks came at 3 am and woke me as they emptied the garbage.the breakfast isn’t as good as that offered in the European Amelia hotels.

title: Worst hotel ever
text: Dirty, unkept, unsafe and overall the worst hotel experience I've ever had. The room was full of dirt and scuffs and smears on the wall. The bathroom was horrendous, with a non-functioning toilet. The "film" that covered the glass wall between the shower and the room was tarnished, dirty and had bubbles/holes. My room wasn't cleaned, the TV didn't work, nor was there any real lighting in the room. The "Window" didn't have shades and faced a brick wall with a bunch of exposed windows. There were non hotel guests roaming the floors and one evening I kept having random people knocking on my door from 11pm on and the hotel did nothing to handle, despite my calls to downstairs. Would not recommend this hotel (which cost nearly $400 a night) to anyone. I've had better experiences at Motel 6.

title: Cumpleannos en NYC
text: La habitacion que elegimos tenia vista a la ciudad. Grande para lo habitual en NYC. la gente de recepcion muy amable para solucionar los muchos temas administrativos (Duplicaron cargos, etc.). El parking esta a dos cuadras del lugar. El restaurante es muy caro y no ofrece variedad. Muy buena ubicacion y metro a mano.

title: Wonderful staff
text: 5 fantastic days in New York enhanced by the wonderful, helpful and attentive staff at Innside by Melia. Special mention from us to Ullah who organised our stay perfectly and Leslie who provided exceptional assistance at reception. They are both a credit to the Melia Group.

title: Hotel with excellent team
text:
Honestly I can’t ask for better team of employees and managers from this hotel .
They are not only knowledgeable but also go out of their ways to help their guests .
Impressive bunch if I had to compare to hotels near Chelsea, trust me I have stayed with them for quite sometimes too.
But Melia nomad is my favorite, so much that I stayed there for 60 plus days .
Here are some managers I have come to known them   Christina , Leslie, Justin , Jon , Jose, Hector  , they are the best .
Their hotel Melia app is also great . 
Highly recommend the place and people there.
Good luck to all

title: Great service
text:
As soon as I walked in, Jestin and Leslie on reception couldn’t have been nicer. A perfect start to a great stay.

Nice touches in the room like the refreshments, yoga mat, books and QR code to get a choice of library books. Great views on the upper floors!

title: So Glad Melia is now in USA
text: From check in to check out everything was really easy. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The staff was truely so warm and helpful. The location is fantastic and very convenient to everything in lower Manhattan and Times Square. Especially Leslie, David, Kima and Denzel.

title: De lujo
text:
Hemos pasado una semana fantástica.  El hotel está muy bien situado para llegar andando a todos los sitios , es 4 estrellas y muy bien . Tiene 20 pisos y los últimos tienen vistas sobre el resto de edificios . El restaurante muy bien,tanto para desayunar como para cenar he te súper amable  . El personal de recepción fantástico y Dirmarys de 10 .
Y sobre todo , te entienden perfectamente en español .

Si eres español y quieres estar cómodo, bien situado y que te entiendan en tu idioma . Este es tu hotel .

title: Horrible Experience
text: My coworker and I stayed here to finish off the weekend of our trip. It started with us waiting in the lobby for 2 hours waiting for our room to be ready. We originally booked their room with 2 beds. The front desk tells us that we have been “upgraded” to a suite. Well this suite only had 1 bed and a very uncomfortable pull out sofa. This was the worst experience I’ve had at a hotel, and hope to get our money back.

title: Outstanding from beginning to end!
text: We had such a wonderful experience at Innside!  From the check-in to the rooms to the lovely guy who greeted us each morning in the lobby.  The front desk staff was really wonderful and could not have been nicer to work with.  The location was perfect for getting around the city.  And the rooms were absolutely silent at night (no street noise or neighbor noise).  Highly recommend to others and we'll definitely be using it again in the future!

title: Fabulous staff
text: We loved our overall experience. Just to name a few engaging and attentive staff-David, Kima,Denzel,Christina and Kit. Wonderful atmosphere, everyone is friendly, ready to hel if needed. Good energy all around.

title: Great experience
text: Great experience at melia innside new york, the location is fantastic close to penn station, breakfast delicious, the staff (Kima, Christina & Hector) very helpful and friendly, the room fully equipped with city views 10/10. recommended 100%

title: Amazing experience 10/10
text: Hector, Kima, Denzel, Christina, David, Jonathan, Jose and Justin were all extremely kind, helpful and welcoming. I really appreciate the service I received. I had a great nights rest and I will definitely be back again. 5 stars!

title: GRAN EXPERIENCIA
text:
Sin duda un completo acierto para visitar Nueva York. Un hotel muy bien ubicado, literal a 20 minutos de todos los puntos de interés, renovado y con un ambiente chill que hace que te encuentres relajado cada vez que vuelves.
Lo mejor, el equipo que siempre esta ahí para ayudarte, sobre todo añadiendo un sentimiento de confort para cada petición creando un momento WOW como lo hicieron Denzel al check in, Kima en el check out e Isaac en el desayuno (me ayudo a crear una gran experiencia para el cumpleaños de mi pareja). No pude apuntar todos los nombres pero cada persona con la que me encontraba o les pedía ayuda siempre estaban dispuestos con una sonrisa.
El departamento de Guest Experience nos consintió en todo momento, llegar a la habitación y encontrar una nota con la bienvenida junto con unos snacks hicieron que la experiencia en esta gran ciudad empezara de 10.
¡Volveremos seguro! Muchas gracias :)

title: It's okay could be a lot better
text:
The good: The location of the hotel seems alright it's in a quiet neighborhood but the area around it seems a lot dirtier than the rest of Manhattan. The room size is decent for the price I paid. The room has a window which when opened triggers the AC off. The WiFi in the hotel is decent. The room has plugs everywhere. The front staff seems nice. The mini bar is free and they stock it for you if ask so free water. 

 The bad: you get no reception in the rooms. You get no view. They send you a form to fill out when chek-ing in online, don't bother filling it out as they don't read it or care about it. The beds squeak and make noise as you move. The shower area is really tiny so if you are a little big you might not be able to get inside from the door or you might hurt yourself trying. The water pressure in the room is not that great but is decent. 
I asked for no room service for the three nights I spent at the hotel and to my surprise my request was not respected. I don't know if housekeeping is paid per room they clean or what but I don't appreciate having my things touched when I explicitly told them verbally I don't want my room serviced and had my door on do not disturb sign. I'm glad I put some of my stuff in the safe cause not sure if they stole anything. I know it's a big accusation and I am paranoid but this is why I don't like my room serviced.  What's annoying even more is that their bed sheets have stains so it's not like the housekeeping team is doing a great job either. I find it really annoying and disrespectful to my melia status that my request is not respected. Finally the room is never pitch black so if that's a problem for you when you sleep then try to stay somewhere else or ask for a darker room.

title: Nice and clean
text: I stayed here some time during the height of the pandemic, so everyone was still masking and Covid protocols were strict. This hotel was great. The room was a bit small, but CLEAN, with no excess bits and pieces anywhere. Like a laboratory. Just clean and white. The window opened which was nice. I checked out on a friday and I noticed it was much louder at night later in the week, but overall a good stay.

title: Birthday Trip
text: I couldn’t wait for my stay to be over! I had to review NOW!  Upon entering the hotel, we were greeted by Mr Denzel!, When I say I felt welcome I truly did. He was AMAZING and EXTREMELY helpful. If I were to ever visit NY again if I could be guaranteed to be greeted by Denzel! He definitely deserves his praises.  Jestin & Leslie, Denzel is the TRUTH!

title: Amazing hotel
text: An amazing find! This hotel is one of the best we have stayed in when in NY - staff are super friendly (thanks to Jestin and Dirmarys for making our stay so enjoyable), rooms are clean, mini bar refilled everyday, location is great for visiting, great gym and the hotel restaurant has phenomenal food and service. Worth 5 stars!

title: Superior service people! Wonderful place to stay when visiting Manhattan!
text:
The Innside New York NoMad is a wonderful place to stay when visiting Manhattan!
First of all, we would like to thank the staff at the Innside. Helpful and friendly people at the lobby. Caring room cleaning staff. Attentive waiters at the restaurant. The Innside team deserves to be thanked and recognized for their superior, top-quality service!

Thank you so much Christina, Jestin, Kima and Alex!
You made our stay memorable!

The hotel is ideally located to visit Manhattan: 10-minutes walk to Penn Station, 20-minute walk to Times Square. This is the place to stay if you want to live in the heart of the action!

We stayed at the Innside for 3 nights and frankly, the trip was too short. We will definitely return to the Innside on our next trip.

We booked the hotel and flight with JetBlue Vacations. JetBlue's flight was smooth and relaxing from Burlington to JFK.

We don't get paid to make comments: we are just very happy to have met such nice people and want to share it with travelers who are planning their visit in New York.

title: Un ángel en el hotel
text: El hotel Meliá INNSIDE, es un hotel bien colocado, con una parada de metro en la calle 28 (el hotel se encuentra en la 27) y desde allí puedes llegar a cualquier lugar de Manhattan en menos de 30 minutos. Pero lo mejor del hotel son sus empleados, en especial Héctor, con el cual tuve la posibilidad de conversar una noche. Tuvimos un problema con una excursión y él se desvivió, para que el día siguiente fuera más agradable, algo que consiguió. Gracias a él nuestro viaje a Nueva York fue perfecto, pues de otra manera y con tan poco tiempo de preparación (nos avisaron de la suspensión de una excursión de 15 horas, a la 01,30), no hubiera sido posible. Muchas Gracias Héctor.

title: The best hotel in Manhattan
text: The best hotel in Manhattan for sure, the locationis perfect. I can tell 1000% you feel at home .   Me and my husband going every month and after a long day we always say let's go home ..  the people working (all of them) are so nice and professional, the room are clean and perfect ... the Wilson restaurant is the best for breakfast and dinner ... but a special note to Christina who make the the difference every time we are going ... she make us feel family we are home ..  Christina is so good and dedicated to you Amazing she is the hotel by herself... the other members of reception are very good too. Christina thanxs you again for everything and your kindness, sweetness professionalism...see you soon Dominique and Alex

title: Lovely 'home' in NYC
text: lovely - have used this chain in Europe so thought we'd carry on in the US.  From reception:  absolutely charming - to the room : lovely and bright and spotlessly clean.  Location was good - we were in NY for a trip to Madison Square Garden.  the reception area / bar is really cosy, a couple of days we were out all day (mostly walking) and absolutely exhausted when we got back and the whole entrance has a lovely cosy feel - e could just flop down with a cold beer and relax.  Thank you

title: Hotel fantástico
text: El trato del personal de recepción excepcional ,la ubicación muy cómoda supermercados cerca y las atracciones también la limpieza de las habitaciones bien, la comida del restaurante buena pero cara como todo en Nueva York . Tienen cafetera en habitación y eso se agradece por las mañanas y agua todos los días volvería sin dudarlo

title: Great stay with warm and friendly staff
text:
Recently had a four night stay at this hotel.

Lovely warm welcome at check in, friendly and personable.

Room was nice and well appointed, free non-alcoholic mini bar with water and juices is a nice touch (included in resort fee)

Beds a little bit soft for us but that is personal
Preference. Daily housekeeping was good.

Shower had good pressure and easy to use.

Didn’t eat in the “Wilson” restaurant but had a few drinks there which were well made and served with a smile. Not cheap but it’s NYC so nothing is cheap.

Good location close to 7th & 27th subway station which makes it easy to get uptown to all the big city centre attractions and  hotel is near to flat iron district, Chelsea, Hudson Yards etc. 

Great stay, would recommend.

title: Great Location but Wifi took aware from experience
text: Loved the staff and the hotel. The location was great and near restaurants and the subway.  Room was a bit small but the internet was not acceptable.  I was on vacation so it was a less of an issue but if I had to work there that would have been a problem.

title: Highly recommended
text:
I had a wonderful short stay. 
The rooms are very well equipped, comfortable and very clean.
Location is great!
The hotel staff are very knowledgeable and amazing especially Jonathan and Dirmarys who helped me with some challenges that I had with a smile.

title: Hotel Review
text: I travel to NYC often, but will not stay at this hotel again. Please see my responses and comments in the survey. In summary, it was in a bad location, very noisy, had to call security because of noise at 2:00 am, towels very thin and rough, housekeeping didn't know how to properly make the bed, breakfast came in a paper bag with plasticware, restaurant staff rude and stopped serving breakfast too early at 9:45 am. This is not a 4-star hotel as it is advertised!

title: Friendly staff!! Excellent stay!! We will be back again!!
text: Very nice and comfortable hotel. Outstanding customer service from Denzel!! He made us feel at home straight away!!  Great service from Leslie and Robert!! You'll made our holiday special!! Thank you!

title: If you have a baby or a toddler please please read this
text:
I’m so sad reading the other reviews which sound amazing! Our experience was the exact opposite of everything I’ve read. We booked this hotel based on these reviews and the fact we’d always wanted to stay at a Melia hotel. My husband brought me and my 1 1/2 year old to celebrate our anniversary as a treat. He had emailed in advance to tell them this and also to ask if we could have a bath and crib for our baby. They offered this, then went silent when my husband emailed back accepting. We turned up after a long flight from London only to find out they didn’t have any record of this. Fine. The room they eventually sorted out for us had a bath plug that didn’t work, was very dirty (hairs in the bath, on the floor, literal dirt I cleaned myself to try to bathe my son, and even strange things like a toothpaste cap left by the sink). They had downgraded us at this stage due to what type of room was available- or so we were told. When another manager arrived, he told us he could move us to the original room we had booked. We were confused but went with it. This next room didn’t even HAVE a plug. By now, this was our second night. We rang down to ask for one. 2 hours later (and 2 calls later) still nothing. I had to shower my son whilst he shrieked in the end. No one ever brought one up- this is really basic. The next morning my husband and I heard the most enormous bang. The crib they had provided and assembled collapsed with my son inside it. He was caught half in and half out of the crib. I have attached photos below. We insisted on leaving shortly after this and on getting our money back. The hotel seem unaffected and not concerned by their negligence and disgustingly no one seemed the slightest bit concerned whether my son was injured or not. I am incredibly thankful he is okay but I urge anyone with younge babies and toddlers not to risk this. The shock and distress this hotel caused my family was traumatic. 

To be clear about the hotel’s response— they gave us a breakfast voucher to “go and calm down” which could have been something, had my husband not found a hair in his food, had crumbs all over the ‘clean’ napkin he was given and my son never receiving a piece of toast we asked for for him. Again, these things are so basic that it is astounding such a well know hotel can’t get them right. Lastly, my husband said very clearly he would not be willing to fit the bill for our taxi to the new hotel seeing as we’d already incurred so many costs (taxi to them, phones calls to Expedia reporting the issues etc) due to their faults not ours. The manager accepted this, went off to a meeting and then denied what had been agreed so the lady at reception attempted to make us pay for the taxi! Our son had just fallen through one of their collapsed cribs! They still have yet to even reply to my husbands complaint which was sent to them and their CEO over 4 days ago now. We moved to the LUMA hotel which was wonderful. They were horrified at what had happened to us and could not do enough for us. I have yet to tell one person this who hasn’t been completely horrified. I will not ever stay here again for fear of my son being unsafe and having a ‘one problem after another’ kind of stay.

title: I LOVE THIS HOTEL!
text: I love this hotel!  The room was perfect for me traveling solo.  The staff was helpful, friendly, and efficient.  Shout out to Liz, Dirmarys, Akhlima, Leslie, and Kit. The rooms were chic and very clean, with an excellent closet design for easy unpacking.  The bed was comfortable.  The bathroom was large, clean, well designed and very attractive.  Great shower.  As a woman traveling solo in Manhattan, I felt very safe in the neighborhood and especially in the hotel--you need your key card to go up to the rooms.  I loved my stay here and highly recommend!

title: 5 stars!
text: Excellent location, super clean and the staff is fantastic. Thank you to Dirmarys who was especially helpful and an absolute pleasure! I come into NYC twice a month and this has become my goto hotel.

title: Five star front desk service.
text: Best customer service hands down! Dismarys went above and beyond to accommodate our stay. Great attitude, professional. She was able to book us in a double bed for the remainder of our stay. Rooms are a bit small though.

title: Great place to stay
text: We really enjoyed our stay. The front desk staff, Jose and Hector, were helpful and definitely went the extra mile to ensure our stay started out right. The room was clean, bright and functional. We will be back!

title: Gracias!....volveremos pronto
text: Excelente experiencia y agradecemos la atención de excelencia de Leslie y Christina, nos apoyaron en todo en nuestra visita, muy buenas anfitrionas...Melia muy buen hotel a pasos de todo...un cordial saludo desde Chile, Claudio, Maximiliano, Martin y Andrea

title: Awesome Experience at the INNSiDE NY Nomad!!
text: Will definitely return to INNSiDE NY Nomad. I was a bit nervous about the parking situation. It was raining. I called the front desk from my car they sent someone outside to help me with my luggage. the young man explained there is street parking you just need to read the signs carefully as there are a lot of restrictions. I found street parking. Was very excited! Didnt have to spend $$ on a parking lot. The front desk employees Jestin & Leslie were very welcoming & helpful. Checked me in quckly, were very informative & super friendly. Made my reservation at The Wilson for brunch the next day. The staff were always cheerful. The room was very clean and comfy! Another great feature the drinks in the fridge in the room were complimentary (at no charge!) They had water and GuS adult soda.  I highly recommend this place!

title: Would def recommend
text: Great vibe, comfortable, clean, nice rooms, restaurant and bar area. Held our bags for us before and after checkout. Front desk great quick service and friendly. No complaints at all! Nice stay for a nice price.

title: amazing staff
text: Me and my boyfriend were blown away by the concierge Leslie, Jestin and Jon. They were so attentive and went out of their way for us on multiple occasions. We now made this hotel our NYC go to solely because of these people who made our trip amazing! Also love the free water

title: Nice and pleasant stay
text:
Staff are very well trained and helpful,  which are not ordinary these days. 
Check out is 12 and we took full advantage of it. Close to subway stations. Room has slippers and bath robes both are very comfortable l.

title: Perfect in every way
text: Me and my dad stopped at this hotel for 4 nights - everything was perfect. The rooms were spotlessly clean and had everything we needed. Also my dad doesn’t like going in elevators and as soon as we mentioned this we were put on the first floor so we could use the stairs - this made the holiday stress fee for us. If we ever came back to New York we would definitely stay here again and I would have no hesitation in recommending it to others.

title: Thanks to Mr. Jose Francisco Torres
text:
מלון נהדר, צוות אדיב ביותר. במיוחד 
Mr. Jose Francisco TOrres , front desk manager. He was so humble & kind, 
 and he gave us personable  and unique service.
המלוןנמצא בסוהו , הצוות שירותי ומאיר פנים והחלטנו משום כך להאריך את השהיה בו

title: Wonderful stay
text: My wife and I went for a weekend anniversary trip and this hotel was perfect.  Very clean, wonderful location and excellent staff.  I was concerned that the rooms would be small or have other issues but I was pleased to find the rooms had very good size and they were very clean. I would rate a 9.2

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
I have stayed here twice now for business. The staff is always sweet, well-dressed, and very accommodating. Each time, it feels like they are giving me special treatment (but I think that's just how they operate). 
This last trip, Denzel was especially helpful in getting me checked-in and set up for my stay. I felt truly taken care of. Denzel was so caring and genuine! Such a level of professionalism, style, and care here.

title: How to make it right!
text:
The team here is superior!
After a misunderstanding with the room & my beverage delivery, the team including the Director of rooms, extended themselves to the maximum to correct my stay! They were extremely gracious while listening to my issues and make the adjustments to quickly. I was impressed and very grateful Thank you INNSIDE team you are stellar!

title: Great for weekend getaway.
text:
Thank you to Jestin, Kima and Dirmurys. We had an amazing stay and always felt welcomed and taken care of. 

We had a 2 double-bed room, and the 3 of us never felt cramped. The room was clean and beds were comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and the shower was huge. We even had a little sitting area where we promptly used to place our snacks. We did not have any issues and could not hear our neighbours (important for people who are light sleepers.) There were welcome waters and drinks for us in the room when we arrived. (Water is also free at the front desk any time you need.) The hotel itself is very conveniently located — we were able to walk everywhere, pick up breakfast or go for dinners, it was a short walk to the subway, and pick up/drop offs for uber and taxis were very easy.

title: Quick trip to NYC
text: Staff were great, location was great, facilities spacious -we had two rooms and both were stellar . The one thing to improve would have been the speed of room service, but once it did arrive the fools was delicious!

title: Great Hotel in a Great Location, Especially If You Like Transit and Urban Living
text:
I spent four nights at Innside during a visit to reconnect with old friends and colleagues all over the NYC metro area. It was the perfect "base camp" for a trip like this. Innside is modern, well-designed and well-run. Its location near Penn Station and several subway stops made it ideal for someone who prefers to get around NYC without a car or taxi.

My room was small - it's New York city, after all - but very clean, functional and suitably furnished. It did not face the street, so it was extremely quiet, like sleeping in a womb. The HVAC worked great and I didn't need it at night, contributing to the quiet. The room also lacked the bright, often flashing LEDs that are a real pain in other places. The bathroom featured a shower (no tub), basic toiletries and great lighting. Just large enough to feel comfortable. The internet connected quickly as was reliable throughout. I never turned on the TV, so I can't evaluate it.

Innside has a nice fitness room on the top floor that looks out on the Empire State Building, an inspirational view while working out. There is also a decent restaurant on the ground floor, but if that doesn't suit you there are multiple other restaurants offering a wide variety of cuisine types and price points nearby. There are also many retail establishments nearby, include groceries and pharmacies. In short, when you stay there you feel like you could live in that neighborhood comfortably.

The staff was friendly and helpful, especially Jestin X, who helped me get a burnt-out lightbulb quickly fixed and also delivered a quick check-out while getting me a cab. I appreciate that the hotel allowed my to decline daily housekeeping, as I was in and out of the room at odd times throughout the day and didn't want to run into a housekeeper.

My only recommendation for Innside would be to improve its "green" features. There was no visible recycling infrastructure in the room or other suggestions on how to minimize waste and save energy and water while staying at the hotel. I was also surprised to find complimentary containers of drinking water in the room. New York has some of the best quality tap water in the world, so when a hotel puts containerized water in the room it suggests that the staff don't know what the water situation is and are actually dissing their own city's water system. I used tap water exclusively and it was fine.

Some of my friends thought it odd that I would choose a hotel near Penn Station. They thought the neighborhood was bad. The neighborhood is fine! It's walkable and convenient no matter which direction you want to head. I was out walking at various times between dawn and midnight, and always felt safe. If you're comfortable in an urban setting you will love it here. I know I did, and I'll come back the next time I'm in NYC.

title: Excellent hotel and Front Desk Team
text: This hotel is gorgeous and the service is top notch. My husband and I arrived to celebrate my birthday. Leslie and Jon welcomed us and were so nice and helpful. They gave us a bottle wine and started the birthday celebration off right. We look forward to staying at this hotel whenever we are back in NY. Thanks again!

title: Place to stay midtown Manhattan
text: If you are staying Midtown Manhattan this was a great location. Front counter staff Miguel and Dirmarys were excellent, friendly and extremely helpful with our late evening arrival. Rooms are well appointed, modern, great storage space and bigger than expected . 1 block from Subway line 1. 7 blocks Penn Station. Walking distance Madison Square Garden.

title: Nice hotel. Very amenable
text:
Stayed here recently with our 11 month old baby, they were very good in providing us with a cot for him, a normal kettle for his bottles and a bucket so we could sterilise for him.

Rooms were comfortable and spacious for a NY hotel room, comfortable bed and bedding as well. 

Location good too, a lot of cafes and restaurants around. Times Square around a 20 minute walk away or 8 mins by public transport.

The only downside is that the bathroom has a frosted screen into the room which means if you’re sharing the room that person clearly see how and where you shower 😜 so not very private

title: The best staff and most comfortable stay I've had in NYC!
text:
I have been traveling to NYC for 20 plus years. This is by far the best hotel experience! The staff goes over and above! We had issues with our travel plans. Our luggage went to JFK and we landed inLaGuardia.  Christina at the front desk coordinated with their car service, Roger at Luxe, to pick us up then take us to pick up luggage and then to the hotel. All of this as we were in the airport! Every staff member greets you with a smile and asks what they can do for you.  We also had special care with Denzel, Duran and Justin. The room is clean and comfortable with a mini fridge. Any room issues we had where taken care of within 15 minutes. Boxed water and natural soda refilled ever day, no charge.  Location is prefect! If you have friends or business visiting, there is a nice lounge to chill in. The attached restaurant was delicious too. 
I love this city but know that hotel staff can be short tempered. You will not experience this at Innside. I am seriously so impressed. This stay made our visit so wonderful! It was freezing and raining for our trip and coming back to this hotel was so reviving and comforting. Thank you all so much! 
Also, highly recommend using their car service Luxe. The fee is comparable to Uber but instead you will be in a luxury sedan waiting for you at the curb! So worth it!
Anyone that comments about small rooms or bad views does not know this city. Innside rooms are perfect size and larger than normal in the city.

title: Great location and fabulous staff
text: We came in from a late flight and we’re greeted by Miguel and Dirmarys. We had a hiccup with the booking which they swiftly rectified. Cannot overstate the professionalism and courtesy we received. The hotel itself has decent sized rooms with actual storage (fantastic for New York) and modern bathroom. It was clean with comfy beds and long pillows (great for hugging). We were a short distance from subway stations and walking distance to a lot of tourist spots. They offer free rental for push bikes here as well but we didn’t take them up on it, although we saw other guests take advantage of them. Overall loved the location of this hotel and definitely would recommend it.

title: A Fabulous Hotel in Manhattan
text:
My son and I have made it a yearly tradition to attend the Big East Tournament (college basketball) at Madison Square Garden, and we couldn't speak more highly of our stay at INNSiDE on 27th Street.  Yes, the location is awesome--situated just a few blocks south of the Garden and a quick subway ride to Times Square, the Broadway District and Central Park to the north.  Of course, to the south, is the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, the Financial District and the very poignant 9/11 Memorial.  You're close to a lot of landmarks.  But the hotel offers a quaint, quiet, comfortable and completely customer-focused experience while staying there.  Jestin, Leslie, Christina, and the great crew at the front desk are warm and welcoming, and always provide great recommendations on things to do or places to eat.  I honestly didn't hear a single door shut, or close, or any noise from an adjoining room or the hallway in four nights of staying there.  It's that quiet and such a nice getaway.  The cleaning crew respects guest privacy and makes sure the room is completely turned over, with fresh towels and made beds once we returned from exploring the city.   The exercise room is nice (and open for 15 of 24 hours) and the views of the city (our room faced the south, with the new World Trade Center building in the distance) are exquisite. 

Honestly, the only disappointment was heading down the elevator for the final time, knowing we were leaving.  It's a great place and I'll absolutely stay here again next time.  To the great team at INNSiDE on 27th--well done!

title: INNSide
text: The upsale at check-in for $35 a night is a ripoff and not explained well.  The visit did not start well and I was wary of the hotel from that point on.  Otherwise, it is an average hotel for this price range.  it is clean and the bed was comfortable

title: Long Weekend Trip from UK
text: A centrally located hotel within easy walking distance of many sites (Times Square, Empire State, Penn Station, Fifth Avenue) with good facilities, including bar/restaurant, gym. Room was comfortable with a good shower facilities.

title: INNSIDE Melia New York Nomad
text: A really super hotel close to Madison Square Garden and the Chelsea area. The rooms are modern, clean and well taken care of . A solid value for New York City by comparison to other hotels. The attentiveness of Christina,  Liz and Kima made our stay enjoyable. Will definitely return.

title: Honeymoon in NYC
text: We stayed at the Innside by Melina for 6 days and it was the best stay! Upon check in the front desk staff was amazing! Our entire stay they checked in on us and asked if we needed anything! The hotel is located in the heart of Manhattan which is amazing for all exploring and shopping. We were in walking distance of everything we wanted to do. It was a super spacious room for New York! The staff provided information on the BEST restaurants. We had breakfast at the Wilson located in the hotel one morning and it was phenomenal. We had the best trip thanks to all of the employees at the Innside by Melina and would absolutely stay with them again!

title: Great Way to Enjoy New York
text: Great location…easy to get taxis, or just walk to many New York City experiences. The rooms were very comfortable, with all the expected necessities. We were greeted by a very friendly staff each time we entered or left the lobby.  In particular I would single out Christina, Jestin and Kima for their appropriate and helpful suggestions and answers to our questions.

title: Estancia espectacular
text: Decidimos pasar nuestra estancia en este magnífico hotel y ha sido un total acierto! Es un hotel con encanto por todos los rincones. Nos dieron una habitación amplia con vistas a la ciudad y una botella de cava con chocolatinas y una tarjeta de felicitación de cumpleaños (todo un detallazo). La cafetera nespresso y el minibar son gratis (lo reponen todos los días). Los recepcionistas son TODOS encantadores en especial Chistina, Kima y Yohanny que nos ayudaron a resolver un problema con nuestra Metrocard y fueron de gran ayuda! Tienen bicicletas que te prestan también gratis para recorrer la ciudad. La limpieza es de 10, todos los días a parte de la chica de housekeeping, revisan las habitaciones para que estén perfectas. El wellness center en la última planta también está incluido. Ubicación perfecta. Si repetimos de ciudad ya sabemos a dónde ir!

title: Great hotel in a great location!
text: We really loved this hotel. Room was comfortable  and surprisingly quiet. All the staff we interacted with were fabulous and always helpful! We made use of the water and drinks provided as part of hotel fee. The location was walking distance both Chelsea and Flatiron but also super close to lots of different subway stations. I would definitely stay again and recommend to others.

title: Tracy’s Review
text: Each time I’ve enjoyed my stay. The staff is friendly, caring, supportive and professional.. The room are clean, nice layout. The location has been perfect, great walking distance to my business meetings. You should try it out!

title: Amazing!
text:
What an interesting, quirky location!! From check in, with the happy polite Leslie and Jestin to the check out with Jon and Jestin,this stay was top class..  All staff were so polite and helpful couldn’t do any more for us, always greeted with smiles.
Our rooms were pristine and fresh with a great vibe throughout the hotel. 
Would highly recommend Innside as its very central and most places are walking distance!
Thanks for everything 
Tammy ✌️❤️🇺🇸

title: Good relaxing stay
text:
I had a very good and relaxing stay, it was nice to have water, coffee and sodas free of charge during my stay.
The room was comfy and clean.
The location of the hotel is very good, close to all amenities

title: Really great!!
text: Easy check in with a complimentary bottle of wine. Most amazing bed and pillows. Room was clean and was given plenty of towels. Friendly staff and great environment. Perfect location. Would absolutely stay here again.

title: Great hotel
text: Great location and great service!  Jestin was very friendly and helpful at the front desk.  Room was clean and comfortable, and the hotel bar is nice.  The location was an easy walk to good restaurants, bars and many sights.

title: Excellent Hotel in convenient location!
text: This is a lovely hotel, rooms are very clean, location is perfect and the staff is just awesome! Jestin and Kima made sure we were welcomed, Jestin provided us with excellent night-life options which were close to the hotel. Look no further, stay here!

title: Good vibes and fun time!
text: Shoutout to Leslie, Miguel, and Denzel for making check-in and my overall experience really smooth, they added just that much more to my birthday weekend! Everyone was friendly and accommodating, the room and hotel were nicely decorated (extra perk were a few cute photo opps), and the location made it easy to get around to most places in lower Manhattan and find things to do.

title: Best!
text: The stuff is super friendly and positive. Loved the location, the size of the room, the cleaning level. The location is good, it’s very close to the subway, and super close to the main places to visit.

title: Best staff team ever!
text: Fantastic staff, always super helpful. Special mention to Jestin, Kit and Miguel who go are incredibly friendly and go out of their way make a stay here stress free and a home from home! Excellent location and the rooms are kept incredibly clean and tidy. Totally recommend!

title: One of the most breathtaking views in Manhattan!
text: From the entrance hospitality to the cleanliness of the Innside of the hotel. (No pun intended lol) Kima and Jestin made us feel like we were royalty! What a great place to get away but also be right in the thick of NYC!

title: Very satisfied
text:
We are very satisfied we chose this package. 
First, the location. It’s located in mid manhattan. For a first timer its very accessible to stay here coz u’l be in the middle to places in manhattan. The hotel is close to empire building and Time square. I honestly prefer this area coz its not as loud and as crowded/touristy than staying close to the Time Square. 
2nd- The hotel is close to a subway. It’ll save you some steps from the hotel to the subway especially if it's freezingly cold or toasty during the summer (i bet). 
3rd- has a restaurant inside the hotel and it has a nespresso machine inside your room which sold me and my hubby. 
4th- the hotel is more modern than the other ones we saw that costco offers but room is just smaller. 
5th- staffs are very friendly and helps you with directions. And did I mentioned unlimited water and soda inside your room. 
So overall, we had an amazing experience. We will definitely come back and will still choose the package.

title: LOVE THIS HOTEL!!
text: This hotel is one of my favorites in the city. It's clean, spacious, centrally located and has great service. For a NYC hotel it has everything I could need and then some. The staff is always kind and on the ball and I've stayed there multiple times. I can't recommend this hotel enough if you're looking for a great place to stay with family or friends in the city.

title: Fantastically Lovely Hotel
text: A very attentive and knowledgable staff, well appointed and nicely put-together room with a city view, and a general hip, yet welcoming-to-all vibe made this an excellent stay. Great for a simply pleasure trip, business trip, or small family! Pets welcome throughout the hotel is an added plus. I will return next visit with mine ;)

title: Great Spot in Chelsea
text: Excellent service, accomodated our eary check in and facilitated an early departure time.  We used the Subway to get uptown and downtown and this was a great spot to get everywhere.  Very walkable area for food, drink and tourism.

title: Great Location
text:
Excellent staff, great location with easy subway access. Clean room, complimentary in room beverages, comfy bed. Restaurant and bar area was loud and lively on Friday night. Not a negative but was unexpected, and immediately evident as soon as the elevator door opened. I didn't eat or drink at either and was just passing through the lobby around 7pm. Returned a little past midnight to a quiet lobby.
This was my second stay at a Melia hotel and both have been outstanding. I'll seek out again on future travel.

title: Great Weekend Getaway
text: My boyfriend and I had a great weekend at the Innside by Melia hotel in NYC. Denzel was very professional and welcoming when we arrived. He checked us in and ensured that we were well taken care of from start to finish. Denzel gave great tourist recommendations to visit the The Summit at Vanderbilt, we had an amazing experience there. Also, Hector was very nice to me as well, and assisted me with warming my food up at night. This was a great stay, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone  planning to come stay in NYC. 😊

title: Perfect hotel for me
text: Loved this hotel. Small room but it works for me.  Very nice people, nice entry,  nice room.  Great bartender, (Ezra) Love the room with the Nespresso coffee machine for the mornings, and bottled water along with natural sodas waiting for me when I arrive, and no extra charge! I would suggest this hotel to anyone.

title: Very good experience
text: Everything was great. The location is excellent and the hotel is in very good conditions. Christina at the front desk was amazing and helped us with everything we needed. Would definitely stay here again.

title: Awesome experience
text: My fiancé came to New York for my 30th bday and was very satisfied with the hotel! The staff was incredible, the rooms were beautiful and the location was awesome! Super easy to get around. My only minor complaint is the bed wasn’t overly comfy!

title: Denzel is gold!
text: I’m so glad I took a random drive to NYC and stayed at the INNSiDE. The place is well-decorated- clean, and bright. Everyone was extremely pleasant, most especially DENZEL at the front desk and RUBEN at the bar. Thank you ❤️

title: Amazing service! Extremely clean! Friendly staff!
text: Incredible! We stayed for 6 nights and the entire experience was incredible from start to finish! The front desk and cleaning staff are phenomenal! Special shout out to Denzel and Jose for their excellent and quick service when we got stranded for an extra day. I will be choosing this hotel for my next round of travel!

title: 5 stars for customer service
text:
Just returned from a 5 night stay and I can’t recommend this hotel enough. The staff couldn’t do enough to make our stay memorable, special thanks especially to Miguel but everyone went above and beyond to provide an excellent level of service. 
The hotel is well located in Midtown/Chelsea for sightseeing across Manhattan. Very clean with the most comfortable beds (which are a must after walking approx 13 miles a day). 
I’m a fan of the Meliá hotel brand and this one did not disappoint.

The Wilson bar and restaurant attached to the hotel had a good buzz about it. We stopped for a couple of drinks one evening but didn’t actually eat in the restaurant. However, we did get room service one evening and the fish tacos were excellent!

title: Amazing front desk staff
text:
I loved this place clean. Nice location, but the staff at the front desk is the best customer service experience I’ve had in a while. 
I will go back because of this . Also, the restaurant, the amenities and again ; the staff!

title: The Staff is PHENOMENAL
text:
I recently stayed here with my boyfriend. It was my first time in the city, and this was a WONDERFUL introduction! The staff, Justin, Kit, and Leslie were very kind and extremely accommodating each morning. Justin helped us get a room with a beautiful view of the city. The room was big and clean, and we were very close to the activities we had planned.
The friendliness of the staff made me feel comfortable during my first trip to the city. I can’t recommend highly enough!

title: Honestly one of the best hotels in New York
text:
I’ve stayed at a handful of places in the city & have never felt the need to leave a review till now. 

Jestin, Leslie & Kit were all very helpful. My reservation came with breakfast that had they not reminded me of, I would’ve completely missed. They were all very attentive to my needs & helped me with every question I had. They really made my stay at the hotel feel like I was staying at a friends house. The room was very nice too, much cleaner than any other hotel I’ve stayed at in the city.

title: Stay Here!
