Although it was on the street side it was quiet as the floor-to-ceiling windows were well insulated. The staff were friendly and helpful. 27th street is well located a short walk from a subway station (and a big Whole Foods store!) and there is an attractive restaurant at ground level. We hadn't heard of this hotel but got it through a consolidator and are glad we found it! We would definitely stay here again!

title: 2 Weeks at Nomad
text:
I was a little nervous about staying here because it was thousands of dollars cheaper than surrounding hotels. We were staying in NY for two weeks for a camp and I needed someplace close and not ridiculously expensive. I always figured we could change hotels if we weren’t happy.
But when we pulled up there were people outside eating at the restaurant and others sitting at seats on the outside patio reading or relaxing.
The front desk staff were super nice and welcoming. I wish I could remember their names but it may not matter because they were all nice every day. Just super helpful and accommodating . From holding a box that needed to be mailed to asking for an extra key-they made it super easy.
The room is small for sure but it’s clean and has all you need for a stay in New York. We were hardly hanging out in there anyway.
The hotel also has a beautiful “roses inspired”outside patio with a swing and lots of colorful umbrellas as a roof and trendy elevators (haha) with an  artsy map of NY inside.
Great gym that wasn’t used much but had everything we needed for a workout.
Convenient location near vegan restaurants and quick walks to Times Square and 34th street shops.
The housekeeping offered us free extra waters and sodas and towels when we needed it and left us alone when we didn’t. 
I haven’t written a review in a long time but felt that this hotel needed a shout out because they were absolutely amazing. From the weekend DJ to the guy sweeping the outside patio. All of you are incredible.

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
Great hotel - there were some very minor hiccups (room type was different than booked) but the hotel went above and beyond to fix the issue and left us very satisfied customers, great stay and no other issues at all.

Rooms have excellent views, fast elevators, close to everything you would want in the city.  Would stay again.

title: Vacaciones
text:
Un bonito y cómodo hotel, en pleno Chelsea! 
Los trabajadores del hotel muy amables y serviciales, sobretodo, Leslie, la Recepcionista más simpática y trabajadora que hemos encontrado! Gran fichaje por parte del hotel. 
Nos hemos sentido como en casa.

title: Family trip with young kids
text:
The service of the hotel was excellent. Kit the receptionist made our check in and check out experience seamless. We arrived on an overnight flight with exhausted kids and was allowed early 10 am check in without any fee.

The location was excellent with nearby access to multiple subway line. It was also near to Penn Station about 10 mins walk to a trip to Flushing was made easier. Being 5 blocks away from K-Town made late supper easy too.

They also had a nice outdoor area to hang out which was useful for us to have a late night dessert. Right at the back they have the Rose Garden which a nice Instagram spot.

There was one night the maintenance staff double check if our room was serviced. Not sure if there was a problem in other room but we had no issues. Appreciate them making sure all was good.

title: Lindo pero podría ser mejor
text: Es una buena opción de alojamiento. Destaco que es moderno, bien mantenido y sus camas son cómodas. Está a unas cuadras del time square y es bastante silencioso. El desayuno no es buffet y es a la carta con un crédito que te dan para gastar, por eso no usé esta opción. Las habitaciones son bien pequeñas como en todo Nueva York, pero dentro de todo con cómodas. La atención de la recepción muy buena. En el caso del registro y a la salida del hotel, no tuve la suerte de toparme con personal que hablara español, algo que supuse como lógico en una cadena española.

title: Hotel perfecto para visitar NY
text:
Muy buena situación, cuando llegamos a recepción nos atendió Leslie en español y fue nuestra salvación porque hasta entonces nuestro viaje había sido malo en avión y con problemas con la agencia de viajes. Nos dio una habitación con buenas vistas y un detalle del hotel para honeymooners. El trato fue muy acogedor y profesional.
Allí mismo quedamos también con Jorge Marte que nos quería ofrecer una promoción de Meliá, el trato fue excelente, muy cercano. familiar y profesional. Les agradezco a todo el equipo del hotel Innside NY Nomad el buen trato recibido, en especial a Leslie Muñoz y Jorge Marte porque el trato con ellos, al ser en español fue a la vez más familiar y cercano. GRACIAS!!!

title: Clean• Modern• Good Value & Location
text:
Modern fresh hotel with lovely sweet staff! Front desk crew of Jestin, Maggie & Leslie were so friendly and accommodating. So friendly is not always an adjective for people working in NYC, but they were great! Even the engineer that came up to help with a safe problem was so kind and helpful. 

When booking hotels it is important to have realistic expectations. I stayed at the plaza a couple of months ago. This is not the plaza. It was also probably 10 x less money! 

The hotel is clean, modern, bright and fresh. Elevators are fast and efficient. We had a room on the 20th floor with a view of the city across from a very nice gym. 

Be forewarned… THE ROOMS ARE SMALL! 
NYC real estate is expensive. Hotel rooms can be oddly small. They have done a good job with limited space. The room had builtins a tiny desk and chair. Closet cabinet and we had a king size bed. This was perfectly fine. The bathroom is reminiscent of an airplane bathroom with a shower. Perhaps a little bigger, but not much. I prefer more space, but we made it work! The shower had good water pressure, the bathroom had good lighting. The toilet flushed with plenty of water. All good things. 

Location can not be beat. Super close to so much! Close to train station and Hudson Yards and so much more. Easy to get an Uber within minutes. Right by FIT. 

They have places to eat and drink inside that looked great. We did not have the opportunity to eat there, but totally would have. They also have 12pm checkout which is perfect! 

The pandemic changed so much and the city is not as it use to be.  So many hotels have become dated, dark and just unappealing. We drove by a similar priced hotel up the street and the plants outside were dead and scraggly. Not welcoming. When we went outside our hotel to pick up a car, there was a man literally scraping something off the sidewalk to make it clean. I was impressed. 

As a Melia rewards member I was treated so well and saw my room assignment on the app before I even got there.  

Hotel was a good value with lovely staff clean little rooms with good air conditioning and water pressure. Don’t think twice. Stay here. You won’t be sorry. 

And if you need bottled water or bandaids, just ask those nice people at the front desk. They will take care of you!!

title: Great week at Innside NoMad NY
text: We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The staff members were really friendly and eager to help. We requested a bigger room as the closet wasn't big enough for four people and we were given a connected room with double comfort and amenities the next morning.The  beds couldn't be better!! The staff at the restaurant were very nice too. The hotel is well located, near a subway station and important landmarks in the midtown. I highly recommend it to anyone going to NY!!

title: Decepcionada
text:
Viendo la página del hotel en Internet, pensé que como decían era de categoría 4 estrellas. Ya sé que la hostelería no es igual en todos sitios, pero siendo de la cadena Meliá, creí que el hotel estaría mucho mejor. Vamos que la publicidad de la página es engañosa, te esperas una cosa que luego no es.
Viajamos cinco amigas, por lo que la reserva eran dos habitaciones dobles, en uno de las cuales se hospedarían tres personas. No es la primera vez que viajo a Estados Unidos, sé que aquí no existen las habitaciones triples, y que hay que compartir cama, pero siempre ha sido de tamaño king size. En este hotel la cama no llega a 135 cm, será se 120 o poco más por lo que resulta pequeña para dos personas grandes.
Nada más llegar nos dijeron que el agua estaba incluida, pero nunca la ponían, todos los día s teníamos que pedirla. También teníamos que recordar que al ser tres personas, tenían que poner toallas para tres. Así mismo, si se acababa el papel higiénico teníamos que volver a pedirlo. El servicio de habitaciones es pésimo, si a esto unimos además, una limpieza bastante deficiente.
Ni la habitación, ni el cuarto de baño tienen categoría de 4 estrellas. El baño es muy pequeño. 
La habitación tampoco es cómoda. Hay por espacio sobre todo teniendo en cuenta que éramos tres personas. No se podía apagar la luz desde la cama, se apagaba en el pasillo de entrada y luego a oscuras hasta la cama. 
La ubicación no está mal, ni tampoco las zonas comunes.
Otra cosa que no nos gustó, es que, aunque ya sabíamos que teníamos que pagar un impuesto turístico de unos 40$ por habitación y noche, retenían el dinero de la tarjeta a su gusto, y sin orden ni concierto, aludiendo que era para saber si había dinero en la cuenta, y habiendo retenido el primer día 100$ de fianza, por si acaso.
En definitiva, no recomendaría este hotel, ni por servicio, ni por limpieza.

title: Hotel correcto y bien situado
text:
Valorando la estancia puedo poner buena nota,el hotel bien situado, moderno y tranquilo.Las habitaciones correctas y limpias para 4 personas bien,las camas muy cómodas.De todas maneras no parece un Melia le faltan pequeños detalles ya que pagas aproximadamente unos 40 dólares extras como el WiFi,servicio de minibar en este caso cada día tuvimos que reclamar en recepción las aguas. El personal excelente con el trato.

Cenamos un dia en el restaurante y a parte de caro la pasta estaba fría y nos tuvieron que recalentar.  De todas maneras muy recomendable cuando visitas New York.

title: Buena ubicación y buen trato
text: Nuestra experiencia fue muy buena. El hotel estaba bien situado, podías ir andando a casi cualquier sitio y estabas alejado del centro para poder estar más tranquilo. La amabilidad de todos los empleados fue excepcional. Sitio recomendado y para repetir cuando volvamos.

title: Uno de los mejores hoteles Melia, para turismo en familia y grupos.
text:
Estuve con mi familia alojados por 1 semana del 4 al 10 de julio, mi esposa y yo somos socios Circle Melia Red e invitamos a mis hermanos con sus familias y sin duda valió la pena: 

El hotel se encuentra muy bien ubicado, a 1 cuadra de la estación del metro 28th st línea 1, y a 3 cuadras de la parada de Bus Madison 27st norte M1-M2-M3. La mejor opción es comprar la metrocard ilimitada de 1 semana, para el plan de recorrer la ciudad.

El personal del frontdesk hotel es extremadamente amable y cordial, ademas de ser hábiles para resolver los inconvenientes que surgieron, especialmente mención para Leslie Munoz, Miguel Candelario y Maggie, todos con el mejor manejo hacia huéspedes, el tipo de empleados con los que los socios Melia nos encanta toparnos.

El hotel cuenta con una espectacular terraza en patio interior [Rose Garden], ideal para grupos de familia y amigos. El único punto a mejorar es que está desatendida por los meseros del Bar, y es necesario caminar para poder pedir cualquier bebida o alimento. El restaurante también tiene una terraza externa, muy cómoda y bien decorada con detalles orgánicos de inmejorable frescura en ambiente, con excelente atención (de ese lado del Wilson).

Un aspecto a cuidar es la estrategia del cobro del Facilities fee de 35USD/noche, porque no se percibe su valor real: en la habitacion no se comunica correctamente qué incluye, con qué frecuencia, y a qué da derecho. Es un micro cobro que desmejorado la percepción en la experiencia de Usuario. Para mi caso no representó problema alguno al ser socio Circle Red, y el correcto manejo por parte del Manager a cargo.

Innside Nomad es el mejor hotel que cualquier familia puede elegir para su plan de turismo en New York, 100% recomendado.

title: 5 night stay in Manhattan
text: Location, ambience, amicable reception and housekeeping staff particularly Justin, Keanu, Christina, Kit. No niggling issues with lifts, bathroom facilities or response to requests. Patio/ Rose area great additions

title: Superb Service for honeymoon disaster
text: We were on the last leg of our honeymoon trip from across the pond. We flew into JFK from Miami international and American Airlines lost our luggage. With nothing but the clothes on our back Jestin and Maggie really helped us out. We had the room booked for 4 nights and once our bags came they put them straight into our room and even gave us a complimentary bottle of wine to say sorry for something that wasn't even their fault! they went above and beyond the room was cleaned every day to such a good standard. even when out flight home was cancelled we managed to book the room again for another night stress free and our bags and valuables were locked after all day until our flight was ready. Again thank you to Jestin and Maggie you were super stars!!

title: Excelente experiencia
text: Muy buen trato por parte de Christina  y su equipo, siempre  atenta a lo que necesitáramos. El hotel en un  lugar muy bien situado. Muchas partes para conocer caminado  . Hotel alejado del ruido . habitaciones de buen tamaño

title: Treasured Gem in the Big Apple!
text: Crisp, clean, fresh and a sense of positive energy is felt from the moment you arrive.  I confess..I booked this hotel because it is very close to where my sister just relocated in Cheslea area of NYC.  WHAT A LOVELY SURPRISE to arrive and be greeted by Kima at the front desk and her welcoming spirit and bright smile. Her smile and good energy was consistent throughout our stay and saw her always go the extra step to accommodate guests. This boutique hotel has a nice vibe and fresh feel that is apparent upon arrival.  The location is hard to beat as there is easy access to all the "must sees" of NYC.  We will be back ....want to also give honorable mention to Maggie and Christine too on check out day as they were there with Kima managing a large check out.  So excited to discover this Beautiful Gem of a hotel.

title: Great Over the Years
text:
Stayed here many times pre-covid and was always pleased. Finally got a chance to come back this week. Same great experience and stay as always. I think they improved the shower with the addition of thick shower doors. I believe this was an addition.
I love the free mini bar refreshments and the room design makes such great use of the space. Bed is comfy. 
Front desk service was good and my coffee to go experience with two different people, two days was just great. 
Great location and best part is that street is so  quiet! 
You won’t regret staying here.

title: Excelente estancia
text: El hotel está muy bien ubicado, hay estación de metro cercana y caminando puedes llegar a Times Square. La comida de su restaurante es rica, tienen muy buen servicio y las habitaciones son muy cómodas. Tuvimos una estancia muy agradable, si regresaríamos. Una felicitación muy especial para el Sr Ramón en el restaurante (cena), quien siempre estuvo muy atento y al pendiente de nosotros.

title: Wonderful location for this boutique hotel with quick access to all the sites of Manhattan.
text: Jestin, Christina, and Maggie were outstanding ambassadors for the hotel and New York.  Excellent, friendly and professional service made this trip all the more memorable.  They went above and beyond with every request, question and greeting.  We loved our stay in the heart of Manhattan and will choose the Innside New York NoMad for our next visit to New York!

title: Fabulous, Memorable Stay!
text: Everyday of my stay I enjoyed the hotel more and more. Service was great! Shout out to Christina,  Leslie, Kine and Kit at the front desk! Hotel food was delicious, rooms were exactly what I needed and the bar / restaurant was so much fun! I just expected to spend a few nights in NYC for business and got so much more -  a comfortable stay, great food and a chill evening out with friends/coworkers at the The Wilson. I couldn’t ask for more. I will definitely be back!

title: Excellent central location
text:
Visited this summer with family for a five night stay. Central location close to Times Square (20 mins walk) and Empire State ( 10 min walk) Great rooms with city view. 

A couple of points:
One arrival we were asked for a $40 per night supplement for each room (facilities charge) challenged and charge was wavered 🤙

Also the room we were allocated was not a city view (as paid for) again this was sorted with no problem for the next day🤙

Big shout out for Kit on reception who ensured all issues were sorted without exceptional, top man🤙

title: Excellent customer service.. great for families.
text: Jestin and Leslie were amazing. Helped us with questions about the area and accommodated us when we needed help with the kids.the hotel is clean and spacious with a great patio in the back.  Definitely coming  back !!

title: What an amazing facility and crew
text:
My family and I stayed at the Innside new york nomad.
The hotel was super clean and very new looking 
Leslie, Jestin, and Kit were outstanding, any questions we had they were quick to help and made sure we knew our way around with cool tips for traveling around NYC. 
These 3 went above and beyond to ensure we had an amazing stay. 
thank you

title: Good hotel, amazing staff
text:
The location of the hotel is great, you could see the Empire state building from the 17th floor. Clean, big breakfast but a bit expensive (like everything in New York especially if you come from Italy).

But the best thing is its wonderful staff, especially the very kind Jestin and Leslie who had so much patience with our very bad English 💚

title: Favorite place to stay in NYC
text: Amazing hotel experience and stay! The location is close enough in walking radius to the subway stations and just a 20 min walk to Times Square! We loved how clean and neat our space was. The ambience was perfect—we went on a weekend, so they would usually have live music in the lobby next to the restaurant when we’d come back after exploring the city. The common areas are not overwhelming and packed like other places we’ve stayed. The front desk workers were always so accommodating and helpful. Robert was so great with assisting us when we needed help. This place is such a good find that you’d want to gatekeep, but it’s also that good to rave about 😮‍💨 I will definitely be returning this fall again!

title: Una vergüenza de servicio
text: El hotel está muy bien situado pero no se lo recomiendo a nadie. El servicio es nefasto, las habitaciones no las limpian ni reponen lo que se utiliza. Es una vergüenza tener que reclamar cada día el agua en la habitación cuando te cobran 45 euros diarios extras por chorradas como esta. Somos socios de melia hace muchos años y es lo peor que hemos visto. No repetiremos con la cadena. Por cierto, pagamos extra por tres (una niña de 13 años) y no tiene ni toallas ni vasos. Y si parezco una tiquismiquis os diré que pagamos algo más de 300 dólares diarios.

title: Experiencia Maravillosa
text: Nueva York es una ciudad mágica y este hotel acompaña. Buena ubicación. Habitaciones confortables y bien equipadas, camas muy cómodas. El servicio de desayuno excelente, variado y rico. Se destaca la atención de Soad en el servicio de desayuno y el person de atención al público de recepción siempre bien predispuestos.

title: Desastre
text:
Estoy alojada en el Hotel Inside Nomad y mi experiencia un desastre

Hoy me fui del hotel a las 11 de la mañana y al llegar a las 6 de la tarde me encuentro con la habitación sin hacer, bajo a recepción y les transmito lo ocurrido 

Acabo de llegar a las 23,15 y la habitación sigue sin estar hecha, vuelvo a bajar q recepción y la excusa que me dan es que por la tarde no había nadie en el hotel que pudiese hacer la habitación así que hasta mañana nada  y lo peor de todo es que ni se han inmutado

title: NoMad?  NoMore!
text: Como socios Meliá desde hace 14 años, nos hemos alojado en una enorme variedad de hoteles de esta cadena en diferentes partes del mundo.  Definitivamente es el peor en el cual nos alojamos..  Habitaciones extremadamente pequeñas - si bien entendible en New York - con equipamiento minimalista extremo, que no asegura el bienestar del huésped.  Seguramente pertenecemos a una generación que prefiere un baño que no sea literalmente un placard en cuanto a sus dimensiones - sin mesada o lugar de almacenamiento -  o un lugar en donde acomodar la ropa en la habitación que esté al menos protegido por una puerta...  Si bien el personal es extremadamente amable (lo único que rescato del hotel), hay que hacer ejercicio de paciencia para ser atendido en el Restaurant Wilson al acceder al desayuno de tres pasos (uno de ellos siendo la infusión elegida) que llega a cuenta gotas y siempre frío .  A saltear el desayuno si se está apurado!  Pero lo peor fue descubrir que tanto a mi marido como a mí nos faltaron un total de U$ 600 que estaban guardados en la "caja de seguridad" de la habitación.  No hicimos la denuncia oportunamente porque no nos dimos cuenta hasta que llegamos a nuestro próximo destino...  De todas formas, recientemente he leído comentarios similares sobre faltantes que no tuvieron respuesta alguna.   Definitivamente no volvería a elegirlos!

title: Excellent Hotel to choose for your New York Stay
text: I've just returned from 10 days in New York.  The INNSIDE Nomad on W27th Street is THE perfect hotel to choose. The staff were so courteous, helpful and friendly.  Great help from reception staff about conquering the subway.  For two women travelling together from Australia the Nomad was Safe, So Clean and was Super quiet The restaurant was fantastic and served us on our arrival after cancelled flights etc.  I would love to stay again.

title: Visit with my wife and daughter
text:
all the personal was very kind and helpfull
great location and very easy to enjoy
clean, modern and great city views
the restaurant was one of the best things
everything you can need to have a practical time

title: Excelente opción en Chelsea. Volvería
text: Es un hotel moderno y muy agradable. El personal es muy amable y dispuesto a ayudar. Las habitaciones son pequeñas, pero las camas cómodas. Las sabanas y toallas en muy buen estado. Está bien ubicado, a 2 cuadras hay estaciones del metro y el barrio en el cual está es seguro. Alrededor hay abres y restaurantes muy agradables. Sin duda, volvería.

title: Sehr schönes, zentral gelegenes Hotel in Manhattan !
text: Wir verbrachten 5 Tage in NYC und hatten eine geräumige, modern eingerichtete  Terrace suite in der 18. Etage.  Das Zimmer war sehr ruhig und das Bett super, wir haben sehr gut geschlafen. Da die Suite über eine Nespresso-Maschine verfügt, haben wir uns Kaffeekapseln mitgebracht und uns selbst ein kleines Frühstück zubereitet. Die Klimaanlagen im Wohn- und Schlafraum sind relativ leise. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich und hilfsbereit und erklärt alles geduldig auch für Leute, die das erste Mal in NYC sind. Kann man auf jeden Fall weiterempfehlen !

title: What An Amazing Experience!!
text:
So, my husband and I decided to take a trip to NYC last minute! We searched and searched for a good hotel that’s in a nice area, close to restaurants/activities, and where the rooms were nice. We came across the Innside By Melia hotel. We looked at some of the guest pictures and read some reviews and ultimately decided to book this hotel. We were nervous because we’ve stayed at other boutique hotels that were too small in NYC and had horrible customer service. 

From the moment we arrived, we were impressed!!! From the decor to the customer service experience with the front desk (Christina, Destiny, Keanui, and others that worked the weekend of May 26 - 30th),  to the room being cleaned, to the accommodations, and even the restaurant! It’s such a cute, grown and sexy vibe! The decor and rooms were really nice and the space was used well - NY has small hotel rooms, but they were designed nice and well thought out. When we checked out we decided to grab a bite to eat at the restaurant “The Wilson” and the staff was so accommodating. We told them we were in a hurry and the manager at the restaurant Isaac made sure we had our food and that we received excellent service!! 

Way to go Innside By Melia, my husband and I will definitely be staying here again!!!

title: Excellent service, great stay!
text: Everyone who works here was super helpful and welcoming, especially Kima and Kit. The room was spacious (for nyc) and we were comfortable! We managed to fit our family of 7 in one double room! I love that everyone in your party gets a bottle of water at check in.

title: Best hotel in NYC so far
text: I've stayed in a lot of New York hotels over the years, but this is the best. Friendly and helpful staff (special shout-out to Kima and Kit in the reception for helping us out!), large rooms for New York, and tasty breakfast. Will be coming back for sure!

title: Great hotel and staff
text: All the staff at the hotel was very nice. The receptionists Kima and Kit were very kind and helpful, they offered friendly conversation and were very helpful with our trip navigation. The restaurant had amazing food for all meals. The rooms were clean and very spacious for New York. I would definitely recommend staying at innside

title: ******AMAZING*****
text:
Originally me and my partner and his parents were meant to stay here for his surprise birthday night in the city at the start of April. . But that weekend we had  to lay his dog to rest. Very traumatic and upsetting weekend. The team on the phone were really helpful in helping me cancel my same day reservations for both rooms. I want to say thank you for that. It was a terrible weekend and they really helped by keeping the cancellation quick and simple. 

Fast Forward to May 7th. When we had rebooked for. As we were checking in they mentioned to us that i had booked a suit. Which I hadn't but I just rolled with it. lol. The room was amazing. My boyfriend was soooooo happy. We went for drink at the restaurant downstairs before we went for dinner. Super nice place and the staff are all great. It was a really good stay. And even thou I live in the city sometimes its nice to treat yourself. As we were checking out I had learnt that it was Kima that had upgraded our room. I can't say thank you enough. It was a bittersweet moment for us since the first trip was cancelled. You and the team made our whole night special for both of us and his parents. They loved their room and the vibe of the hotel. I'm sure we will be back. Again Thank you for going above and beyond for us. Its the little things in life.

title: Attentive and courteous service
text: While the rooms are pretty basic and not long on square footage, what is there is cool and well-designed. More importantly, the staff is courteous and responsive. We needed a couple of items in our room, and as soon as we contacted staff, the items appeared quickly and with a smile on the person's face who was delivering it.  The front desk person, Kima, helped with a confusion check-in anomaly (the third-party system we used duplicated the reservation) patiently and devotedly. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

title: AMAZING
text: Excellent location, very clean and safe. But my reason for leaving this review is all about the customer service. Jorge at the bar was very friendly. Kima was very sweet and went above and beyond. Our flight was canceled but Justin made our very early morning flight cancelation much more tolerable with his kindness and amazing problem solving skills.

title: Great location, good for gatherings
text: I have stayed in many hotel rooms in NYC, usually for business. But this time was was to meet up with friends.  Innside was the perfect place for girlfriends to get away to the CIty! The room was on a high floor and it wasn't loud (heard very little noise outside or inside the hotel), it was clean and as spacious as NYC hotels get. The beds were doubles instead of Queens. Our requests were addressed quickly and politely. And we loved the outdoor lounge/restaurant. Close to everything. I would definitely come back!

title: Me desapareció mi camisón y ni me pidieron disculpas
text: Estuvimos alojados en Semana Santa del 2022, fuimos para 6 días, el segundo día me desapareció el camisón. Todos los días me decían que ya habían hablado con la housekeeper y con el servicio de lavandería pero el camisón no apareció. No me pidieron disculpas. Solicité libro de reclamaciones y me dijeron que ni había tal libro ni habían tenido nunca. Al volver a España encima me pasan un recibo de 187 € (entiendo que por utilizar wifi y nespreSSo????). En fin, parece mentira que sea un MELIA!!!!

title: Happy Guest
text: Great first impression with the front desk staff. Robert greeted us cheerfully and without hesitation accommodated us with a room even though it was hours before check in time. Kima helped us with local directions and went over and beyond to arrange for airport transportation. She reassured us the driver is dependable and he showed up promptly at 4AM. The hotel is chic and inviting,  rooms are very clean and roomy, great location, and awesome front desk.

title: BAD ROOMS
text: rooms on the top floor (19th) can be very uncomfortable with the gym ( treadmills/weight lifting etc) right above your head open 24/7  We spent two days with an almost constant thud of weights dropping and feet pounding above us.  dont pay a premium for a high level view - useless  disappointing since we always had enjoyed this hotle

title: ¡Lo disfrutamos mucho!
text:
Pasamos 3 noches en este hotel y nos sentimos muy a gusto. La ubicación es muy buena a unas cuadras de Penn Station, por lo que los traslados en tren al aeropuerto Newark fueron muy eficientes.
Las camas son cómodas y confortables. La ducha es excelente.
El desayuno en el restaurante Wilson es delicioso y muy bien servido.
Alexander en la recepción nos ayudo a hacer unas impresiones, sin dificultad y con mucha amabilidad.
Nos encanta siempre encontrar a alguien que nos ayude en nuestro idioma.
Agradecidos por la gran experiencia, son parte de nuestros gratos recuerdos de NY.

title: Comfortable stay.
text:
Although I prefer to stay on the East Side, we tried this West Side hotel in Chelsea and enjoyed our stay.  The location was in walking distance to restaurants, shops and transport.
The hotel had friendly, helpful staff and a hip vibe.  The rooms, although on the small side, were very comfortable and were thoughtfully laid out to take accommodate everything in the space available.  The Wilson restaurant downstairs  also serves a wonderful breakfast.  My only complaints:  1) a hook or rack is needed to hang the hand towel in the bathroom and  2) the firewalls on the internet are too strict as sometimes I couldn't even get onto the Google browser.
Overall it was a pleasant stay and good value for money.

title: Good location and decent size room in Chelsea
text:
Even though I have traveled to New York many times, it is always a search to find a good hotel in the city.  When looking for a hotel, we are looking for a centrally-located hotel that provides a nice-sized room and with decent customer service.  In the search, I narrowed our search to Chelsea as that was centrally located to many restaurants and transportation including Penn Station, subway and other aspects.  Within Chelsea, we found Innside NOMAD by Melia Hotels.  I have stayed at Melia before but it was an all-inclusive in Punta Cana at the Melia Caribe Tropical but that was my first experience at a Melia hotel.  That experience was nice so when I noticed the InnsidebyMelia, decided to try out this hotel.

The hotel is located in Chelsea and is in walking distance to many shops, restaurants, and transportation access.  The hotel is 6 blocks from 34th Street and Herald Square, is 6 blocks away from Penn Station, and is close to Madison Square Garden as well as many subway stops.  The hotel itself is located on 27th Street between 6th and 7th Avenue; location on the side streets is very nice as it is away from some of the noise and hustle so you get a more restful sleep.  There are two main doors to the hotel - the outer door leads you into the covered patio for the restaurant and lounge and you walk straight through to the other door which leads you into the general lobby.  It is New York so everything is small including the lobby; in the middle of the lobby is a small sitting area while on the right is the restaurant and to the left are the check-in desks.  Because the lobby is a bit narrow, it can get crowded during peak check-in and check-out times.  Check-in is generally very quick and efficient and you get your key as well as bottles of water - bottles of water are available at the check-in desk and can be requested at any time. 

We received our key and proceeded to the elevator.  The elevator was located in the back of the lobby and you needed your key to access guest rooms.  My review of the hotel is based on 3 different stays and each stay there were different rooms, all basically the same but the only difference is one room was bigger in size but amenities were the same.  When you get off the elevator and go down the hallway to your room, there is a full-length mirror next to each  room number and that was a nice feature of the hotel; to have a last look of yourself and outfit before proceeding out.  As you enter into the room, on one side was the restroom.  The restroom had a sliding door and contained a shower, a toilet and a sink.  The sink had a huge drawer underneath which contained all the towels plus the hairdryer.  There were refillable bottles with handsoap and lotion next to the sink and body wash and shampoo in the shower; the smells were really nice and it was very nice quality and options for the toiletries.  There was not a lot of storage space in the drawer but there was some; there was more storage space underneath the drawer.  As in all New York hotels, space is limited to the bathroom space is compact. 

On the opposite side of the bathroom, in the entrance hallway was the open closet.  The closet contained a small iron and ironing board, a rack to hang clothes on, drawers underneath, shelves on top, and an umbrella in the closet.  Next to the open closet were open shelves and those contained the mini-fridge, the safe, and the coffee maker.  Next to the open closet was a landing where you could store your wallet and phones and along the closet was a ledge where you could store your phone.  Next to the closet mounted on the wall was the TV and at the end of the wall was the small table and chair.  There was a nice window that provided a lot of light and views of the city and there was a chair next to the window.  The beds were located along the wall across from the TV and I generally booked a room with 2 double beds - the beds were spaced out with a nightstand in the middle.  The nightstand had a phone on it and above were 2 small individual reading lights.  The beds themselves were comfortable and provided a good enough sleep; the beds were big enough to sleep 2 people comfortably.  

As I said, the review was based on multiple stays and 2 stays were in the same room type while a 3rd stay was in the bigger room.  The typical room type was spacious enough and was a standard hotel size so 2 people could comfortably fit; it was definitely more spacious than some of the other NYC hotels I have stayed at.  The bigger room had the same amenities but was more spacious - there was definitely more space in the bathroom and in the bedrooms which meant that 4 individuals could comfortably fit into that room.

Amenities in the hotel included wifi, bottles of water, a fitness center, a restaurant, and meeting rooms.  There is a $35 daily resort fee to cover all the costs of these amenities which to me is just another excuse to get more money because I doubt these amenities cost that amount nor is there enough demand on all the facilities to justify that costs.  The bottles are water are limitless so you can go to the front desk multiple times a day to get bottles of water; the wifi was fast and you can load as many devices as you want so both of these were nice.  Because I was usually on there for a weekend I never had time to access the fitness center (and when I did try and check it out it was closed due to COVID restrictions).

Overall, it is a nice centrally located hotel in Chelsea.  The location is perfect with easy transportation and walking access to many shops and restaurants.  The room itself is not squashed and is a decent size, the supply of water (which is important when travelling) and the multiple devices on wifi make this a nice hotel in New York City.

title: Good hotel & location, but be wary of hidden costs
text:
Pros:
- Modern interior, nicely decorated hotel.
- Friendly, professional, attentive staff.
- Good location: relatively quiet street, close to convenience stores, restaurants/coffee, landmarks, 28th street MTA station.

Cons:
- Hidden service fees of $35/night charged on arrival after pre-paying online. I've seen the defending of this in response to other reviews, trying to blame the customer for not noticing them while booking. However these were *not* mentioned when I booked online, and some of the facilities covered by the service fees are actually described as "complimentary" in my booking information. This is not OK and it's unfortunate that I have to lower my overall rating of the hotel for an otherwise great stay.
- Air con is not very powerful and very loud. The temperate gets to a comfortable coolness, but it takes a long time which is not great on hot days.

title: WOW STAY HERE S/O to kima and Steve!
text: Wow Steve engineering  maintenance man and Kima, Queen of Lobby provide OUTSTANDING customer services. They are quick efficient and will make your stay exceed expectations. Thank you steve and Kima for making our stay amazing :)

title: Modern hotel in excellent location, with amazing front desk
text:
I could not recommend the hotel more for its central location. However the true gems are the front reception staff, specially Kima! She masters the art of hospitality to a T, always going above and beyond, with genuine care for her guests. We could have given her 10 stars for considering our feedback, acting on it, and all with a smile. She and her colleagues, be it during the day or night service (especially the lovely Daniel) could not do more.

Afraid we do have to comment on the housekeeping which was not adequate. Floors not were vacuumed despite frequent requests, dustballs collecting, coffee cups not changed etc..and all of this during covid times still. The reception does their best to remediate but really the cleanliness needs to be addressed. Also emails sadly go unanswered (which is annoying for foreigners needing contact from abroad)

title: Moderne, idéalement situé, nickel
text:
Surpris lors de notre arrivé à New-York tant l'hôtel était moderne et propre. Les infrastructures sont agréables, la sécurité et le souci de satisfaire le client sont au maximum.

Kina et Christina ont fait de leur mieux pour nous aider, quelle sympathie, quel accueil! Nous reviendrons certainement dans cet hôtel.

La chambre était idéalement située au 17ème étage, l'hôtel dispose d'une belle pièce salle de sport dont nous ne nous sommes pas servis.
Les ascenseurs sont des œuvres d'art et à chaque étage, une grande fenêtre vous permet d'admirer la superbe vue sur les buildings.

Le bar en sous sol est à tomber par terre. Le restaurant, que nous avons testé au petit déjeuner était excellent. Seul petit bémol: pas de jus d'orange fraîchement pressé, quel dommage!
En soirée, ne servant pas de café, le serveur a offert un coca à mon père pour se faire pardonner. C'était adorable!

Il y a aussi un bar fleuri, Le "Rose Garden - La vie en Rose" qui est super instagrammable pour qui recherche des spots originaux.

Je terminerai mon avis par dire que tout s'est déroulé sans encombre, aucune taxe supplémentaire que celles qui étaient prévues, nous ont été prélevées. La confiance règne!

Merci l'Hôtel Innside NY Nomad et mon agence Loriane Voyages de Gilly de m'avoir fait découvrir cet endroit

title: Vacaciones
text: Hotel precioso y renovado , pero lo mejor la atención de todo su personal , tuvimos un problema con el traslado al aeropuerto contratado por nosotros y la recepcionista nos lo solucionó muy amablemente , mil gracias . Restaurante con maravillosos desayunos.

title: Average stay, wouldn’t stay again
text:
Stayed for 5 nights in NYC and found the stay average.   To be honest the hotel has put me off staying in a MELIA branded hotel again. 

The room is clean and minimal, but this also gives an eerie and basic feel.  location is a plus, the only real plus for tourist attractions, so considering the price per night I think there are better choices in NYC.

title: Fantastic
text: Fantastic hotel for NYC city break. Couldn’t wish for more - brilliant location, everything you need to see and do is pretty much walkable, excellent service at the front desk, and in the restaurant, really cool interior, hip and contemporary; comfortable beds, hot power shower, trendy restaurant and bar on-site, The Wilson, fantastic breakfast. Loads of bars and restaurants around, try Oscar Wild and Patent Pending. Didn’t know such a great stay in NYC is possible without breaking the bank. Found my happy place in New York.

title: amazing
text:
i am very happy with my service with the best employees. Kima,Zack,Maggie. Magiie was a great welcoming employee. the food was amazing, the neighborhood was really great. 20 min walk to HARRY POTTER STORE WHICH I LOVED.
thank you

title: Happy customer
text: I stayed at Innside NY Nomad  we just loved it. The man who checked us in Lazarus, he was AWESOME! The rooms were cute and clean the vibe of the hotel is great. Check out by Kima and Christina was pleasant as well

title: Hospitality at its finest.. a NYC gem
text: I don't often write reviews, but my experience at the Melia Nomad exceeded my expectations. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are modern and clean with a European flair. Beyond the room, the service we received impeccable. Kima, Maggie, Christina and the housekeeping l staff were incredibly professional and went ABOVE and beyond to make this stay incredible. I left a special pair of sunglasses in the room and within 10 minutes, Kima informed me they found them and would be sending them out the next day, which was a huge relief. I felt that the staff truly cares about their guests. Maggie also handled an unexpected incident with one person in our group with the utmost class and courtesy. Maggie is a true gem and should be recognized accordingly. You’d be hard pressed to find someone as dedicated as her. I will definitely be staying at more Melià properties after this experience.

title: Great hotel!
text: We stayed in a family loft which is two connecting rooms, one with a king and one with 2 doubles. Each has a bathroom. So perfect for our family of 5! The hotel and our room is very clean. The beds are so comfortable.  The front desk staff is amazing and provides us as much bottled water as we need. The supervisor Kima made sure we were comfortable and gave us an early check in which was so appreciated. The location is great, very easy to get anywhere we want. I would definitely stay here again!

title: NYC gem
text: I go to NYC a lot, and this is hands down the best hotel I've stayed at. Robert and his whole team are excellent. Very clean hotel and the service is outstanding. Location is as good as it gets. Every time you stay there, it makes you think about moving to NYC. Highly recommend staying here anytime you're in New York.

title: Great Experience!
text: I don't usually write reviews, but because of the amazing hospitality we experienced at the Innside NY, a review is definitely warranted! We've stayed at the Innside NY many times and have always had a good experience. On this visit we came to NY due to an emergency. The staff at the Innside NY was so helpful, understanding, empathetic and accommodating, they made our very difficult emergency situation much easier. Zack, Maggie, Cassie, Alexander and Akhlima were all absolutely fabulous! Each of them went above and beyond so that we were able to focus on our emergency situation and not worry about the logistics of our stay. Zack even loaned us his own personal phone charger for the evening. Seeing first hand how caring and hospitable the staff has been at the Innside, I would  not hesitate to recommend the Innside NY, and it will always be our first choice of where to stay when we come to Manhattan.

title: Estadia en NYC
text: Depues de 3 Anos  queries que to-dos en El Hotel Melia sepan que quiero ageadecer de tal excelentisimo services en especial a El Manager Alexander y a Christina  y Zach  por hacer de nuesrta estadia la mejor  experiencia apresar de que ha sido corta el servicio al cliente de este hotel es mágico y espectacular.  Gracias a todos por ser tan pendiente de nosotros y definitivamente regresaremos!!! Los queremos

title: Amazing Hospitality Team - Kudos to Christina, Alex, Zack and Robert especially
text: I've stayed here on numerous occasions before the pandemic, and always noted the incredible friendliness and attention to service of all employees there. This past week I was there for six nights with a friend, and did not tire of this lovely place, not even for a moment. These folks are the loveliest, and take very seriously their job of ensuring that you have a great stay.

title: FANTASTIC TEAM/HOSPITALITY
text: I am a native (and opinionated!) Manhattanite, I stayed here with an out-of-town friend for six nights this past week, I cannot say enough about the wonderful staff there, particularly the Front Desk folks who make everyone feel welcome from the moment you enter for the first time.  Christina, All, Robert and an extra-special shout-out to Destiny, who was born to be in the Hospitality world.

title: Way better options in NYC than this
text: I was so excited to stay at this hotel because I’ve stayed at Melia hotels several times, including Innside, in other cities and was happy to see they have a NY location.  But since day 1 I have been disappointed in this hotel.  We were charged a hidden resort fee of nearly 50 USD per night which was not included in the total when I made the reservation. The  rooms are unimpressive and lack basic amenities like robes and slippers, as well as hair conditioner. There is just an overall cheap vibe at this hotel that makes you wish you had chosen differently. We had to call several times for better pillows and for housekeeping to remove our dirty dishes which were just ignored during the daily cleaning. Thumbs down. Stay at the Kimpton Eventi instead which is the same price range and much nicer!

title: ÓTIMO HOTEL- EQUIPE PROFISSIONAL EXCELENTE !!!
text: Excepcional, fiquei de 15 a 30 de janeiro de 2022, hotel impecável, localização, limpeza, manutenção das instalações e equipamentos, ótimo café da manhã, tudo superado pela equipe de profissionais que trabalham no Hotel, recepção, restaurantes, camareiras, sempre na busca do melhor atendimento, extremamente importante e acolhedor ser bem  recebido com certeza voltarei ao hotel e o indicarei a todos.

title: Como en casa
text: Es la segunda vez que nos alojamos en el Innside New York NoMad y la experiencia siempre ha sido inmejorable. Localización ideal, magnífico ambiente y personal cercano y agradable. Una mención especial para Alexander Martinez por su amabilidad y cercania. Sin duda repetiremos.

title: Great Weekend Stay in NYC
text:
Spent a Saturday night in city to join friends for a special dinner.
The Innside was perfect in every way. The room, the staff, the location, the gym could not have been better. The downstairs restaurant(The Wilson) was quite popular with Saturday evening  and Sunday morning

title: one of the best and most accommodating staff in the area
text: staff are super friendly and very accommodating  most especially ALEX.he made us feel very important guest in the house, the rooms are so clean when we arrive and sanitize that's why we feel very safe,ambieance and the smell of the whole hotel makes me feel at home.

title: Great location NYC hotel with spacious rooms
text:
This hotel was good value, centrally located and the bedroom was large compared to other places I have stayed.
The service was good, hotel was nice and clean
There is no real room service / it doesn't really work

title: Good week, good location
text: Good week in New York, good price for the location and size of the room. Don’t bother upgrading for a city view room as you’ll just see the buildings over the street. The location was good for all major attractions and subway, the free Wi-Fi was good and you get complimentary use of the nespresso machine which was good. The room could do with updating but by no means in a bad standard.

title: Ideally situated
text: We stayed at the Innside when we visited with family and friends. The hotel was perfectly situated for everything we wanted to do. The staff were helpful and polite. Our room wasn’t the biggest we have stayed in at NYC but was kept really clean. We would stay there again

title: Perfect Stay…Perfect Staff!
text: My husband and I traveled with two other couples to dine our way through the city… Our accommodations were perfect and the staff was lovely! Everything we need it was only a block away with easy access to the subway and only blocks from some of our favorite places.

title: NYE in New York
text:
Stayed at this beautiful hotel to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary and saw the new year in also! 
We had a suite on the 20th floor and it didn’t disappoint! Great veiws, beautiful room and fabulous staff! We will most definitely be back!

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
Is was a wonderful family vacations, staff extremely friendly, beds are very comfortable, very quiet hotel and at the same time waking distance to every place. Restaurant was very good !!!
I will come back and I recommned 100%

title: Non consigliato
text: Mi spiace ma non salvo nulla di questo hotel se nn la posizione. Reception pessima, poco staff e non preparato, colazione pessima viene gestita dal ristorante a fianco che il lunedì è chiuso e gli altri 2 giorni non aveva 3 dei 7 piatti sul menu. Camera ok, bagno piccolo con ventola rumorosa che va anche di notte e spazi comuni sporchi. Rapporto qualità prezzo pessimo

title: XMas visit to the NYC
text: Location in the city was excellent.  We stayed there 3 nights, and did not have to use any transportation services, including uber.  We came with the bus from DC to NYC Penn Station which is 10 minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel was clean and modern.  The size is as expected for big city hotels.

title: Surprise Christmas trip - probably last one with our grown up sons
text: On arrival we had major issues with our booking - hotel insisted that we didn’t have one which was not a fun experience having just arrived from Ireland and an exceptionally long trip due to covid testing requirements before we left home and unfortunately found the duty manager that day to initially be quite dismissive of our dilemma. But very pleased to say the issue was eventually resolved and we found the hotel to be very central, within easy walking distance of Times Square. The room was clean, beds very comfortable, had a mini fridge and safe and I would have no hesitation in recommending - just make sure to bring proof of your booking with you!!

title: Shocking experience
text: A shocking experience staying here. Had to raise concern to management and receptionist. Initial trying to handle the situation and trying to redeem themselves by given us a different room, which was nice. Some breakfast vouchers which we could not use all days as restaurant were closed on mondays, what a joke. And some other promises that never happend. Really badly managed and in general very dissatisfied from this Melia hotel. Not a safe stay! Cleaning missing towels in room and even leave with your door open letting you room available for everyone. NOT acceptable and be careful booking this hotel. Management tried to manage the

title: Perfect Spot
text: Great hotel, great staff and really great vibe in the bar and restaurant. I liked the location as we could walk to everything, whether we wanted the hustle and bustle of downtown or the serenity of the Village. Great spot.

title: Good Location, Poor Contact from Hotel
text: The hotel was in a great location! Rooms are rather small but just what you need for somewhere to sleep and have a shower. I would recommend ensuring you have your booking confirmation printed as we had booked two rooms and only one room was showing on the system when we arrived at the reception. Fortunately, the confirmation showed that two had been booked and paid for. Also, don’t expect to receive your incidental deposit back in a hurry. We departed on 7th December and have still not received the money back for both rooms. We have tried to contact the hotel (email and  phone) but have still received no reply.

title: Great Hotel -- will return
text: The hotel was perfect for our trip. We had two rooms, on same floor, a few doors apart. The rooms were clean, and comfortable. Location of hotel is awesome, some great restaurants close by as is the subway station. The staff was friendly and helpful.

title: Disappointed
text: Bathroom door was broken and would close. In room safe battery was low and couldn’t be used. The beds have one light comforter, which is not warm enough for winter. There’s no in room coffee pot or kettle. The room is sterile, filled with white furniture, the majority of which was stained and scratched. The rooms are not trendy, they’re just ugly and unwelcoming. The only good thing was the view.

title: Great hotel in a good location!
text: Location of the hotel was good, walkable to many attractions. Very friendly and helpful staff . Very good sized rooms with plenty of storage. Bed was so comfortable and room was very well soundproofed, didn’t hear a sound. Great value Would definitely recommend!

title: Nice hotel and friendly staff
text: We stayed in a family suite with is 2 connecting rooms; one with a King and the other with 2 doubles.  This worked well for our family of 4.  Hotel is updated and clean.  All staff we encountered were very friendly.

title: Great hotel, shame about the service
text:
The rooms for this hotel are quite small but to be fair to the hotel the sizes are listed on their website.

Overall a very nice hotel, a great location and the staff are very helpful so all good in that respect.

Our main issue is the hotels policy on generating income as they seem to give priority to anyone that hires their function rooms over their guests.

After a meal in Greenwich village we decided to go back to the hotel for drinks rather than walking around looking for places to go as it was cold and raining.

Other than the reception area the only place hotel guests can go (other than their room) is the restaurant/function room. 

On arriving back at the hotel we discovered that restaurant/function room was booked out for an external private party and none of the hotel guests where allowed in leaving us having nowhere to go.

We did enquire with the reception staff only to be told that only room service would be available for us but being a very small room, not really an option.
Obviously once we had come from the other side of the city it was too late to head back up there so we had to have an early night.
This happened on two occasions out of the 4 nights we stayed there.

Be warned, the hotel has some great facilities you just may not be able to use them!!

title: Great Place
text: Glad I payed a little extra to stay here.  Room was very modern and contemporary and clean.  Felt room was spacious for NY City hotel room.  Subway entrance just a street up and Penn Station and MSG just a short walking distance so location was perfect for our needs.  We didn't actually go to the restaurant and bar but it seemed to be a very happening place.  When open it always seemed busy and they even had a DJ in lobby playing music.  I wouldn't hesitate staying here again on a return trip to NYC.

title: un gran hallazgo
text:
Mi cuarta vez en la ciudad pero la primera vez que me alojo en este hotel. Me quede sorprendida con el ambiente y con la calidez de la gente que trabaja.
Las habitaciones cómodas y siempre limpias. 
Una buena opción para alojarse en el flower district a una cuadra del subte 1.

title: Great hotel, but tech problems
text: I stay at this hotel often when visiting NYC because of the great location, clean rooms, and modern decor. The service is also very friendly and helpful. My complaints are that the hotel Wifi is very unreliable and the outlets are low power, making it difficult to do work on my laptop and to recharge my mobile devices.

title: Segunda vez en el hotel, segundo decepción, más grande que la primera. Innumerables fallos de servicio, limpieza, etc.
text: No tiene nada que ver con la calidad que ofrece habitualmente la cadena Melia. Innumerables fallos de servicio, habitación sin hacer, fallos de limpieza, mala atención. No pudimos disfrutar de las ventajas por ser miembros Platinum.

title: Great NYC hotel
text: Staff are super helpful and friendly. Rooms are clean, modern and spacious especially in NYC. They were quick to help when my wife forgot an adapter. Internet is good in the room, important if you’re travelling for business. Beds and pillows might even be better than the ones I have at home.

title: Decepción por segunda vez
text:
Fuimos a Melia por ser cliente habitual de la cadena, además de miembro platinum. El hotel está bien situado en la calle 27, las habitaciones son espaciosas y las camas cómodas. Aún así el trato es bastante frío en general, hay que preguntar y solicitar todo desde una cafetera para la habitación, te que no repusieron, agua de cortesía en la
Recepción, y uno de los días a las 20:00 hrs habiendo salido a hacer turismo a las 9:00 de la mañana, cuando regresamos la habitación estaba aún sin hacer, tuvimos que pedir toallas limpias y dormimos en las camas deshechas de la noche anterior. Esta ha sido la segunda y última vez que voy a alojarme en este hotel. En otros de la cadena Melia seguiré yendo, será la excepción… ya no habrá una tercera oportunidad.

title: Good location and clean, but…
text:
Hotel and room were very clean upon arrival. Good location, with subway right around the corner.  
But… we stayed for 3 nights and received no housekeeping during our stay! Hair dryer was broken. There was no mention in our confirmation email or at check-in that you had to request a Nespresso machine for your room, something that is included in the daily additional $35 facility fee. 
Also, I paid extra for a city view room, (which their website describe as skyline views, including the Freedom Tower) and I was on the 9th floor (of 20), looking into office windows across the street. No skyline view at all!
And be prepared for the tiniest bathroom I have ever had, including in Europe. 
An OK place, but room for better communication and oversight.

title: Great quiet location
text: Nice and quiet location with friendly staff. The first floor is lively with the restaurant next door and had a Dj one night, but you don’t hear any of that in your room. Rooms were bigger than I expected. You have to ask for the coffee machine that’s included in the price, but it was an espresso machine that we did not enjoy. We were very satisfied overall with our stay and would definitely recommend!

title: Stay away from this hotel
text: The mattress was the worst that I had in an hotel, zero support, no mattress cover, and the housekeeping did not do the bed. They just pulled up the duvet without arranging the "cover sheet' for the mattress.

title: Welcome home!
text: This is my go-to hotel for business and personal travel.  The hotel staff are very welcoming and the front desk is managed by Alex Martinez - he is the reason I return time and time again!  You are always greeted like a long lost friend, check-in is efficient and always a wonderful experience!  The rooms are well equipped, beds are very comfortable, clean and have all the amenities needed. Have an event - then Alexandria Castro is your go to person! She is efficient, detail oriented and has always come through even with last minute requests.

title: Amazing Front Desk Staff!!
text:
I can't thank enough Christina, Alex and Kit. They were very helpful and made our stay in New York wonderful.
We had issues with our flight and car service. Christina helped us to get the same room for an extra day and she got a car service to the airport when the one we had reservations called 30 minutes before our pick up time. Alex was amazing at check in and his recommendations for dinner were "great"
The Hotel is in a great location and a modern vibe/design. Common areas are clean but I can't say the same for the room.
From day one of our stay no body wash until they day we left. The room was not cleaned the second day of our stay. The floors were dirty. Towels were grayish and worn out. I would definitely stay here again if the hotel takes action with the housekeeping issues.

title: Very chic, well located
text: The hotel was clean, efficient, and hip. Very walking friendly. That said, I reported the room was left without sheets on the bed, so I asked for them to be delivered. They were not. Luckily the night attendant was on duty as when I returned from a late night out—I desperately needed sheets! I had them delivered but then still had to make the bed up before I could use it at 2am before traveling early. Less than ideal, but everything else was wonderful. Just a small oversight.

title: Nice, modern and clean hotel but enough expensive
text:
We had a double room. It was enough spacious and very clean.The hotel was crowded and the lobby is too small when the hotel is almost over booked.
For the price of the room they could offer the breakfast

title: Great stay!
text: Hotel is centrally located to subway, restaurants, attractions. Family loft is guaranteed connecting rooms. Hotel vibe is young and exciting. Hotel restuarant and bar are convenient and offer quality products. Nice stay.

title: Great Stay
text: I visited NY CITY this time with my parents (in their 60s) , and it was their first time. In the past, I've stayed with friends, so this was my first NY city hotel experience. The hotel was above our expectations. We had no issues, and the staff was great. We felt safe since the elevator  requires a room card to use it. The restaurant has a great ambience, so I was glad no visitor can use the elevator. We are planning to return next year since we have a few things we did not get to do, and my father said: 'we have to come back to the same hotel'.

title: Friendly Staff Make the Visit!
text: Our stay was absolutely amazing. My mom, future mother in law and I stayed at the Innside Nomad in Manhattan because we came to the city to wedding dress shop for myself. The hotel and staff we both wonderful. I loved the atmosphere of the hotel, bar and restaurant so much! I would most definitely stay here again. For a 3 night stay for 3 people and breakfast included, the rates we extremely reasonable. I was so happy to not have to spend a fortune on lodging as we would be doing other activities in the city as well. More than happy to give glowing reviews of this hotel!

title: Perfecto hotel, muy buen servicio y calidad y en una zona estupenda.
text: Totalmente recomendable, por ubicación, calidad, tamaño de las habitaciones, algunas con vistas increíbles! Es nuevo y esto en Nueva York es muy importante! El personal de recepción fantástico, Alex, Kimberly y el resto !! Volveré!!

title: Great Experience
text: So pleasantly surprised by how lovely, modern and artsy the hotel was. The rooms were clean, functional and modern supplying everything you could need. The communal spots were beautifully decorated and the bar was wonderful. Staff were attentive and extremely helpful. Excellent value for money and I enjoyed my stay

title: Thumbs up
text: Great stay at the INNSIDE. Nice property, comfortable beds, good location and helpful, friendly  staff.  Initially had problems signing on to the wifi, but the staff was very quick to solve the problem.  My go-to in NYC.

title: Great Wedding Weekend
text: The reception staff, Christine, Alex, and Kit, made our stay very smooth.  They added a special touch by adding a bottle of wine in our room when we arrived. The terrace faced the Empire State Building and was great at night to look at.  Thank you for making it special.

title: Excelente servicio !!Queremos volver pronto!!
text: Solo quiero darle muchas gracias a Alexander Martinez, nos atendió como si estuviéramos en casa, nuestras habitaciones estaba super acogedoras, la bienvenida fue de ensueño y la atencion para celebrar una cena de cumpleaños fue lo mejor de todo... la verdad que se lucio y ame el hotel... ya estamos planeado otra visita en febrero 2022. Esperemos volver a vernos muy pronto!!

title: El Hotel es lo máximo
text: La verdad INNSIDE  es lo máximo,  el joven Alexander Martinez es lo mejor que puede tener el hotel,  no conforme con que no hablo inglés el chico se encargo de darnos una atención perfecta y personalizada, todo los días nos pregunto cómo estábamos y si queríamos agua o una reserva en el restaurante. No solo cuida las instalaciones si no que protege al huésped.

title: Bien ubicado.
text:
Es un hotel que por lo menos en nuestro caso nos salió carísimo para lo que es el hotel.  La calle adonde  se encuentra durante todo el día hay camiones de reparto o camiones descargando mercadería., o grúas trabajando.,
La habitación tiene buena insonorización, cama cómoda . 
Es obligatorio el pago de free resort (40 dólares x día) 
Estás a 2 cuadras de la 5 Ave. 
El restaurante del hotel es muy bueno, pero no es barato .
Los chicos de recepción son excelentes!!! Lo mejor del hotel!
Hay 2 bicicletas para uso de los huéspedes.

title: Loved!
text: Definitely bumping here. Great for a younger crowd on a weekend, vibes were awesome. Felt very updated and modern and fun, loved the DJ and lights and ambiance in the lobby and restaurant. Probably not the best for families but for a weekend trip with friends… perfect. Great location too.

title: We are coming back!
text: I just want to say alex made my whole trip experience at New York the best. He made sure everything was set right when I arrived and till I left. Everything was perfect because of his hospitality. And just with the whole staff in general they were great. I will defiantly be coming back!! Thank you!

title: OK, but a little high priced for what you get
text:
My city-view room really had more of a view of the rooftops of the buildings just south of the hotel.  Skyline views south were limited at best.

The hotel was quiet, which is a must in NYC.  There are not a lot of amenities at the hotel, however.  The hotel restaurant (The Wilson) was constantly booked when I was there, with dinners sometimes spilling into the lobby (with their plates of food).  And the restaurant did not appear to be open on Monday or Tuesday.

The room was small, as per usual in NYC, although it did not feel cramped.  There were some technical glitches - several major  broadcast channels on the flat-screen TV were simply bank (NBC, Fox, etc.).  The bathroom shower controls require you tot and in the shower to turn it on - be prepared for a blast of cold water.  Also, I really had to slam the door shut to make sure it locked.  I can't say all rooms are like that - just mine.

On the plus side, the hotel was relatively low priced for NYC (although $300 per night still seems steep for what you get).

title: 5 night stay in NY
text:
Me and my German friend Leo stayed at your hotel from Thursday-Tuesday (10/28-11/2). I need to give a huge shoutout to all the employees of this hotel, especially Cassie, Destiny, and Zack, you guys were truly amazing. I have never been treated with such kindness and friendliness at a hotel, even if I was quite intoxicated several times. Of course all the members working for this hotel were amazing but I must direct extra attention to Cassie and Destiny as well as to Zack. The amount of water bottles I ordered to our room was insane, and Cassie still didn’t say no, which I genuinely appreciate. We’re definitely staying at this hotel in the future when we revisit. I hope this review gets passed on to upper managers, because without Cassie, Destiny, and Zack, at least our hotel experience would not have been as fantastic as it was. Being treated this good by these 3 people as two 21 year olds is something I will never forget.

Much love from two Europeans!

title: Lied when booking!
text: I recieved wrong information! I was told there was a rooftop seating area and a buffet style breakfast. Not true! Too expensive for a "family suite" that was only two conjoining rooms that you couldn't even keep the doors open because you couldn't move around the door.

title: Fabulous hotel and staff
text: I can't say enough about the Innside Hotel.  From booking with sales director Alexandra Castro, who is amazing, to Kit and Christina at the front desk, they make me feel like I am home and not at a hotel!  The Innside is my home away from home.

title: INNSIDE by Meliá
text: My stay here was amazing. The hotel is so nice and clean. The rose garden patio is beautiful. The location was perfect for everything I did that weekend. The best part to me was the staff at the front desk. Cassie was so nice and helpful with everything. She really made my stay there so much better. I would love to stay here again the next time I’m in New York…

title: Customer service here is perfection
text:
I just came back from a 3 night stay and the staff here went out of their way every chance they could to make our stay more comfortable. I walked in with a fussy 5 year old and hands full. One of the ladies working behind the desk spotted me struggling and immediately came our from
Behind the desk to give me a hand and calm
Down my child. It was very touching. She accompanied us l the way to the room. She had long straight long hair , maybe Cassie 

The next day I needed to upgrade the room to accommodate my friend joining us. Christina made that seemless. We also didn’t have to worry about anything as all Of our packed belongings were moved to the larger suite as we were out having lunch. 

As for the room, the beds were comfortable and the rooms were spacious enough. Our city view was amazing ! 

Shoutout to Christina, Cassie, Alex, and Kit. I will definitely stay here again.

title: Great stay in Nomad
text: This is a very nice hotel in a location that was good for our family activities. The rooms were more spacious than other places we’ve stayed in NYC. The staff was gracious and accommodating. Great memories!

title: Would stay here again
text: I highly. recommend INNside New York NoMad, it is perfectly located, clean, with friendly and helpful staff. The front desk held my luggage until my room was ready. I had a balcony room and it was worth the money.  My room was clean and I opted for daily housecleaning. Due to covid, you may have to ask for certain amenities, like slippers, robes, blow-dryer, iron + ironing board, etc. My room had a small fridge which was perfect to store beverages in. Also, you can request complimentary water bottles, which is a plus. I enjoyed the Nespresso coffee maker in the room; the coffee mugs were cute too. The rainfall shower was very nice, but if you don't want to get your hair wet, you don't have to use the rainfall shower. They have liquid soap and 2-in-1 shampoo/conditioner. I didn't use their shampoo/conditioner as I brought my own. Soap smelled nice as did the hand lotion in the bathroom. The AC in the room works really well. I prefer a cold room and I had it on the lowest setting. I only used the black out curtain once because I preferred waking up to the city views. The bed and pillows were comfortable.  I didn't use the gym, but the gym provides amazing views of the city. A nice little perk was the view of the One World Trade Center as you wait for the elevators to come up to your floor. The view never got old and elevators are fast and uniquely decorated.  The Wilson is the adjoining restaurant. They were friendly there too. I went for brunch and it was packed.  Reservations are highly recommended and they will seat you when all of your party has arrived. Special shout to everyone who helped us: Hugo (how do you remember everyone's name?! that's amazing), Christina, Cassie, Adeel, Getachew, Kit, and so many others. Highly recommended.

title: Cozy, nice, quiet boutique hotel in heart of Art District
text:
Love the hotel location. It is situated right in the center of Chelsea. Easy access to The High Line, Flowers Market, Chelsea Flea Market, FIT and other art stores. Short walk to lovely Maman Cafe. 
The hotel itself is one of the very rare which can provide guests a good night sleep. Not noisy or smell of Marijuana in the hallway like other hotels in Soho. The front desk attendees are super nice and accommodating. Will definitely come back and recommend to friends.

title: Amazing Staff and Service
text: Can't say enough about the professional, friendly, helpful staff.  Everyone we encountered was very pleasant and very willing to go the extra mile to make sure our stay was a positive experience. Because of their commitment to excellent service I would definitely stay again.

title: Great location and very clean
text: We arrived on a flight early, around 10 am, and were able to check in when we arrived at the hotel. Christina at the front desk was super accommodating and helpful. Easy walk to the High Line andHudson Yards. Nice area with lots of coffee shops and restaurants.

title: Great Hip Spot in the Perfect Location
text: Would definitely stay here again. My only surprise was how small the room was. We only used the room to recharge, so in the end the size of the room did not matter, but I was definitely surprised by how small it was. Staff was kind and helpful. Definitely recommend.

title: Manager displayed a vested interest in providing excellent customer service
text: Front desk staff failed to notify me of $35 fee and all the amenities available to me. Although she may have been distracted because the computer were down, she had at least two opportunities to explain. I told her I prepaid for my stay so what fees would be charged to my account when the computers came back up.. She advised she couldn't confirm what i'd paid until the system was back up. She offered me 2 waters. I asked if they were free, she playfully stated she would not offer it they weren't free.  She told me I would be notified when charges are made. I checked in on Thursday and by Saturday I had not been notified. I asked another front desk staff about my account.. she never looked it up but said i would receive my charges etc on check out. I asked again, if I prepaid what charges would be on my account. She explained that there is a $100 deposit that's charged to my card and a $35 per day resort fee.  The deposit will be refunded. I inquired as to the purpose of the $35, she stated it's for the amenities. I asked what the amenities were. She stated, unlimited water, expresso machine, work out facility (i believe on the 20th floor), and free bike rental. I was actually at front desk to get cups for the water we purchased at a convenient store. I advised her coffee and water water accessed off premises because I was unaware that they were amenities. She apologized, offered to send up expresso machine and offered me water (i had a gallon of my own). She advised the manager would be available in the morning.. HERE IS WHERE IT ALL CHANGED.. I met with Alexander  Martinez. He actively listened to my complaint, looked up my account, explained to me when I purchased online it also stated I would be charged a $35 fee by the hotel. He continued by confirming that we received our expresso machine and advised I could have as much water as I needed (i don't have to take 2 at a time). He reiterated the amenities that they have available. He then offered to remove the resort fee for 2 days . I of course had to pay the fee for the days I was made aware of the fee and amenities, which was fair.  In the middle of the night, just hours before my flight departure, my flight was cancelled. NO flights for the day. I called front desk and they suggested I call after 8am. When I called at 8am, I asked for Alex; I was told he would be in at 10. I explained to him my dilemma. At this point, i had to pay an additional $238 to fly home (don't ask). I asked for a fair rate for the additional night as I might have to go to another hotel if he couldn't provide. He offered a fair rate for the unexpected stay.  He could have tried to monopolize on my desperate situation, but he didn't. THANK YOU ALEX.  Yes there were hiccups at the hotel, but ALEX worked to rectify it all. I don't expect perfection, but I do expect to be treated like a valued customer. Alex did just that.  Sorry this is so long, but you don't really realize how good or bad a company is until you need them.

title: Nice hotel but hidden fees
text: The hotel in general was very nice,  very clean and we appreciated the upgrade, but very disappointed in the extra charge when I booked the hotel with Melia app it give me a final price with taxes and I got charge $184 usd extra. I send to emails asking why never recibe a responde.

title: $35 facility fee?!?!?
text: There was a $35 service fee which included nespresso and water but you have to ask for the machine/water and you have to set it up the machine yourself. The staff was friendly but the system was down. They had to scan your ID and credit card. It was in a great location

title: Wedding event- Innside Nomad Melia hotel
text:
Best Hotel Stay Ever!!!! 

Alex and Hugo are the best! 

My daughter and I stayed at Innside Nomad when we were attending a wedding in New York. This was the most amazing stay I have experienced at a hotel in a long time. This a very modern, sleek hotel with wonderful views from every room. Our room was immaculate and the cleaning staff serviced the room thoroughly every day. The front desk attendees were excellent.. Two staff members in particular (Alex Martinez and Hugo ) deserve a hospitality award for the above and beyond customer service they provided. We are definitely planning on staying at Innside again soon!

title: Excellent location
text:
We loved our stay at INNside Nomad,  the lobby has a modern, minimalist design which is comfortable and welcoming. The staff is also welcoming and professional I would like to mention Hugo at front desk he was helpful and gave us few tips and instructions on how to get to places faster and use our time efficiently. 
Overall we highly recommend the INNSIDE!

title: Great stay at Innside!
text:
