My teenage daughter and I recently took a "girls trip" to NYC. We took the Acela into NYC and the Innside was about a 10 minute walk and very easy to find. We arrived around 11:30 AM and asked to have our baggage stored but the hotel was able to check us in early which was really nice! 

The hotel lobby is small and has some seating but it is very clean and there is an outside lounge area which was highly utilized and very comfortable. 

Our room was on the 16th floor and faced the front of the building. There wasn't a spectacular view - if you are looking for a view you may want a higher floor or possibly the other side of the building may provide one. 

The room and bathroom aren't huge (which we didn't expect as it is a city hotel) but provided plenty of storage, a small refrigerator and served our needs. If we had wanted a coffee maker we could have requested one be brought up. We didn't experience any noise while in the room - either from the outside or from other guests. We actually didn't see any other guests on our floor. One night we did want an extra blanket and housekeeping brought it up to our room very quickly. The room itself is very minimal and modern (think white walls, glass walled shower, small table and chair, etc.). There were some dings around the bed frame and along the bottom of the wall but it was normal wear and tear and what I would expect. We found that the room and bathroom were very clean as well as the common areas (halls, elevators, lobby, common area bathroom).  

When we checked out we still had several hours before our train was departing. The hotel was able to store our baggage for us and retrieved it in a timely fashion when we returned. 

As a side note: this is an especially good location if you have a student attending or interested in attending FIT as it is at the end of the street. We went to the FIT museum and while it wasn't huge there was a nice exhibition and a nice way to spend an hour. 

Everyone at the hotel was attentive and checked with us on how our stay was going as well as if there was anything they could do better.

There is a restaurant on site. We didn't try it but it was very popular and does offer breakfast on most days.

I would stay at the Innside again based on the location as well as the attitude of the staff and overall care of the building.

title: Perfect Spot
text: We found the hotel to be in a great location, perfectly distanced from the hustle and bustle of the City but yet easy to walk to when out and about.  The double beds in the Family Loft did not provide the comfort we expected but served the purpose.  Attention to the non working lock on the bathroom door was mentioned along with the broken lid on the bathroom garbage can.  Minus these few findings the hotel was perfect!

title: Unfortunately not….
text:
We are repeating customers since the hotel opening….have been here probably 30 times and after the last very bad experience in February 2020 we gave another try after COVID closure.
No way…manager in charge at the check-in was very unfriendly and didn’t properly take care of us.The staff still efficient and kind , apart from the manager ( blond air man)  
Amenities downgraded but at the same extra cost. Maintenance poor. Towels supposed to be white but kind of grayish and worn out.
Room downgraded in size considering the past stays experience.
Room at the 19th floor under the gym to avoid!!! 
We always thought the Melia NYC was our home away from hotel but it’s time to say goodbye!

title: Stay elsewhere
text: Hidden fees for what it is. Not worth the price. My friend and I were surprised at how different the pictures looked online. Of course I should have read other reviews. We would have stayed somewhere else

title: Beautiful boutique feel in the middle of Manhattan
text: First time to New York, hotel was a nice surprise. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Room was beautiful with an amazing view! Ask for the 20th floor - worth the small upgrade fee! Water towers and Freedom tower - so breathtaking. Restaurant was nice with good food. Saturday night they had a DJ in the lobby and it was fun to walk through and see all the activity in the restaurant/bar and outdoor seating areas. Very clean, very safe - great vibe! Would stay here again and have already recommended to my friends!

title: Fantastic!
text: From the minute we walked in to the minute we left the service was FABULOUS! Very attentive especially the night employees at the front desk and housekeeping! We feel terrible because we had minutes to get to our train and forgot to leave a tip for the hard workers that cleaned our rooms. We will be staying there again when we come back so will be making up for it! The gym was great they even had a skipping rope which I have never seen before so I was very happy. No towels though which was a huge bummer. The tv was very spotty but it was not that big of deal seeing as we didn't spend a lot of time in the room even with our 6 year old. The room was very quiet too. Thank you Melia for making our first trip to New York special and stress free!!!

title: Inside the Innside
text:
This was my third stay at this hotel--this time I got it as part of a JetBlue package deal and it was well worth the price of $135 a night--you can't beat that for a hotel this nice in Manhattan. I walk everywhere when I'm in the city, and the location of the Innside is perfect for that.
I would highly recommend this hotel for the single traveller or a couple looking for a getaway weekend in Manhattan.

title: Labour Day Weekend Trip
text: We celebrated my Bachelorette in New York during Labour day weekend. We were pleasantly surprised by this hotel. We stayed in the Family Loft which were two adjoining rooms, each with a bathroom.  It was more spacious than we anticipated so we would definitely recommend this type of room for groups again. The rooms were clean and decor minimal but still a modern feel. Overall, the staff were friendly and we had a good experience from check-in to check-out. We would stay here again!

title: Not a 4 star rating hotel
text: This is a 4 star hotel but not really a 4 star. Rooms and specially bathroom need more cleanliness. There were hairs under the toilet seat cover and overall bathrooms were not clean. They don't have a cart to put your luggage on it . Front desk service was good as I was with 2 kids and they offered me help to take my luggage to the room.  Overall I would not stay in that hotel again

title: Great Location. Great Vibe
text: This hotel is at the heart of Manhattan ideally situated between Times Square and Lower Manhattan. It is cozy but, feels upscale and is very well appointed. Great value for money too. The Rose Garden with it's umbrella roof is a cool touch.

title: Best stay ever!
text: The hotel was 5 stars & they were lovely to my dog ! From now on Innside hotel will be the only hotel I stay in when in NYC- the brunch vibe was fantastic, I was upgraded to the townhouse, & everywhere I went our dog was welcomed & loved!

title: Great Place to Stay!
text: My friends & I had a great stay at Innside NYC. The hotel was super modern, clean & in close proximity to a ton of cool restaurants & bars. Our check in with Kimberly was seamless (much appreciated after a long ride from Boston). The view from our room on the 19th floor was amazing. The room could have been a tad bigger for the price, but the style & design more than made up for that. The Wilson (restaurant w/in the hotel) was great. The outdoor seating area in the back was gorgeous. Our server Esteban was excellent. Only complaint-kitchen closed @9:30… I thought this was the city that never sleeps? Check out was also great (minus the “resort fees”). Alex , Ridge & Christina were very kind & more than happy to store our 15 bags while we spent some time enjoying the city after check out. I’d definitely stay there again. 8/10

title: Gem of a hotel!
text: Great hotel for the price. The rooms and facilities were exceptionally clean, quiet and comfortable. Traveling during the pandemic we felt safe staying at this hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We ate dinner at The Wilson which has a wonderful patio and surprisingly good food!  The only drawback is that the Wilson isn't open for breakfast so we had to walk a few blocks to find a place to eat in the morning.

title: nice hotel near Fashion Institute of Technology
text:
Used this hotel during college drop off at FIT NYC
Very close to campus
Safe area
Hotel was upbeat and had a very pleasant smell
Has indoor and outdoor seating at restaurant
Room was comfortable
Additional hotel service fe of 35 a night

title: Awesome Experience
text: This was an great Stay, Staff was friendly and helpful. I was in the city to drop off Daughter for School and the staff was Awesome with parking and dinner reservations. I would recommend this Hotel on your  next stay in NYC. Location was perfect, short walk to many attractions.

title: Clean modern room
text: Even room 1313 was incredibly clean, bright, modern, windows that opened to let in fresh air, Nespresso machine brought to the room shortly upon request, floors without carpets.  Would be great for work or fun.

title: INNSIDE NEW YORK HOTEL
text: Horrible place to stay. very dirty hotel, we had to check out early because how dirty the rooms were. We had dirty and ripped sheets, blood stains on the sheets and bugs in the rooms. The lobby is like a club not a hotel lobby. very loud music you can't hear the front desk when talking with them. Good luck finding parking.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: I'm very happy  that we stayed in this hotel, location great , the staff very nice ,everything excellent.We are very pleased.We highly recommend it.The housekeeping staff very nice they keep our room clean and they make sure everything was fine.the last day the service car came for us to take us to the airport but  we were stuck in traffic ,I forgot her name but she call me twice to let me know that the car was wating for us. Thank you so much for your service.

title: Eli
text:
Great service. The concierge was welcoming and very kind. My friends and I all got great sleep. We felt the hotel made special accommodations to keep the rooms clean. 
I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

title: Great Everything
text: I had a really great experience at the Innside hotel. My check-in was quick, the staff was super friendly. The hotel was nice, my room was pretty roomy for NY standards. The air conditioning was adequate. The room has a little mini fridge, which was nice. Everything was clean. The lobby smells amazing- like flowers or something. The restaurant adjacent was delicious, I ate a couple of meals there. Fun little rose garden area in the back too. I would stay here again for sure.

title: Charged Triple, Treated like criminals
text:
We stayed here for 3 weeks, the first day we arrived everything was fine, Robert  Hughes was so kind, since I am a silver member he let us check in very early 8:00Am so we had our room very early which was a good thing.

Rooms are quite small but are comfortable.

We had problems the first two days with the cleaning of our room. But then it was solved.

4 days later we arrived to the hotel and our room was blocked, it was like 23:30pm the unblocked our room and 30 minutes later we received call, that they need to talk with me..why they call at that time? I went downstairs to the lobby and they told me my credit card was declined , they’ve tried like 10 times … they told me they need another credit card which I refused because they have charged me 3.200 USD and they have debited from my credit card… later on they tried again to charge me 3.200 USD again… how the hell they try to charge double? Or triple? With the authorization of ? The attitude of Alexander Martinez was horrible he almost threat us like criminals.. even though showing him the authorization of my bank he told us that he need other documents to prove we where not lying… why I am going to lie? I’m a Melia silver member and we are always treated like SILVER members in all our trips around the world we stay at Melia and we haven’t had any problem like this… after we show Mr Alexander de authorization number he changed his attitude… but sadly I received a message from my bank telling me they where  trying to charge again 3.200 dollars and there was other transaction for 200 dollars.. they blocked my credit card… I’m sorry but If they thought that for having a Visa Signature credit card or an American Express Platinum it doesn’t means I’m from the Rockefeller family, and seriously it is very disrespectful to do this kind of things. They blocked my card  they literally fu**** up our vacations. And we feel like criminals.

We seriously can’t believe that there where no apologies.

We check out the 27th of July, we are on August and it’s the time I haven’t received my hotel invoice for our stay as well as we received our Melia Points incomplete… 

We want to highlight the attitude of Roger and all the ladies (don’t remember their names)  they were kind and they helped me  solve a personal job situation.

We didn’t received the treat that we should…as well as they charged us more than the value it appeared when we booked… as well as they told me they will reimburse to my credit card the 100 dollars charge…I’m still waiting.

title: Excellent accommodations
text: I had an excellent experience. I checked in a bit earlier than the scheduled time very easily. Christina at the reception desk was courteous and accommodating checking in and out. I was very impressed with my room, it was quite & clean. Unfortunately I did not try the breakfast as I had to leave a bit earlier than the scheduled brunch time. Looking forward to return soon again.

title: Great Experience at this Hotel
text: We had a wonderful experience here! Due to delays in our apartment move-in date, we kept needing to extend our stay here. Christina was extremely helpful and kind. She was a pleasure to interact with over our few days here! Hotel was clean and abided by Covid-19 restrictions as well.

title: Innside New York NoMad
text: Excellent hotel! You might find the rooms a little on the smaller side compared to somewhere in the Midwest but that is expected. Customer service was exceptional! Staff was always super responsive to our needs!

title: Great Hotel-Great Location
text: This hotel on W. 27th St. in Manhattan is very close to the MTA on many different corners. It is very clean and has literally the best air-conditioning I’ve ever experienced in a New York hotel on a hot July week. The staff is friendly the bar is great and the Wilson restaurant is intriguing.The shower was fantastic and the beds comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel. We stayed for five nights and had zero problems.

title: Awesome!
text: Had a great stay at the Innside New York NoMad. The front desk staff, especially Alex, Christina, Kit and Ridge, were wonderful. They were very professional and accommodated my requests and provided helpful advice on places to go and where to have meals. The room that I was assigned was fantastic. It was very clean, comfortable and had a great city view of the Freedom Tower. I would definitely stay at this hotel on my next stay in NYC!

title: Vacations
text: Pretty hotel, located in Manhattan close to public transportation and Times Square and Empire Building.  Nice rooms, well serviced and very clean. No street noise whatsoever. Very secure place and friendly staff.

title: Perfect stay
text: Everything was amazing and perfect from the minute I stepped in the hotel to the minute I walked out........ loved it. Only I dumb complain, the water the I was given in the from desk at check in wasn't cold enough🙄that's just me though

title: Araceli Cruz Ojeda
text: Muy buen hotel, me gusto  la  respuesta final al problema del desayuno incluido ya que finalmente nos bonificaron la cantidad que nos habían cobrado de mas,  me gusto la habitacion, de lo que no nos informaron fue que nos podian proporcionar agua y cafe todos los dias, nos enteramos hasta el final de nuestra estancia.

title: Expensive for a small room and bad customer service
text: Very expensive for the tiniest room and smallest bathroom possible. Also, the strong lotion in the lobby is not good for people with allergies/smell sensitivities. We requested more towels for the room and it took over an hour to get them. We left after the first night because we weren’t happy with our stay and service. Two different people gave us different explanations of their cancellation policy, even when the reason we were leaving was the bad customer service and terrible room. Finally the manager spoke with us and said that we would only be charged for the one night we stayed and no other fees would be charged. I just saw my credit card bill with charges and I was definitely charged more than the one night stay. Very dissatisfied with my experience staying in this hotel.

title: Everything was perfect and the place is maintained very well.
text: Our stay was great considering my wife had to look after a 3.5 year old daughter and 3 month son for whom it was the first overnight stay outside of our house. There is a lot that the place offers like bikes to go around city but we could not use it. Maybe next time when it is just me and my Wife. my only gripe would be the 35 $ fee which was a little excessive considering all facilities could not be used and it included wifi use . Being a Melia Rewards Gold member I would have hoped that such fees are reduced for Gold and Platinum at the very least.

title: Wonderful hotel
text:
I had a fantastic stay in this hotel. The staff – especially Robert, also Cassie and Jhon – were wonderfully kind and helpful – they made me feel right at home. I can only recommend staying in this place when visiting Manhattan. 

Dr. Daniel Herz

title: NY 4th
text: Great location, amazing staff and customer service. This is a hip, quiet and very nice hotel. Definitely a hotel I will use again. Easy access to all parts of the city and walking distance to NY Penn station.

title: Never staying anywhere else!
text: Cassie and Robert at the reception were AMAZING. Always ready to help and make our stay even more pleasant. Besides the great location, the room & hotel itself were top quality with great service. Thank you for making our stay so memorable.

title: Great hotel at the heart of NYC
text: We loved the stay, Everybody is very friendly and willing to give the extra mile to make you feel welcome. Alexander Martinez did an amazing job, incredible value to the hotel experience. I recommended the hotel to all my friends and family.

title: Mostly Positive Experience With a Few Hiccups.
text:
Excellent location (mid-town & close to subway station and restaurants). Very clean room. Quiet on the 16th floor. Bed was very comfortable. Reasonably sized room for NYC.
Biggest issue was hotel restaurant. It was not open every day and did not serve breakfast (although it was advertised as doing so several places on-line). Restaurant menu was also odd, with several esoteric dishes at the expense of more "standard" fare. We mostly ate or drank somewhere else in our 7-day stay. Luckily, for breakfast, Friedman's is a short walk away and is excellent.

title: Clean and with good amenities, but BEWARE DECEPTIVE MARKETING DESCRIPTIONS
text:
Our stay at Melia Innside NOMAD was a mixed bag. The amenities, cleanliness, ambiance and location were all tiptop. The outdoor patio downstairs was a nice place to hang out and have a drink and the location is well positioned near metros and various sights, even the hotel restaurant, "The Wilson" was surprisingly nice, and quite busy to boot. BUT WE WERE GIVEN A ROOM WE DID NOT BOOK. We paid extra for a "CITY VIEW" room and expected to either see the financial district  downtown or of the Empire State building and etc uptown. WE SAW NEITHER. 

BEWARE, UNLESS YOU ARE ON FLOORS 18-20, YOUR VIEW WILL BE OF THE SURROUNDING BUILDINGS. The picture of the "City View" room online is taken from one of those top three floors, we were on floor 13 and had a "view" of the building across the street. Very disappointed. When we brought this up with the front desk, they said the upper floors were completely booked and that the 13th floor is considered "City View".  They offered us a room on the 15th floor, and late checkout as compensation..... Not worth the up-charge we paid.  Full disclosure we booked through a third party- COSTCO TRAVEL, so maybe they give the less desirable rooms to these travel partners. Unless you're lucky and land on 18-20, booking a "City View" room is more like booking a "no street noise" room as that was the only real benefit we got from being on the 13th floor. 

It was a major disappointment for our 1st anniversary.

title: The Innside Front Desk Staff
text: I just want to take a moment to say how wonderful Alex Martinez has been to me while staying at the Innside almost weekly through some of this pandemic.  Sweet as can be, makes sure I have water and a wake up time, even when i forget to ask.  He goes above and beyond for the customers and if you see him, please make sure to give him a big smile, he's got a fabulous one to that is always being shown!  Highly recommend this hotel and the fabulous Alex. Thank you for hiring such upbeat, personable hospitable staff to manage your locations!!

title: Weekend Getaway
text:
We just recently spent a weekend at INNSiDE when I took my daughter and her soon-to- be maid of honor to NYC to dress shop! The INNSIDE staff was so accommodating, responsive, and professional. The area felt safe and was within walking distance to everything we wanted! Everything from start to finish went smooth. 
The rooms were meticulously clean and the bed was so comfortable!
Having The Wilson restaurant there was so convenient and their staff went above and beyond also. 
I would definitely stay there again.

title: Birthday weekend celebration
text: What an awesome place! Beautiful room with terrace and great view. Andrew from guest experience, did a great job organizing the entire weekend. Whitney was so friendly checking us in to the hotel. Great weekend spent at a happening place. Highly recommend the Innside Melia. Great photo opportunities from the lovely Rose Garden to the black and white designed elevators.

title: Wow! Just Wow.
text: After a career in HR, this hotel has it down for hiring great staff and fabulous customer service.  Every staff member was friendly and helpful - - and really went above and beyond with all our requests.  Whitney & Christina rocked the front desk! I traveled from Oregon to meet family and spend two days in the City (including an appt at Kleinfelds). The location was great, easy walk to Kleinfelds and Madison Ave park (with Shake Shack), subway is close.  It was an easy walk from the new train station (wow! Penn station what a change!).  Room was small compared to Oregon hotels, but had everything we needed.  Beds were comfortable, linens were fine. Views were stunning on floor 19.  The Resturant "The Wilson" had a great happy hour. Covid wise, mask still required and many amenities were sanitized etc.

title: Great Art + My Godaughter, Perfection!
text:
Innside was well located for Chelsea Gallery visits. Close to Whitey Museum, Madison Square Park for the Mia Lin installation and dinner in Koreatown! Hotel staff was friendly, efficient and knowledgeable.
Lovely top floor room w city view. Great stay, thanks.

title: We will come back
text:
We came to visit our family and stayed at the Innside hotel for 8 days.
We didn't know what to expect, and we were very pleased to find a place to which we certainly will come back.
In one word: excellent!!
It starts with its great location, in the Chelsea area. It continues when you discover you arrived at a new hotel with spacious rooms relative to what is acceptable in Manhattan. 
More than anything, it is important to note the good spirit, the kind and dedicated staff (Alex, Kit and Christina whom we have met more than once) make a difference. 
In summary a hotel where the corridors are quiet and clean and, in the lobby, and restaurant next door you will always find young people that create a great atmosphere.

title: Fantastic Stay
text: Great staff, very accommodating, loved the night and day staff, great room and view, clean room with sealed towels, very cute and stylish, plan to return here again! Great location and has a bar/restaurant downstairs.

title: Excellent hotel & amazing stay!
text: We stayed at Innside NY Nomad for a little over a week. From the beginning til the end of our stay, we were delighted by our experience and stay at the hotel. We appreciate that Christina and Alex went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable and memorable by offering us great restaurant and activity recommendations. Our check-in experience was flawless, the rooms were clean and well-designed, the location was central, and the gym on the 20th floor was fantastic. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an enjoyable stay in NYC!

title: Charming hotel in Central location
text: Visited New York for first half of honeymoon and enjoyed our stay at INNside. Rooms were clean and quiet with a modern and hip vibe. Location is actually really convenient if you're trying to go to Times Square, Highline, Chelsea Market, Or Flatiron. It actually wasn't even that tough of a walk to NoHo. There are plenty of markets close by for any items you may need.  Hotel staff was excellent and very receptive and responsive especially Ridge, Kit and Whitney. They were always very welcoming, very nice and always seemed to have energy!  Thanks you three and the rest of the INNside staff for a wonderful stay!

title: Comfortable, Great Views, But Lacking on Service & Cleaniness
text:
I appreciated the great views from the bed and how well located this is. However, considering the times and lack of tourism, you would expect for the staff to be friendly. The staff was very cold, not friendly, and made it seem like dealing with a guest had to be completed in 60 seconds or less. No hellos, no good mornings, no good evenings, no recommendations, nothing. 

The rooms were comfortable, but small as is expected in NYC. The shower and sheets were the only places we didn't think were super clean, there was three broken tiles in the shower with dirty grout, dust/dirt in the corners, etc. A few random hairs on sheets/pillows at check-in. The floor, windows, etc seemed clean otherwise. 

The views are great, the area is safe. If you're chill and don't need much, this is a great option. If you're used to being greeted with a smile and expect warm hospitality from a 4 or 5 star staff, you will be disappointed.

title: Home away from home
text:
Whenever I come to the big apple my family and I stay here . Location is great , atmosphere is great ! The staff is great!!!
I wanted to especially give a big thank you to Whitney ( manager) !! She always has a great spirit and attitude. She takes great pride in helping not only me but all the guests here . I have watched her diffuse any issues and problems that guests have . I know there is no question that staying here is my first and only choice for travel ! Thank u Melia and thank you Whitney !!

title: GEM in NYC
text:
One of my favorite hotels in NYC.  This was my 2nd stay here (yes, it was that good) !  Great location close to subways, good restaurants and bars.

The rooms are gorgeous and spacious with great views. The hotel has a hip sexy vibe and has a beautiful restaurant/bar downstairs and an outdoor patio and lounge - and an interior courtyard with beautiful decor. The gym has a fantastic view and is kept very clean. 

Huge shoutout to Richard H (Manager) for the upgrade and the great service from the team. Everyone at this hotel is helpful, professional, and very generous with their time and info. 

I can't wait to come back!

title: Our NYC home away from home
text: We've been staying here as well as their other hotels in Paris since 2018. It's always a great experience. We are always remembered by the staff. And our dog Emily always receives an equally warm greeting.

title: One of the best Hotels in NYC
text:
Great Overall!

Would just like if Hotels showed more transparency when it comes to the fees (Facility Fee) and the Holding fee. Being shown when booking the room but that's not this Hotels fault.. that's just how it is.

title: Truly Exceptional
text: I am so thankful to Trip Advisor for helping me find this hidden gem of a hotel in New York.  The reviews here are 100% accurate.  The Nomad is a beautiful hotel located in the flower district just a very short walk to Penn Station.  The hotel is impeccably clean.  It feels cleaner than a hospital and one has no doubt that they take cleanliness very seriously.  The hotel is also very secure with security always present in the lobby and needing your key to access the elevator.  The rooms themselves are very modern and large with lots of space to store your things.  I stayed in a king room alone but this room could easily accommodate a couple for a week long trip or more.  The bed is also very comfortable.  And the room is very bright with floor to ceiling windows.  However, what makes this hotel truly exceptional is the the staff.  The staff from the front desk to housekeeping and maintenance to management are exceedingly attentive to every need.  They respond almost immediately and always leave you with the sense that they are genuinely happy to assist you and very appreciative for your business.  It is difficult to find good hotels these days and almost impossible to find exceptional hotels like this especially in New York and especially at these prices.  This is an absolute must and where I will be staying from now on when I travel to New York.  Highly recommend to all types of travelers.  You will be just a pleasantly surprised as I was.

title: Great stay!
text: Top notch from check in to check out.  We were there to celebrate my son's college graduation.  We wanted it to be a very special family event since Covid dictated a virtual commencement ceremony.  The entire InnSide staff was amazing. They went out of their way for us and made our stay extra special.

title: Loved our stay!
text: The staff, the hotel, the room was the best. We would absolutely stay here again. My only 2 complaints are they need to service breakfast and late night dining (even if it’s only room service or only for hotel guests). Lastly, they need to be more clear about additional fees such as the resort fee being taxed. Other than that, it was a great place!

title: Excellent Midtown Hotel
text: Chose to stay at hotel based on the recommendation of a friend.  Enjoyed the property and its in a very good location.  Was able to walk to many places around the city and had easy access to the subway and Penn Station.  The only issue that I had was that my room wasn't cleaned during my stay on April 25th.  Other than that it is an excellent property and the staff were great.  I would definitely stay again.

title: Not a great hotel for the money
text: This hotel was just fine. The staff was very nice and the best part of the stay but the room is bland and sparse. The bathroom is pretty stripped down and only fitted w pump soap which is annoying in the shower. The pillows are not very good and I felt like the layout of the room wasn’t so comfy. Meaning the tv was in a bad spot and there was this safe door that was permanently swung open jutting out as you passed by.

title: Amazing stay!
text: I love this boutique, somewhat new hotel.  I booked the double beds suite with a view. Like all NYC hotels, the room and bathroom are small but they made amazing use of the space making it feel larger.  Super clean, bright, and airy.  The tall window opens a few inches allowing for fresh air. Comfy beds, cool colorful led lighting, spa like vibe.  I will be back!

title: Great stay at the Melia Nomad NYC
text:
Robert, Christine, Kit and the entire team at INNSIDE by Melia in Nomad were warm, welcoming and accommodating throughout our entire stay. 

Comfortable and clean rooms. Great location and great value. 

We would absolutely stay at this hotel again.

title: Chic even during COVID times
text: The room was sanitized and cleaned very well. The interior design, lobby, elevator were all stylishly decorated. We stayed in Chelsea which was a great location. I recommend especially because of the value for cost.

title: Favorite stay in the city...
text: I’ve been here twice already with my boyfriend this year alone! We come here to treat ourselves time to time and love coming back because the staff goes above and beyond. Robert, Alex, and Whitney are unbelievably friendly— always accommodating our requests. The hotel has nailed the sanitation process and offers calm city views!!

title: Amazing experience, especially with Alex
text: My stay at the hotel was incredible. All of my little inane requests were field professionally and the team did their best to accommodate. Alex, the senior manager, went above and beyond time and time again to make sure I was taken care of. Will be back soon!

title: Lovely Stay
text: Definitely liked the vibe and ambiance of this hotel. The customer service was top notch from check-in to check-out, including the restaurant dining experience. Whitney at the first desk was amazing and gave me some great recommendations for dining in the area aside from the Wilson. I will be back again!!

title: Dirty coffee machine
text: I was very disappointed in receiving a coffee machine that was not cleaned out thoroughly. There was still nespresso capsules inside of the machine which led me to believe this machine was not sanitized. Considering the circumstances, this should have been clean out thoroughly. Same thing with the pet bowls. They had pet food reside inside.

title: It’s Cute!
text: This is a “girly” hotel. The ambiance is more catered towards women. The rooms are small it gives studio vibes, lighting in the rooms arent the best. It’s cute overall. The staff are amazing and super outgoing. Reception answers all questions and fufill requests as quickly as possible. Storage space in the rooms are adequate.

title: Great stay. Excellent Staff
text:
I stayed at the Innside recently for a week and had the most excellent stay. The rooms are spacious, clean, and provided excellent views of the City. The restaurant was amazing!
My stay was made even better by the hotel staff - Alex, Christine, and Whitney at the front desk, as well as Alex Castro in the Sales Dept. 
The COVID protocols were on point. It was overall a friendly and comfortable experience.
I am excited about my next visit and look forward to the Rose Fountain that I heard should be up by then.

title: A HOME AWAY FROM HOME GEM
text: Other than wishing they had soundproof rooms - I had an overall great experience. I would stay there again. Alex at the front desk was absolutely amazing! And the Director of Rooms Robert was great as well. They both represent the hotel brand very well with excellence.

title: Beautiful spacious vibrant room with lots of storage enjoyable outdoor space and castable tv. Just be aware of resort fe
text: The hotel was nice and it had a Beautiful and spacious, vibrant room with lots of storage ...enjoyable outdoor space and castable tv. Just be aware of resort fees!Definitely on my top 3 hotels to visit in the area.

title: First timer
text: Best experience ever especially since it was my first time in New York  and I loved the treatment from the moment I came to the moment I checked out and also food was great and greet you every time overall loved it

title: A NIGHT TO REMEMBER!!
text: WOW! If you are looking for a hotel for your vacation to NY, look no further!!!! This was the BEST HOTEL EXPERIENCE I have ever had (and I have worked at hotels and travel a lot so I know what customer service entails), and Innside NoMad exceeded every expectation! My boyfriend and I stayed one night for our anniversary, and it was definitely a night to remember! The excellent customer service began even before my arrival. I called ahead of time to confirm my reservation, and was greeted by the amazing manager, ALEX, who answered all of my questions and concerns, and he even said he would be expecting us the day we arrived. When we arrived, we were greeted and checked in by the wonderful, WHITNEY! Alex also came out to greet us as he said he would, so they really made us feel so special! They sent us an amenity for our anniversary, and later in the hotel room, my boyfriend and I got engaged!! Alex celebrated us, and thanked us for choosing Innside NoMad to share this special moment. Even the hotel engineer was so nice! Aside from the amazing staff, the room and hotel were absolutely beautiful and so so clean! Even with covid, I felt very safe and secure with the health and cleanliness precautions they had set in place. Also, the hotel was perfectly located and  just walking distance from the main attractions we wanted to visit. All in all, the Innside NoMad will always have a special place in my heart! Thank you again to the staff! I will definitely be booking again.

title: Great hotel
text: Great customer service whitney was very helpful! All staff including security very nice I enjoyed my stay ! Thank you keep up the great customer service. I have nothing else to say just trying to reach minimum thanks lol

title: Amazing Front Desk Staff
text: From the time I checked in until the day I checked out, Alex Martinez made sure I was taken care of. This pandemic has rendered many of us travelers a totally different hotel experience, but it's so great to know there are people such as Alex who provide a great experience not matter the situation. Thanks, Alex and team!

title: ALEX is the best! We love INNSIDE
text:
We’ve been in the midst of construction and have been staying in hotels a bunch lately. Now we stay only with INNSIDE NOMAD. 

When we couldn’t take the construction one more minute, I went online looking for hotels close to our business. We have driven past almost everyday for years. 

When I discovered the hotel online and saw rooms and they had terraces, I was sold. I booked a few nights and the rest is history!

From our first step through the door, we were greeted warmly. The woman (front desk manager at night) was lovely and accommodating and made us feel at ease. 

I said to my husband after she checked us in, do you think the hotel will be as nice as she says... She did not disappoint. So much so that we kept extending our stay. 

I would be remiss if I didn’t mention Alex. The daytime front desk manager. Every time we walked in or out he greeted us. He even asked about our puppy when she wasn’t coming back one night. 

This is a luxury hotel with heart and soul. The staff is gracious and kind and makes guests feel welcome. 

This is a 300 plus room hotel and we felt like the only ones there. They know what they are doing!

I highly recommend this hotel, if you book it, ask for Alex, (fabulous front desk manager) and tell him Dina and Guy sent you!

title: Whitney is AMAZING!!!
text:
I stayed at the Innside back in 2019, and I remember having such a wonderful experience. So, when I recently booked my stay (3/20/21) at Innside I wondered if my previous experience was going to be the same this time around. From the second I walked into the hotel,  I was greeted by Whitney and she could not have been more professional and welcoming. She made me feel just like I did when visited almost two years ago. I will be returning to Innside next month, so I am looking forward to my stay and seeing Whitney and the rest of the staff (and eating at Wilson's).

Sean C.

title: My Favorite Hotel
text: I first came to Innside for my birthday at the end of last year. Ever since my first stay, I have been back to Innside almost every month for business purposes. I love this place so much! The excellent customer service from Alex, Whitney, and the rest of the staff downstairs has been instrumental in why I've come back. I could choose to stay anywhere but I choose Innside because of the extraordinary experience here. Alex in particular goes above and beyond to make sure all my needs are taken care of.  From extra card keys, using the gym upstairs or suggesting places to go or see, I'm very appreciative for his upbeat attitude to genuine nature. It's so difficult to find hotels with exemplary customer service but I have never felt that while staying here. That is so important to me and I always feel like I'm right at home here. I will continue to say nothing but beautiful things about  Innside because I feel like I have a family away from home. It's been so great getting to know the staff here. Thankful to know Alex and couldn't imagine coming here and not seeing his lovely face. To me coming to Innside is not an ordinary experience. It's an international hotel located in the FIT area.  It's as if you're in Brazil or Paris but you're actually in New York. It's wonderful seeing people of all walks of life and ages come and stay here. I hope you'll decide to give Innside a chance.  It's definitely worth you're wild. You'll fall in love with this place in no time.

title: The Staff is The Best
text: I really can not say enough about the staff at the Nomad location. Alex is the best front desk manager. He truly makes my experience there great every time I stay there. I also love the food at the restaurant The Wilson's.

title: A great Valentine's day!
text:
Innside recently had a deal for Valentine's Day with The Wilson (the restaurant right in front of the hotel/on the same property) so boo and I took advantage! I'm glad we did! 

It was a busy check-in (everyone was boo'd up for the night!) but hotel staff kept things going smoothly. Despite the busy/hectic evening, Alex was super sweet when checking us in and getting us situated. Also, because I was in the lobby for a while I observed the security guard doing a great job of keeping strays from getting too far into the hotel. It was really busy so that was quite impressive!  

Our room had a city view, which was gorgeous. The bed was king-sized and the mattress comfortable (not too hard, not too soft!) so we got a good night's sleep! I also really liked the complimentary soap/lotion in the room (I think the brand was "Smile") - I think it had eucalyptus in it, it was so calming. 

Glad we got to try it for Valentine's Day. I would stay here again!

title: Innside
text: Decent stay with decent city view. Wasn’t able to get the room I booked due to overbooking but other than that, Stay was ok. The hotel also allowed late check out which was great so I’ll stay again for sure.

title: Great Stay !
text: I stayed at this hotel for one night during my birthday weekend. Front desk staff was very friendly and engaging. I’m sorry I forgot their names but they were the best! The room was very clean and Covid-19 safety precautions were in place throughout the hotel. I will be returning to this hotel anytime I’m staying overnight in the city!

title: GREAT NEW HOTEL / EXCELLENT LOCATION
text: New hotel with great rooms and views. Nice lobby, restaurant  bar and gym. It's in a great location near NoMad hotspots, and walking distance to a few different subway lines. Hotel Management was great. I can't wait to return and highly recommend !

title: Love this place!
text: I had a great time staying here at the beginning of February. The staff, both Alexandra & Alex, were extremely helpful, friendly, & accommodating. I would recommend this place to anyone I know coming into the city and I will absolutely be back again!

title: 5 stars for the hotel and 5 stars for Alex!
text: I had a great time during my stay at this hotel. Alex, the front desk agent was amazing, attentive, kind, and not that it matters, but very stylish! The room was gorgeous and the restaurant downstairs was impeccable. I’d definitely stay again!

title: Best hotel in NYC and staff is incredible
text: This is by far the best hotel I've stayed at in NYC and believe me I've stayed at tons of them. The townhouse suite with balcony was just perfect size and luxurious, even better in person than the photos I seen before booking. Their staff though went above and beyond to assure me and my parties stay was just perfect. Alex at the front desk was a pleasure to deal with but, Whitney Najee, the manager was such a sweetheart and went above and beyond to make sure our stay was a very memorable one. We will for sure be back here in the near future. Solid booking if I might say, even the Wilson there resturaunt was impeccable. Loved everything about the choice I made to stay here.

title: Great Beginning and End
text: My entire stay from beginning to end on New Year's Eve was exceptional! From check in to check out with Whitney who was attentive and very friendly. Shandana, the security officer was also very helpful and provided directions. My cousin and I had dinner at The Wilson Restaurant where Nancy greeted us and made sure that we were seated. Glenn made our dining experience more than we could have imagined. He too was attentive and had a sense of humor that was so memorable that we will be back soon. Our meal of choice was the Seafood Risotto that was absolutely delicious! Hats off to the chef. We ended our night laughing and having fun with my friend before retiring with warm showers. We slept ever so comfortably in our beds. Thank you to the Innside New York Nomad and The Wilson staff for a grand experience!

title: The best experience
text:
I was in the hotel with my boyfriend, it's our first time in New York. Our experience was truly amazing! Alex was amazing , he helped us since the first day  that we arrived and explained some recomendations about what we can do and visit.
Also due for Covid they have everything sanitized and you feel safe.

We want to come back to the hotel

title: Clean, cool & comfortable.
text: The rooms have a great vibe and efficient layout. We were on the 17th floor, and had a great view of the city. There are several cool outdoor lounging areas which is great for pandemic safety. We were able to get takeout and eat it in an outdoor lounge. Overall, we loved it and would absolutely stay again if the price is right. The lobby & areas are fun spaces, the elevator has interesting decor, it's just so clean and lovely, and we got a good deal. The only thing I didn't appreciate was that they add a "resort fee" which is apparently for coffee & gym? The coffee you have to request, and due to covid, you have to schedule a slot at the gym. Which was great, it's just a really odd thing to add a "resort fee" for things that are completely standard offerings.

title: Wonderful Staycation
text: I stayed at the INNSIDE New York Nomad for a birthday staycation. My experience was truly wonderful. I was greeted immediately at the front desk and the staff there was warm and friendly-thanks Rob. My room was spacious and well appointed and the view was amazing. As it was my birthday, the Director of Sales left a nice little surprise for me-thanks Alexandra. Overall the hotel was extremely clean with several COVID-19 measures in place, regular cleaning, sanitizing stations, temperature checks, and my room itself along with the towels, remotes, phones, etc had been sanitized and sealed prior to my arrival, which made me feel completely at ease. The Wilson was open for business with their outdoor patio set up and I definitely took advantage of that with to glorious meals. I could not have asked for a better stay and was sad to check out and return home. I highly recommend the INNSIDE to anyone traveling to NY, as it’s location is perfect and also to anyone already in NY if you want to slow it down and get away.

title: Worth It
text: Me and the boyfriend decided to do a staycation downtown in the city due to not being able to travel. Hotel was clean, spacious, and def up to code with Covid protocol. Would def recommend and stay again!

title: Survey
text: I travel to NYC very often and this was one of the best experiences. Only issue I had was the heat in our room was not working but they quickly tried to fix it and gave us a new room. Overall I would recommend.

title: Outstanding service and facilities
text:
Everything was just perfect! 
Great service, location, facilities with clean and comfortable rooms.
Robert, Alex and team were always very attentive and professional.  Thanks again
Hope to be back soon!

title: Excelent facilities
text: Excellent facilities, great location, clean, very clean. We arrived early in the morning and the personal in front desk help us with our doubt. The room is very confortable and super clean. In bathroom, very organized and with HOT water....this facilities was super great!!!!!

title: The Staff at Innside is amazing
text: This hotel is lovely. From the moment you check in until you check out it is a perfect experience. The front desk manager Alex is amazing. I was made to feel comfortable. The hotel is super clean. Hospitality is amazing.

title: Awesome
text: The room was clean, quiet with a fast WiFi service.Overall my staying at this hotel was pleasant everyone who worked there was very professional and provided good customer service.The only thing I wish was different is the parking situation.

title: The manager Robert Hughes wow!
text: I was here for one night from oct 30th to check out on the 31st. I was greeted as soon as I entered the lobby, I was very impressed by the hotels boutique privacy look. Every detail is truly inspired by the most modern look of fashion, hence why it’s the fashion district. Robert Hughes was very kind and professional, he answered all my concerns in regards to cleanliness due to covid situation. He was there for all of my request and made me feel right at home. The entire staff from the front desk to the house keeping are extremely attentive, I have the impression Robert is a senior manager; he is doing a fantastic job with them!. I will come back to this hotel and not look anywhere else. Thank you thank you thank you!

title: Fair Price for Beautiful Stay
text: Fair price for a lovely stay at this hotel. Everything is walking distance (nearby liquor and pharmacy for any other needs) and the hotel is beautiful. We were able to check in a little early and we received a free upgrade as well.

title: Good Experience
text: I stayed here a few weeks after they reopened and found the hotel very comfortable. The covid 19 precautions were very clear and followed by the staff. The room was very comfortable and the sound proofing from outside was excellent. The staff were very polite and kind. I would be happy to stay here again.

title: Nice place, Not-So-Nice Attitude
text: The establishment was awesome and I was very pleased. As far as staff all I can say is that the front desk/reception was judgemental and quick to assume. So I wont say anything bad about The NoMad because of a few employees that aren't skilled in their area of expertise if that's where management chooses to put them.

title: I got married at the Innside Melia Nomad! :)
text: So, I was supposed to get married on a private rooftop in Chelsea, but it rained heavily that entire day.  From the moment that I checked in, the Director of Rooms, Robert Hughes came to the rescue! I was clearly upset about the rain, but he put me at ease. He upgraded my room, and made sure I was all set with the accommodations. I noticed that there was an indoor/outdoor garden attached to the lobby, and inquired about possibly using it for my ceremony instead. To my surprise, Robert advised that I was able to use the garden with no problem! I was so thankful, because I did not have a plan B for the outdoor wedding. In short, the ceremony was absolutely exquisite! The garden lights, the sound of the rain - everything was just perfect. Hotel employees Angel, Jose and Alex all helped me with reservation changes, and any other requests that I needed while I was there. I would totally recommend having your ceremony or other special event onsite at the Melia Nomad hotel. The friendly and knowledgeable staff, the hip, cool property and the incredible, sweeping city views are all reasons to stay here. Thank you to everyone who had a hand in helping to make my day as special and as beautiful as it was. Robert especially, went above and beyond to help make our stay and wedding absolutely spectacular. The most important part, in my opinion, the photos, were simply stunning! Thank you!

title: Bring your own mug
text:
We were moving out of a building a block a way and need a place to stay after our furniture was gone.
Within the first hour of arriving we had to contact the front desk 3 times...
1) A coffee machine with mugs should have been in the hotel room, as this item is listed on the website, and very important for most working professionals.  When a coffee machine was brought up to us, it was brought with PLASTIC cups!! 
2) We called the front desk to ask for styrofoam or glass, and they told us because of covid they could not provide those, and proceeded to tell us where we could go buy styrofoam cups.  Fortunately we had little tin containers from our dinner delivery, which we cleaned out and used to drink our coffee out of in the morning. Ridiculous.
3) The TV in the room had no service, so a technician was sent to our, and he had to replace the wiring behind the TV.  We should not have been placed in a room where the TV was not checked, forcing us to let someone else in our room during covid.

title: Warning:  Hidden "resort fees"
text:
The hotel is great.  The staff is excellent.  The vibe is spot-on.  The rooms are designed with guest experience in mind.  Perfect, though there needs to be two hooks in the bathroom per person, one for towel drying and one for bathroom kit.   And the shower needs a mirror for shaving.  

Downside:  Room costs are actually $20 HIGHER than posted due to HIDDEN "resort fees"  After four years of Trump, haven't we learned that being honest is just better all around.  Why hide your actual fees.  And how absurd to call a cramped, though nice, Manhattan HOTEL a "resort" - that's just absurd.  

And yes - these fees ARE disclosed - but only AFTER you book....they are buried in the fine print and the Management loves to point that out as if after you click RESERVE under a "TOTAL = $215" button you're supposed to wonder whether the "TOTAL" is really the total or just a fake total that is the total of what you HOPE you're paying, knowing that the hotel is going to hit you with a "REAL TOTAL". 

This hotel had NO AMENITIES, they didn't discuss them on check-in and they certainly didn't reveal the "resort fee" on check-in either.  

It came as a total surprise.  And I'm a CFO, by the way.

title: Lack of Service
text:
I recently stayed at the Innside New York Nomad for a week.
Upon arrival the Receptionist after checking in informed me about the lack of service, no breakfast, lunch, dinner, bar, etc etc etc.................due Covid
First 2 nights they didnt clean my room nor change towels etc.....on the day #3 i jump to the front desk to request if also due Covid they were not cleaning my room
They apologies and sent me some one to clean my room....it was a fatal mistake
The house keeping lady excuse was: we are short staff, in fact she said was very busy due that, .............amazing for a Melia, i was in shock
Main areas like lobby or lobby terraza, etc were dirty, never saw in 7 days someone cleaning there......
No watter in room, no nothing, TV channels most of them didnt work.....as a recap, after many years of traveling to NYC, this has been the worst hotel ever
The cherry on the cake was, i requested previous my arrival, some type of upgrade if possible as i was celebrating as well, my 10th Wedding Anniversary
Never ever nobody did or said a word on that, total lack of interest and professionalism from the Staff.

title: unorganized
text: this was by far one of the worst experiences i've had at a hotel ever. well first i did an online checkin and let them know what time i would arrive at the hotel, checkin starts at 3 i arrived around 5:30 which they knew ahead of time. i prepaid for the room before i got there, once i got there i waited online for about an hour just for them to tell me the room was not ready and they were still cleaning it. so finally get to the room just to realize its not the townhouse suite i booked but a regular size room. i made them aware just for them to tell me the suite was not available, the price of the suite i paid for couldn't be adjusted to fit the room they gave me apparently and i was told by the front desk person that they would try to see what they could do after speaking to a manager but they never got back to me. being the person who i am i just accepted the room i had because i basically had no other choice.so not only did i pay for a room i didn't receive i realized that after i checked out they also charged me for the suite a second time, i called them and let them know the error that was made and i was informed i would be refunded once he realized the mistake but i have yet to be refunded and the 100 deposits i put on the room for incidentals i also haven't received back yet as well. this place is an unorganized headache and as much as i wouldnt like to get a lawyer involved i feel like thats my next step.

title: An execrable experience
text:
Decided to go to NYC with my partner for our wedding anniversary. I booked our 2 nights at the INNSIDE New York NoMad. 
Arrived at 9:00 knowing that check in is usually at 15:00. Asked to see if it was ok to do an early check in and they told me not at the moment until 13:00. We dropped our luggage and tour the city. Came back to the hotel at 14:20 and the room wasn’t ready. Front desk told me to wait 40 minutes. We sat outside and waited patiently. After 40 minutes passed, went back in and my room was still not ready. 15:00 they were so many people it was impossible to stayed inside the lobby. This time it was almost 16:00 and their excuse was that they didn’t have enough housekeeping and mentioned that the front desk manager was helping housekeeping with the cleaning. We didn’t get into our room until 13 minutes till 18:00. Exhausted, irritated and stressed. To make the trip even better. No hand wash was put in our bathroom. I was too exhausted to go back down and next day I asked to see if they could delivered a new bottle of hand soap. We check out the hotel and never brought up the hand soap. The lack of professionalism this hotel has its absolutely unacceptable. No apologize, no empathy or not even my money reimbursed. NOTHING! I can’t believe the people that work in this hotel are eligible to work without been professional. 
Our anniversary was stressful in this hotel and I will never come back! Nothing went right during the weekend. Absolutely unacceptable!

title: 10/10 Great hotel and great location
text:
Came to NY and stayed here for a weekend back in December with friends. My four friends and I were supposed to have two connecting rooms, but unfortunately, we got stuck with two rooms down the hall from one another. This was not a problem for us, but the hotel was very apologetic and even sent us a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolate. Very nice touch. The rooms here are small (to be expected in NY), but they are very clean and well kept. 

What made this hotel ideal for us was its location. It was perfect walking distance from everything we needed to get to. We had a great stay here and we would definitely stay here again.

title: Muy buen hotel.
text: Las habitaciones pequeñas, poca ventilación. Los trabajadores increíbles, una maravilla de ciudad y de recibimiento. De lo mejor al otro lado del atlántico, la gran manzana, ENJOY IN NEW YORK, IN INSIDE TO NEW YORK!

title: Meliá garantía en el extranjero Covi19
text:
Debido al Covi19 tuvimos que cancelar nuestra estancia el 4º día de estar alojados en el hotel, nuestra reserva no era modificable y el hotel sin ningún problema nos reembolsó el resto de días que ya teníamos anteriormente pagados (en puntos Meliá Rewards).

El personal de habla hispana excepcional, gracias por la acogida.

Nos alojamos en la planta 17 con vistas al Empire State, 100% recomendable.
La ubicación del hotel, excelente!!!

Mini bar, gimnasio, teléfono (llamadas dentro de eeuu) y limpieza, están incluidos en las tasas que se pagan a diario.

Repetiremos en nuestro próximo viaje a NY.

Gracias por la acogida.

title: Perfect hotel for a quick New York getaway
text:
During my last overseas trip I extended my layover so that I could spend a full 24hours exploring the city. The Innside Hotel was perfectly positioned for my trip for easy exploration of the City. The hotel was modern and very well designed. The room was great, very clean. 

I stopped into the gym in the morning, clean and amazing views! 

To top it off the front desk staff was so accommodating, helpful and friendly. Especially Kit, he assisted with recommendations for exploring as well. 

I highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

title: Esperábamos más...
text:
Instalaciones y ubicación excepcional.
Desorganización en recepción (no encontraban nuestra reserva, nos hacían pagar el desayuno cuando lo teníamos incluído en el precio, largas esperas, no nos contabilizaron los puntos en tarjeta Melia Rewards ...). Salíamos del hotel a primera hora y a las 17-18h la habitación todavía no estaba limpia, cada día tuvimos que esperar y reclamar. A pesar de todo, el personal muy amable y predispuesto.

title: Una buena sorpresa
text: La habitación cuádruple, era amplia y las camas cómodas, todo muy limpio y todas las personas que nos atendieron, tanto en recepción como en cualquier puesto del hotel fueron encantadores. Mención especial a Diana, Alex y Javier que nos hicieron sentir en casa y nos ayudaron en todo. Incluso aunque no todos lo trabajadores sepan español se esfuerzan en entender y hacerse entender para poder ayudarte, lo cual se agradece mucho. En cuanto a la ubicación la recomiendo está a medio camino entre la 42( pero sin tanto jaleo) y el Soho y la parte baja de Manhattan . Cerca del Ironflat , muchos restaurantes, entradas de metro. En fin , la próxima vez que vuelva a Nueva York iré a este hotel.

title: Acogedor y muy bien situado
text: Está muy bien situado para visitar Manhattan. Todos nos trataron muy bien. Especial mención a Hugo que se preocupo de que estuviéramos bien en todo momento y nos dio consejos sobre que cosas visitar. Al irnos se encargaron de salir a buscarnos un taxi (el aeropuerto estaba a 1 hora y media y no todos los taxistas aceptaban porque algunos terminaban su turno).

title: Very Pleasant stay
text: Overall it was a very good experience and good value. The room was very nice and comfortable, I like that there was no carpet in the room. Good location and the bar/restaurant staff was terrific! We loved that there was a patio for visits too.

title: Eh. Sterile. Small rooms. Nothing Special
text: Eh. Sterile. Small rooms. Nothing Special Room service was hard to deal with and not always offered. The manager was useless. The hotel might as well be a motel 6. You get about the same from both. Eh

title: Great Hotel
text: Very nice, clean hotel with extremely pleasant staff. Room are comfortable size for a hotel in the city. The vibe was upbeat.  Both check in and check out were smooth and efficient. Didn’t eat at the restaurant- so I can’t comment on the food.

title: Estancia en Nueva York
text:
El hotel está muy bien ubicado y conectado. Puedes visitar múltiples lugares andando (el día que asistimos a un musical en Broadway pro ejemplo, decidimos ir andando). 
Habitaciones limpias y amplias, muy bien iluminadas. Personal amable y siempre dispuesto a resolver tus dudas.
No perderse las vistas de la planta 20!

title: Weekend in NYC
text:
My children have lived in New York almost 20 years and this hotel has become my favorite.  Great location, lovely rooms and their restaurant The Wilson is wonderful.
Alex Martinez at the front desk made our stay extra special.  Thanks Alex for your hospitality.

title: Melia una garantía
text:
Con mucha ilusión iniciamos el viaje a Nueva York el martes. La elección del hotel fue un absoluto acierto. El Innside New York Nomad tiene una situación fantástica, tiene buenas instalaciones pero, sobre todo, tiene un personal excelente. Con respecto a la situación, está muy cerca de Times Square y al lado del Madison Square Garden. En relación a las instalaciones, la habitación era grande, nueva y estaba muy bien acondicionada (destacamos también el buen nivel de limpieza). Por último, y para nosotros lo más importante, en lo referente al personal quedamos tremendamente agradecidos, especialmente con el equipo de recepción. Con anterioridad a la propagación del Coronavirus, ya fueron muy amables para recibirnos y resolver todas nuestras dudas; con posterioridad a la declaración del Estado de Alarma en España, nos han facilitado con gran comprensión todas las gestiones para dejar el hotel. Por este motivo, Meliá siempre es una garantía y queremos reflejar nuestro especial agradecimiento en esta situación nada convencional.
Muchas gracias y ¡ojalá que hasta la próxima!

title: RIP OFF HIDDEN CHARGES
text:
Found $200 of Hidden charges on my credit card after the stay. Booked through Hotels.com and paid in full in advance. Found a $200 charge on my credit card after the stay. Called the hotel to inquire and was told it was a $35 a night service fee for the so called 'complimentary' mini bar and gym access. 
Wasn't made clear there would be the charge on hotels.com and wasn't told at check in or check out. Only found out later. Complete hidden charge rip off. Avoid

title: NYC & Buffalo
text: Overall, my experience at the hotel was great.  The hotel rooms are great for one person, but might be tight for a couple including luggage.  The in-room services were good, but the coffee option would be better if it wasn't espresso based, but more mainstream coffee.

title: Absolutely fantastic hotel!
text: We really enjoyed our 6-night stay at this amazing hotel in Midtown/Chelsea! The location within NYC was perfect - easy to get to uptown, downtown, Brooklyn, Penn Station, airports, etc... We would be out all day exploring and looked forward to our return back to the room at Innside, our home base for a week. Our room had 2 Full beds and it was super comfortable, very quiet, and impeccably clean. The view was the back of the hotel but it was a still a good view and really quiet, couldn't hear anything. We really loved how the rooms have hard wood floors not carpet. The size of the room was big compared to other hotels in NYC. The bathroom was also big and we appreciated all the amenities (shampoo, conditioner, and body wash pumps in the shower, etc..). The hotel itself has a very cool vibe, a spacious layout with different patios, seating areas, downstairs work area, and has the nicest staff working there. They were all so very helpful and super friendly. My family and I will definitely return and stay at Innside. We highly recommend this property!

title: Christina Colderon was amazing!
text:
We checked in for my wife’s birthday and Christina was amazing! From the time we checked in to the time we checked out she was there for whatever we needed.  She was always cheerful and pleasant and provided outstanding customer service.  We are Circle members of Meliá and she was by far the best employee we have come in contact with all around the world.  Hotel was great and couldn’t of been better. 

Thanks Christina for all that you did to make our stay amazing! 

Rob & Sadie

title: Excellent, cheap and clean
text: Very nice, very reasonably priced, very nice and helpful staff and very clean. I love that the rooms have wood flooring and not gross carpet. Comfy beds and bedding. Nice size room.... I will be back.

title: Nice and clean, surprising service charge...
text: The hotel and the rooms have a nice, modern and clean look. Comfy beds. The hotel is in walking distance for a lot of the things to see in New York. And it's not far from subway stations to take you all over town. We were surprised about the service charge that we learned about when checking in. Adding the service charge to the room price, increased the cost quite a lot - making the price/value compared to other hotels different. Going to New York another time I would read the fine print, and probably stay at another hotel.

title: Excellent service at conveniently located hotel
text: The staff at the Mélia is what sets this hotel apart. The rooms are nice enough (clean enough/no bugs, comfy bed, spacious) and the location is excellent for getting other places (Flatiron isn't the best place just to hang out), but the staff itself was very helpful. From helping me seamlessly extend my stay, to dealing with another guests detailed requests in another language, to making sure the gym was stocked with Lysol wipes during the Coronavirus panic, the service was above and beyond. Shout out to Javier, Christina and Nalini at the front desk/lobby!

title: NYC Trip 2020
text: When they say everything is small (places to live) in New York, they really mean it.  I liked how the mini bar was included, I wish we had a microwave though.After getting over the size of the room, the location was very convenient to get around Manhattan.  The staff is nice and very accommodating. All-in-all the stay was nice, especially with public transportation and Starbucks just around the corner.

title: problemas con mi tarjeta visa
text: me han hecho cargos a mi tarjeta por valor de casi 300€,que yo no he realizado,espero que me sea devuelto cuanto antes esta cantidad. en caso contrario tendré que tomar medidas legales contra el establecimiento.

title: Geheimtipp in Manhattan
text: Lage perfekt in der Nähe zum Madison Square Garden. Sehr ruhig, für NYC. Man hört die Stadt nicht.  Zimmer sehr sauber und modern. Großes Dankeschön an Kim, Christina und Kit !!! Sehr empfehlenswert für den Preis. Unbedingt Zimmer in Etage buchen.

title: Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo
text: Un ottimo hotel, giovane e con personale cortese. Io viaggiavo per lavoro ed è importante quando si torna trovare un ambiente presso il quale si sta bene. La colazione offre una buona scelta ma il costo (della singola colazione) è elevato. Si trova di meglio in città a quel prezzo.

title: Gone downhill
text:
This is (was) my preferred hotel of choice in NY when on business and have stayed many times. So much so that I battled to get the hotel added to my companies preferred hotel list and I’ve stayed here at least ten times now. 
This time around I noticed a sharp decline in standard, I’m not sure if they are trying to cut corners to save money but it feels like it.
The reception staff are still great but the room service is awful.
No coffee pods
No biscuits
Fresh juices have been replaced by carbonated drinks and a carton of water
No toiletries
Mini bar not restocked daily
Paid for city view room and colleagues who hadn’t the paid for upgrades were upgraded to better rooms

I mentioned concerns to front desk and was told that they would make it up to me next time but I don't think that there will be one as it’s time for a change. 
A average rating is now representative of value for money as there is little to set this hotel apart.

title: Great location, lovely hotel would definitely return
text: Booked here for a 5 day trip in NYC and the location was fantastic, only 10 minute walk from Empire State Building and great access to the Metro to all the sites. Hotel has a great vibe and lovely decor. Bedrooms and bathrooms well equipped and great size considering it's a city hotel! Would highly recommend to anyone. Staff were very welcoming and helped with all our needs. There is a gym there and has the best views of the NYC skyline.

title: Me ha gustado mucho el hotel
text: Es un hotel moderno con habitaciones bonitas y baños muy funcionales, yo he estado muy a gusto. Muy buena ubicación a solo una para de en metro a Times Square. Lo único que la de la limpieza debería estar algo más Atenea, no limpiaba bien el espejo

title: Super!
text: Leuk, hip en gezellig hotel! Vriendelijke mensen, vooral die meneer uit de domenicaanse republiek, ik ben zijn naam kwijt, erg met hem gelachen en hij gaf ons goed advies en leuke tips. Ons zoontje kreeg als verrassing heerlijke chocolade op de kamer!

title: Nice rooms - pathetic room service
text:
This place has a lot of good things going for it. Rooms and beds are very nice. Bathrooms are nice. The front desk is professional and the overall hotel is clean and nice. The gym is small but decent and I was able to get a solid workout. 
The cons: The worst - and I'm not being hyperbolic - worst room service I have ever experienced. Cold, small, extremely overpriced and served in a cheap paper bag. I've had better room service a the Days Inn in the middle of nowhere. Borderline criminal what they charge for this poor service.
Also there is a $40 daily charge for the fridge contents- but there's nothing but cheap soda and one carton of water. Pretty sad. 
Also TV/Movie choices are almost obsolete and well below par of hotels these days

title: Overall very impressive. I will be staying here again and recommending it to my friends.
text: My wife and I had a great time and a great value for NYC. Melissa at the front desk made our check in process easy and added some extras. I was very pleased to get a heads up that there is a mandatory $40/night facility charge when checking in instead of like other hotels finding out hidden in the bills at check out. She was very courteous and accommodating. The bar was good, but I cannot recommend the breakfast buffet for $28. The box water in the room is also hard to drink with a weird after taste. Overall we had a great time and will be staying here again!

title: Buen hotel. Céntrico
text: Cuando reserves ten en cuenta que te aplicarán una tarifa de servicio de 35 $ + tasas (supuestamente por el uso de Wi-Fi gimnasio y minibar gratuito, Nespresso en la habitación, pero no hay opción si no lo deseas). Aunque se advierte en la reserva suele pasar desapercibido debería estar incluido en el precio de la habitación. A tener en cuenta también las tasas turísticas de la ciudad de Nueva York

title: Lush
text: Stayed for a business trip last minute. They had the rooms I wanted available and the price for the room being close to everything was great. View of the city was awesome and the lounge area was very lively. I would certainly come back if the opportunity presents itself.

title: Muy recomendable
text: Estancia muy agradable del 22 al 28 de febrero. La situación es ideal. En la misma calle tienen una boca de la estación de la Línea 1. Restaurantes y locales de Jazz alrededor. La habitación muy acogedora. Cama amplia y cómoda, baño funcional con ducha espaciosa. Cafetera y nevera en la habitación. El personal muy agradable. Especial mención para Hugo, guest sperience, muy simpático y resolutivo. El hall no es tan amplio como suelen ser los de la cadena, pero agradable.

title: Piacevole soggiorno
text: Ho prenotato alcune volte in questo hotel, accogliente sebbene moderno, in ottima posizione. Personale accogliente e preparato. Ho usufruito anche della colazione, ottima e abbondante. Ci tornerei in futuro

title: Muy recomendable.
text:
Las instalaciones fantásticas , camas y almohadas muy cómodas.
El tener cafetera en la habitación es muy cómodo todos los días te reponen café , leche , ademas de agua ,  zumos , Coca Colas .
El personal es muy atento y siempre dispuesto a ayudarte , mencion especial para Alex que fue el que nos recibió atendiéndonos en español , también mencionar Javier , Jorge , kit y Robert , gracias a todos ellos nuestra estancia ha sido perfecta y recomendamos el hotel por que sin duda volveríamos.

title: Ok hotel let down by poor housekeeping
text: The hotel itself was quite nice and good value for the price we paid.  The rooms are basic but comfortable.  The bathroom was tiny and as others have commented there was no room to put anything.  All of that would have been fine but the room was not cleaned properly when we arrived and got worse throughout the stay plus the amenities were not replaced consistently each day.   It actually felt quite dirty by the time we checked out.  For this reason I would not recommend this hotel.

title: Terrible Hotel
text: I will never stay here again. The rooms was not well taken care of, almost no bathroom counter space, no towel bars. They forgot our towels after room service and it took 3 trips to get the proper towels. They charge a "facilities" fee of $30/night that basically gives you free water in the room, but you have to ask for it.

title: Not Thrilled
text: I am disappointed my  iPhone charger was not returned after I had left in my room after check out. Room was not that clean. The complimentary  beverages were appreciated. The staff was courteous and attentive. The location is convenient to Penn Station

title: Surprise Fee
text: Not a bad hotel, terrific location. But be prepared to pay an additional $40+ PER DAY fee they charge when you check out. They explained to me that it covers the mini fridge, the Wi-Fi, and access to the gym. None of which I really cared about. On top of that, we got no maid service on one day. They never came to the room at all during the day. Comfortable hotel, but they are absolutely gouging with that daily fee. Be prepared to pay it.  The rate might look great online, but make sure you add that amount per day. They don’t advertise that. They surprise you with it when you get there. Otherwise, not a bad place.

title: Visita turística familiar
text:
El hotel tiene unas excelentes instalaciones, la habitación sin ningún tipo de objeción, magnífica ubicación y unas maravillosas vistas.
Todo esto es importante para un recurso residencial, pero, lo es más, si el personal del hotel entiende la importancia de su trabajo, y demuestran su profesionalidad en cada una de sus tareas. Durante nuestra estancia pudimos contrastar esa forma de trabajar, todos ellos, nos atendieron, además, con gran cariño, en especial Hugo, Javier, Cristina y Jenny.
Enhorabuena a INNSIDE por ofrecer este magnífico recurso.

title: Very pedestrian hotel
text: If you need a room, a bed and a shower with a Nespresso machine, this is your hotel. Aside from the the Nespresso machine, there were no frills. The people who worked at the hotel were lovely, though the rooms were small and bland. It is a short distance to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden. I’ve stayed at many hotels throughout New York and would not rush to stay at this one again. The only reason we selected it was that it was close to our class in the city and was reasonably priced.

title: Genial!
text: Hotel con un diseño moderno, habotaciones muy limpias y cómodas y de estilo más europeo que americano en su decoración. No soy muy fan de las típicas habitaciones de hotel con muchas cortinas y sobretodo moquetas por eso elegimos el hotel Innside en NY y fue todo un acierto. El hotel bonito y acogedor, el personal muy atento y el desayuno muy bueno. La localización está muy bien.

title: It's the little things that count
text: Hotel/room was mod, extremely clean, spacious and very comfortable.
