They paid extra attention to the little things... great bathroom amenities, free water & soda in our mini fridge, best coffee maker we have ever had in a hotel room, an umbrella (which was vital on our first day).  All the staff were very friendly and Hugo was a great host!

title: Going down
text:
Been here many many times . Sorry to say that it is going down and down. Unprofessional and extremely rude Feliciano receptionist made our stay a nightmare. We never experienced a worst customer service in 30 years in the US.
This place has been our home away from home from many years. Now is just another dirty place in NYC.
It is not a new gym or a Friday night deejay that make a place better, it is the care you put in make your customers at home!

title: A sour ending
text: The hotel was nice although the rooms were not cleaned well with clumps if hair under the bed, however the BIG issue was to come home to get a £654 credit card statement where they took the city tax of 128$ seven times??? So someone in admin doesn’t know what they are doing! I then spent 30 mins calling the USA from the UK to try to sort do will get a large phone Bill now too! Could even be going legal if monies not returned!! We had a great week in New York but this hotel group just took the edge of it!!

title: Una decepción
text: Me he alojado más veces en hoteles Meliá y siempre ha sido fantástico, pero este hotel ha resultado una completa decepción. Una vez hecha la reserva, nos informaron por correo de que además del precio fijado, el hotel cobra 35 dólares por noche por el uso de "las instalaciones, la máquina de Nespresso y el minibar". Nos sorprendió y cuando lo buscamos en la página de Meliá, sí que se informaba de esto, pero en la letra pequeña de las condiciones de la reserva. Nosotros no lo vimos, es verdad, pero esto debería informarse, previo a reservar, de una manera más visible. Sobre los servicios del hotel por los que se pagaba, en alguna ocasión se olvidaron de reponer el agua o el café del minibar (por lo que recordemos, pagabamos obligatoriamente 35 dólares diarios) y en otra ocasión nos encontramos el suelo del baño sin barrer. Hubo además un día, en el que volvimos a medio día y la habitación aún no estaba hecha, si bien es cierto que cuando lo dijimos en recepción nos la limpiaron enseguida. A parte de la amabilidad del personal, destacar positivamente la ubicación, que era inmejorable.  Todo el personal, en este sentido, muy amable. En definitiva, no vale la pena, resulta muy caro para los servicios que da.

title: Mi más reciente viaje a New York
text:
New York,es una ciudad en permanente cambio. De modo que uno conoce en cada viaje nuevos
lugares siempre, nuevos restaurantes, algunos bares con música en vivo. Fuimos a Eataly es un lugar donde hay
varios restaurantes. Pero tambien venden quesos,carnes,etc.
Fui al Metropolitan Museum que me gusto mucho.
 Y fui al Bar Terra Blues en Greenwich Village,donde escuche un excelente grupo, con un priemara guitarra
 excepcional.

title: Don't book the Townhouse Suite
text: I am a Melia member and love the chain, but our stay at this location was very disappointing. We had one of the Townhouse Suites on the 20th floor (room 2006). The suite's design was so off, that I was very surprised as I know that Melia prides itself with being modern and designed well while being very functional. It felt like they tried to furnish a suite with exactly the pieces of furniture that go into a single room, hence it felt empty. There was nothing on the walls either (including no hooks for towels in the bathroom), not a single picture. The A/C was so loud and constantly running that we had to shut it off all together. When we took a shower, the bathroom floor was flooded. Also, you entered the suite into what could be described as a living space. From that room, you could enter the bedroom to the right or the bathroom to the left. There was no direct way to get from the bedroom to the bathroom. The breakfast was ok, but very basic and not as spectacular as it was advertised. The hotel seems to make extra income on the side and has rented out a part of what was formerly the breakfast room to "Kettlespace" a co-working chain in New York City. Extension cords all over the place to provide extra outlets, it didn't look safe. I hope our experience for this one night stay was unique, but there are better options for $450/night (incl. breakfast). We won't return.

title: Modern Hotel, Big on Personality, Service, and Value
text: I travel monthly back to NYC and return to this property time and time again.  Although you might not think of the Brand for business travel - the rooms are spacious, efficient, modern, and well appointed - room to work, spacious bathrooms and the staff is beyond accommodating.  Hugo is the Guest Services Manager who makes it his business to ensure his guests are welcomed, valued, and surprised with small but meaningful "VIP" gestures.  Its a great choice regardless of purpose.

title: Very hip and trendy hotel in the heart of Chelsea
text: Had a fabulous Valentines weekend at the INNside by Melia in NY.  Friendly staff and very hip hotel in the heart of Chelsea.   Location was perfect to walk too 5th avenue, Chelsea Market and the High Line.  Loved the restaurant The Wilson and our friendly bartender Neema. Food was great and so was the wine!  This hotel would be a great consideration for a small NYC meeting at a very reasonable price point.  I highly suggest and will return again soon.  And thank you Alexandra! :)

title: This is an amazing hotel and the customer service is exemplary!
text: Jose at the front desk delivered to me amazing customer service . I felt at home and comfortable entering the hotel and during my stay . The room was clean and gorgeous, and I even felt comfortable walking without sandals . Ahaha some hotel rooms you need to use sandals to walk in the room . The slippers were a very homey touch , and I appreciate all that was done .

title: DID THE JOB
text: This hotel was recommended to us as being in a good location close enough to Times Square but far enough away at the same time and also having all the necessary facilities. And it did. Our bedroom was well enough equipped and not noisy. Wifi worked well throughout the hotel including the bedroom. The shower in the bathroom worked well too. Space in the bathroom was pretty tight. The hotel has a bar diner called Wilsons which is leased out and is very popular but pricey. Front of house staff were excellent as indeed were all of them. Not a huge choice of eating establishments in the area. We were happy enough with the offering but taxes fairly bumped the price of a stay up.

title: Great location
text: We come just about every year and stay at this hotel because of the location and the room quality.  The rooms are modern and clean.  The amenity fees are my only concern.  To charge $20 a day for slow internet and inconsistent replenishment of coffee and condiments and little flexibility on the minibar such as swapping water instead of sodas is an issue.

title: Amabilidad absoluta del personal de recepción.
text: El menú del restaurante es repetitivo y corto.Creo que deberían ampliarlo y, si fuese posible, aumentar la carta de pescado.Los postres son buenos y las cosas están bien cocinadas.Especial mención para el personal de recepción.Su amable disposición para ayudar es simplemente maravillosa. Especial mención para HUGO que , entono momento,nos trato estupendamente.

title: Tucked away on West 27th Street
text: I do not know if the price we paid for the hotel was because of the season, but I would have paid more for what I got in any other neighborhood of NYC. The hotel is straight the point. No large lobby or useless space. An active lounge as you enter to the right and the hotel lobby to the left. Check in was painless. Staff was friendly and upbeat. Our room was clean, modern, and smelled good. No odors being masked my chemical sprays. Not a large room, but that would have been unnecessary for our purpose. The bathroom was clean and the walk in shower provided two shower heads. Also included was body wash, shampoo, and conditioner. We didn’t utilize room service or any eatery establishments in the hotel. We would recommended and use again.

title: Fine for a night
text: We stayed in the Double Queen room facing the street. Pros: Room was quiet, clean, beds comfortable, and everything worked. Cons: Room was small, not enough hooks in the bathroom to hang towels, beverage center was useless bc you could only make one size coffee since only the smaller espresso cup could fit under the spout. These are small "cons," but after a few days, they would become annoying. The major negative at this place is the $40 daily service fee. They tell you this will cover all the juice, tea and coffee you would like.  However, they only carry one type of tea and coffee, so if you would like something different, say herbal, you have to go to the restaurant and pay $5 for the tea. Seems that they should carry at least a few extra varieties for the $40 surcharge. My advice to the hotel: Skip the surcharge and add a few $ to the overall price, or actually make people feel like they are getting something extra. All in all, it was a fine stay. I would stay here again. At the price point, it is about as good as you will find in the city.

title: Great Hotel
text:
Great Hotel in a very good location. Everything was fine, but Hugo was the best!
Perfect host and a good reason to come back again. He and the team did a great job.
But next time we will use the restaurant, which really looked very good .

title: Hotel de cadena española, en el que no se habla español
text:
Desde la entrada tuvimos problema para que nos atendieran en español, a pesar de ser una cadena española y uno de los motivos para elegir el hotel.

A pesar de haber pagado con antelación toda la reserva nos exigieron que enseñáramos la tarjeta de crédito con la que la habíamos garantizado 8 meses antes. Al no llevar esa tarjeta (había caducado) fueron muy intransigentes.

title: Cool Vibes with some hassle
text: You will be forced to pay for Wifi and your refreshments even though they say its free. It is billed in their "facility" fees that around $40 DAILY! again you are forced to pay this even if you dont want or use any if it

title: PERFECTA ESTANCIA
text: Recomeindo al 100% este hotel. Tiene una gran ubicacion y magnificas instalaciones. Las habitaciones muy comodas, un excelente trato de todo el Staff y en especial, el gran trato del Sr. Hugo Gonell, que hizo de nuestro estancia una gran experiencia.

title: Really TOP
text:
Again, this is already my third time in this Melia Hotel.

I have enjoyed again the very nice suite on 18th floor with a nice terrace with great city view.
I really appreciate the location, nearby everything.
Excellent service and attention, and very confortable.
Clean, modern and large rooms especially for NYC.
Good bathroom.
Cool lounge/bar/restaurant with nice music.

The service and attention is more than great, this is top of the top.

The Melia Reward program is also very good.

title: Todo perfecto!
text:
Estuvimos alojados del 25 al 30 de diciembre y disfrutamos muchísimo de la ciudad,del ambiente navideño y del hotel.
Está bien ubicado,en la 27,cerca de casi todo y muy bien comunicado con el transporte púbiico.A cinco minutos del Madison Square Garden.
A la vez es una calle tranquila y silenciosa para descansar.Las habitaciones son amplias,von todo lo necesario y Wi-Fi gratis..aunque en New York hay Wi-Fi gratis por toda la ciudad!
Es un hotel nuevo,moderno y con encanto..con un desayuno buffet completo y estupendo y que luego se transforma en restaurante y por la noche además en un bar de copas muy chic.
Es ideal para parejas,para negocios y para ir con niños también perfecto!Con bonitas vistas y una terraza estupenda para salir,tanto en invierno como en verano..a tomar algo,a leer..mientras estás envuelto por el ambiente y la ciudad de lis rascacielos.
Sin duda es una buena elección alojarse en el Innside Nomad.Disfrutarás del hotel.Disfrutarás de Nueva York.

title: MY WIFE’S BIRTHDAY
text:
Had a wonderful time and our thanks to Cristina!!!  Only minor issue was the internet....Thanks!!!
As a frequent guest to the Melia Castillion in Madrid and a few other Melia’s I am very familiar with their hospitality and interior appointments. It’s a unique hotel chain no matter was city you are staying. Always though the staff makes a large difference.

title: Another amazing Melia experience
text: Rock solid consistency from this hotel chain that we use regularly, due to their consistent performance. This was no different. Great experience, and really found the room comfortable. Great location, which we walked everywhere from.

title: OVERCHARGED
text:
So we get to the hotel and after paying £2000 for a holiday we are then told we need to pay $125 dollars for 5 nights or WiFi, which I had to choice to agree to.

The hotel then took another $125 from my card the next day which I was not told about which is just lovely when you’re on holiday.

On return to the U.K. they took another £112 from my account which I have happily reported to the bank as fraud.

Only stay here if you have cash that you don’t really need.

title: Hotel recomendado
text: Hotel bien situado y habitación acogedora.La habitación es de buen tamaño para una pareja.Recomendado 100%. Buen trato en recepción. Hacen lo posible por ayudarte. El primer contacto fue súper amable. Está genial comunicado.

title: Perfecto para familias
text: Trato excelente. Habitaciones amplias con 2 camas de matrimonio. Servicio Melia Rewards sin ninguna pega. El desayuno es lo mas flojo del hotel, pero tiene en los alrededores muchas pfertas para desayunar

title: Maravilhoso!
text:
Hotel novo, limpo, com staff muito atencioso. Cafe disponível no quarto e água na recepção. 
4 elevadores rápidos com uma decoração incrível. Ressalva apenas para a academia, que está localizada no último andar - fiquei no penúltimo andar e fui acordada todos os dias com alguém estava malhando - necessita urgente de isolamento acústico.

title: Not for family maybe for business
text:
Have spent the week-end with my family. Hotel not adapted for that 
The breakfast is not at the standards of a melia hotel. The team is sociable a d professionnal . The rooms are too small and sometimes 
noisy. May be suitable for business

title: Great hote with a hidden suprise, nightly rip off
text: This was a very good hotel with brilliant staff in a good area for all attractions. But lets itself down by adding a $35 charge per night for so called room facilities, unsecured wi-fi despite paying for it

title: Kit was the best to work with!
text:
I do events for a living and I work with so many hotels and Ive never worked with someone like Kit before, he was detail orientated, collaborative and attentive. Such a calm cool and collected presence. If great customer service is important to you, you’ll be so impressed! 

The hotel is cute,  quaint, great cleaning, comfortable beds. I’ve held events here for a few years and they never disappoint. Will always be coming back 😊

Thank you, Kit and team!

title: Excellent, convenient hotel.
text: This was a very nicely appointed, comfortable and well located property. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful and a brief subway ride or walk uptown puts one at 42nd street and Times Square, from which you can access just about every subway line in NYC. Great place, we will definitely be coming back.

title: Room smelt of urine
text: Room smelt of urine. They did a deep clean but it still smelt. I am pretty sure they knew this about the room as it was filled with deodorizing spray when we checked in. The following morning it had all faded and we were left with urine. Breakfast buffet was overpriced, poor quality and poorly serviced. Breakfast for 2 was 70$ with tip and taxes included. Waitstaff was over it. I'm sure they get poor tips during the buffet and it showed. I had a carton of water with no seal on it in our room, which leads me a little suspect. Also 40$ day resort fee seemed overkill for what you were getting.

title: My Go To Hotel
text: Innside New York NoMad is my go to NYC hotel.  I have been staying here since it opened and it keeps getting better.  The hotel is fresh, clean, open...in a great location for both walking and public transportation.  But what keeps improving is the service. I have stayed at other Melia properties where my reward status is never recognized or acknowledged.  Here I feel so welcomed!  Hugo Gonell is simply is the best addition to your staff!  The service I received will bring me back again and again :)  See you in March!  And thank you again.

title: bien
text: respecto a las  habitaciones bien, grandes con mucho espacio y modernas, lavabo comodo  y destaca la buena ubicación del hotel,  en zona tranquila donde no hay mucha circulación y hay una estación de metro cerca

title: Pretty Spacious for New York
text: Pretty large room for New York. Requested a Queen bed at happily got upgraded to a King.  Loved that the refreshments were included in the resort fees. Very clean and stark white. Location served us well for enjoying NYC nightlife.

title: AMAZING HOTEL AND CUSTOMER SERVICE!
text: Wow I can’t say enough about this wonderful hotel Innside by Melia!  I have brought a group of college seniors and colleagues for our annual trip to NYC and we have had a great week!  I worked with Sales Director Alexandra Castro and her staff since October and everything was made easy and efficient!  When we got here they had made cute welcome gifts for us even so far as to have the SMU blue ribbon!  Every little detail was taken care of which made it so much easier for myself!  Then we get here and wow what a beautiful hotel. The rooms are bright and clean and very comfortable!  I even had a beautiful terrace to enjoy. And since there was a heat wave in January I got to sit out there with friends and enjoy a bottle of wine. I even got a great pic of the Empire State Building and the full moon!  Anything myself or the students needed the front desk staff was write on top of it.  Also the Wilson restaurant is attached and they have great food and amazing drinks!  The hotel is also in a great location and it’s easy to get anywhere in Manhattan!  You truly will have a wonderful experience here at the Innside!  When you are stay at a beautiful and comfortable hotel it elevates your trip!  Again that you Alexandra for a truly wonderful week!  Can’t wait to stay here again!

title: Great stay!
text:
My husband and I stayed for 3 nights for my birthday weekend. Everyone was friendly and accommodating, I even got chocolates, a bottle of bubbles and a hand written note for my birthday in my room!! I left my jewelry in the safe and everyone has been helpful in retrieving my items.

Javier, Christina, Kit and Robert were amazing! Would definitely come back and stay.

title: HOTEL FUNCIONAL Y URBANO, MAGNIFICA OPCIÓN PARA VISITAR NYORK
text: fantástico en línea generales. en calle tranquila pero excepcionalmente ubicado. a destacar la gestión de director y de Hugo que es la amabilidad personificada. por poner una pega, colchones excesivamente blandos y pocas amenities

title: Muito Bom!!!
text: Hotel muito bom e bem localizado! Longe do agito, como queríamos. O ambiente é super moderno, com check in e check out rápidos. O restaurante com boa comida. Jantamos duas vezes lá. Optamos pelo café da manhã (sobretaxa). Ele é bom, mas poderiam variar o tipo de comida. Um bom destaque para as frutas. No mais, a experiência muito boa que tivemos no hotel foi com o concierge Hugo que é inigualável! Nos recebeu falando a nossa língua e com a maior simpatia. Dá ótimas dicas de restaurantes. Com certeza ele faz a diferença. Sobre o quarto, não concordamos com os itens obrigatórios do frigobar. Poderiam deixar somente água.

title: Reunion in NYC
text:
We were home in New York for Christmas 2019 for the first time in 16 years.  All the staff were so welcoming, especially Hugo & Jenni.  The hotel looked so festive.  House Keeping were amazing.  Great location to base yourself in The City.  I’ve always loved that area for socialising & dining.   We’ve stayed at the Melia Alicante, so we were very pleased that the same 5 star 🌟 service  and amenities were provided at the Innside Nomad
Health & Happiness in 2020
Until we meet again

title: ATTENZIONE! 27 $ IN PIÙ AL GIORNO per WI-FI E GYM CHE SI SCOPRONO SOLO DOPO LA PRENOTAZIONE
text:
Generalmente non posto recensioni negative, ma questa mi sembra d’obbligo perché purtroppo i furbi sono in tutto
Il mondo, e non solo in Italia.
Avevo già soggiornato 4 anni fa in questo albergo, quindi scelgo di riandare per un nuovo soggiorno ad NY. Peccato che la scorsa volta mi era sfuggito (essendo
Stata pochi giorni) che ad un certo punto del soggiorno - IN TOTALE AUTONOMIA E SENZA CHIEDERE - decidono di prelevarti dalla carta (che all’ingresso viene richiesta come di consueto a cauzione di eventuali danni) 27 euro al giorno + tasse per facilities che - al momento della prenotazione - vengono presentate come gratuite e che sbucano (guarda caso) solo
Sul foglio di conferma. 
Sicuramente noi abbiamo peccato nel non leggere nel dettaglio la Confirmation, ma:
1) avevamo fatto una tariffa PREPAGATA ALL INCLUSIVE e l’esistenza di queste FEE si palesa solo alla fine del processo, mentre i servizi nel  sito sono presentati come GRATUITI
2) all’arrivo NESSUNO HA SPECIFICATO L’esistenza di queste FEE
3) non esiste che a valle di un pagamento - già effettuato-  di oltre 2000 dollari venga disabilitata la chiave della porta SENZA PREAVVISO, lasciandoci fuori della stanza. Che razza di customer care avete in mente?!
4) NON TROVO GIUSTO CHE QUESTE FEE vengano prelevate senza consenso. Fortunatamente avevo lasciato una prepagata, altrimenti avrebbero compromesso il plafond della
Mia carta di credito, senza che neanche lo sapessi.
5) altra cosa davvero strana: date le mie proteste l’addetto alla reception si è la briga di scontarmi 3 giorni di fee. Scusate, ma io non credo che un addetto possa fare degli sconti, quindi questo mi fa pensare che ciò che è successo a me non sia un caso isolato, ma che sia piuttosto ricorrente e questa sia la prassi adottata per far stare buoni i clienti che protestano.
 
In conclusione, sebbene in termini strettamente legali sono sicuramente nel giusto - trovo del tutto UNFAIR il fatto che queste FEE siano comunicate solo a prenotazione avvenuta (soprattutto in una tariffa prepagata), perché alzano il costo giornaliero del soggiorno e soprattutto perché NON SI PUÒ SCEGLIERE DI NON PAGARLE in quanto FACILITIES OBBLIGATORIE.

title: What a hidden gem
text:
We had a fantastic stay here and out of the 3 hotels we stayed at during the time we spent in NY this was definitely our favorite by a long way.
Staff were exceptional and engaging. Hotel really exceeded our expectations as this hotel was what we considered to be an affordable hotel and was miles ahead of the hotel we stayed at first in UWS.
It is walking distance from the Bus Station and in a fantastic central location for getting around with subway closeby, walking distance to Times Square and Flatiron district. 
Also super close to Oscar Wildes bar which is a must. Also close to Madison Square Gardens and our cosy haunt called John Does just close by. Also wortrh a mention that the in house bar is rated in top 20 NY bars

title: Excellent stay!
text:
From check in to check out and everything in between it was great! 
The location is very central, allowed us the flexibility to walk uptown or down and be staying a few blocks away from the hustle/touristy area of Times Square. Very easy to walk in Chealsea and to Hudson Yards to explore the High Line. 

The hotel was exactly as advertised on the Meliá Website. Very pleased with the service and the style/vibe! 

Looking forward to booking another trip here!

title: Ótima escolha
text:
Ótima localização, perto do Madison Square Garden e  fora daquela agitação da Times Square.  Facilidade de locomoção, pois há estações de metro em todas as esquinas. 
O espaço do quarto é muito bom. 
Chegamos bem mais cedo que o horário do check-in e como havia disponibilidade do quarto, prontamente fomos atendidos e nos disponibilizado o quarto.

title: Hotel was fine but the “accounting error” is NOT
text:
Booked the hotel within 12 hours of check-in so we could be in town to surprise someone for their already planned trip for their birthday.  That process, along with check-in was easy.  

The room was spacious, tidy, and accommodating.  The beds were rather comfortable.

We were not impressed with the service at the restaurant/bar, The Wilson, as we felt overlooked and undervalued probably because only ordered one drink each.  

The big problem presented AFTER our stay as we noticed 5 days after check out (12/13/19) that the entire initial booking hold was still posted as a charge on our credit card statement along with the final closing statement amount.  On 12/18/19, I spoke to a representative from the hotel and was told it takes 5-10 business days for that hold to drop off.  We waited until 1/6/20 to make the second phone call because the charge was still there.  After getting “disconnected” while my call was being transferred, I finally got to speak to - at this point - the third rep from the hotel who told me I had to send an email detailing my issue.  I included screen shots of both charges on our card along with a detailed description of the problem only for an email response stating the only charge I should see is the final amount.  Nothing was mentioned about the holding charge I was questioning nor an apology nor how they planned to reverse the charge.  It took yet another email and a threat of bringing our attorney into the mix did they all of a sudden find “an accounting error” and claim to have reversed the charge on 1/8/20, which will now take 3-5 business days to appear.  I’ll believe it when I see it.

title: Weekend Getaway
text: I highly recommend Innside. The swanky, boutique vibe is refreshing. Restaurant onsite is wonderful - the brussel sprouts are a must! We picked for close proximity to FIT with easy access to train & major attractions.

title: MUY BIEN
text:
Hotel muy bien situado y comunicado, con varias estaciones de metro muy cerca,  muy limpio, habitaciones amplias y cómodas.Tuvimos dos habitaciones comunicadas para la familia de 5 y estuvimos muy bien.
Desayuno bien pero caro para mi gusto.
Destacar la atención y la  disposición a ayudar de Javier, Chistina y Kimberly.

title: AMAZING!!!
text: My friends and I had such an amazing experience during our stay in this hotel. When we arrive in the hotel the front desk was super helpful and very nice. They gave us a awesome map with all the go to spots to try out. The room was phenomenal, the beds were so comfy and clean. I certainly will be coming back again.

title: Great location at a great price
text: Christmas in New York was perfect for our family of 5. We booked the family Suite and it worked out perfectly.  The hotel is modern, clean and has a great vibe.  We enjoyed a delicious meal in the hotel restaurant on Christmas night.

title: calidad-precio normal, bien situado
text: son habitaciones muy justas para 4 personas , habitación, baño, armarios. para pasar varias noches como fue nuestro caso 9 noches, se necesitaría habitaciones más espaciosas, armario más amplio, baño separado de la ducha.

title: Amazing stay
text: Can’t say enough good things about this place. The room was fabulous. Large for NYC standards, clean and had nice amenities. The Wilson (hotel’s restaurant) was excellent and dog-friendly. Hugo (in customer experience and at the front desk) was so nice and accommodating—you can tell he genuinely cares about each guest’s experience at the hotel. Fun, inviting vibe with great music playing in elevators and lobby. We’ll definitely be back...sooner rather than later!!

title: Fantastic Experience
text: This place is fantastic. It's clean, has an excellent restaurant/bar, and has a relaxed funky vibe, but the best thing about this place is their client experience. Kit and Naline are both fantastic to work with, and Alexandra in sales is also a gem! Every employee I've met in the hallway has been extremely accommodating and friendly.  The rooms are big for NY standards and are packed with anything you might need. I highly recommend this place, especially given that I'm in NY often and see what the standard generally is for hotels. Thank you Kit and Naline :)

title: Perfect location for NYC Visit
text:
Stayed for Christmas with 2 rooms, 1 2 beds 1 Queen.
The Queen room are located at the end of each corridor and slightly smaller than other rooms.
Fees are approx $40 PER ROOM PER NIGHT. (Payable on booking out) Rooms are clean, however we had a number of issues with the quality of the housekeeping.
We ended up moving rooms mid stay to a King room (photos of this room)
Much more comfortable than the Queen rooms. (Duty manager was so helpful in resolving our problem loves)

There nearest Subway is 1 street away (about a 2 minute walk) at 28th Street on the 1 Line which can get you Downtown for the 9/11 Memorial area or Uptown to Times Square and further.

The Breakfast is a buffet type buy I feel the $35 per person price is expensive.

Without eating here, it's a great hotel with a view from the 20th floor lift lobby and Gym of Downtown and I would stay again if I returned to NYC.

title: ..pensavo meglio..
text: Non posso dire di essere mi trovato male..ma visti i giudizi degli altri viaggiatori e il prezzo pagato mi aspettavo di più. La camera e’ piccola, il bagno pure. L’armadio e’ a vista senza ante. C’è un piccolo tavolino con una sedia. I materassi troppo morbidi e le pulizie non impeccabili.

title: A relaxed and pleasant stay
text:
Thank you so much for a wonderful staying and special thanks to Mauricio and Brandon who made our experience in the hotel to an unforgettable!
The hotel is located perfectly in Chelsea neighborhood and close to everything by walking distance. The room is very comfortable and we reserved a premier king city view room which give you a nice views of the city. The room was super quiet and we had a very nice and pleasant stay. We will defiantly come back! 
Thanks for everything.
Lior

title: Ubicación increíble
text:
Lo mejor del hotel es la ubicación. Además, esta totalmente reformado y todo es nuevo y moderno. Muy bonita la recepción y habitaciones.
Sin embargo, el servicio del hotel es malísimo, no hacían la habitación por la noche (anochece a las 5p.m en invierno) y se olvidaron varias veces de reponer las toallas porque “no les quedaban”. Y nunca nos repusieron la crema de cuerpo, que era lo único que venía en bote pequeño y no “a granel” dentro de la ducha. Muy mal el servicio. Y muy lentos en recepción para resolvernos lo de las toallas.

title: Nice-sized room, great location in the heart of Chelsea neighborhood!
text: If you're looking to explore Chelsea, INNSiDE is a great place to stay!  Clean and larger-sized rooms, nice modern shower, friendly staff, great restaurant, close proximity to the High Line and tons of great coffee shops and restaurants in Chelsea, all make this one of the best hotels I've stayed in Manhattan.  When I return to the city I'll definitely consider another stay!

title: Great value and location for our family
text: Love the Chelsea neighborhood, and this hotel was very convenient to the subway and local restaurants and bars. The disturbing trend in hospitality is this "resort fee" where hotels (many hotels, not just this one) tack on extra per-day charges for things like "free" wifi (which, by the way, in 2019 is like saying "free electricity in your room!"), "full access" to the mini bar (which included one fancy box of water -- about 16oz -- and 3 cans of soda which we don't drink), and "full access to all the hotel amenities" (meaning, you're allowed in all areas but you still have to pay for anything done in those areas). I wish they'd just increase the price of the room and have the per-night fee the only thing you get charged at checkout (except, of course, if you order room service in or have your laundry done). This fee is especially bothersome when there's nowhere to hang a hand towel or facecloth, there's a crack on the back of the door near the lock making us wonder about safety (maybe this could be fixed before you rent the room?), and only about 4 channels on the TV worked for us (eventually we called down and it was fixed). I have no complaints about the hotel staff who were all lovely, warm, friendly, hard-working people and would highly recommend this hotel when it's undersold and not at the peak of the season as I'm not sure it would be as great of a value at a higher price point.

title: Beautiful hotel and amazing staff!
text: It's a really well run hotel. The staff always make you feel welcome and are really friendly. The room was always clean and at a good temperature. It's also a brilliant location. I will be returning that's for sure.

title: Came for the deal, but will come back for the hotel
text: I found the hotel on Hotels Tonight and the price was amazing for NYC.  But once there I realized I may have found a new "go to" business travel hotel: right location, good amenities and comfortable.  I'm sold!

title: Fun date night
text: Great time loved the location and amenities very trendy and updated.. fun drinks at the bar and overall fun vibe! Our room was a great size for the city and provided us will all the necessities. We will absolutely be coming back!

title: Weihnachten im Melia
text:
Sehr schneller Check-in; freundliches Personal.
Zimmer sind für ein zentrales Stadthotel gut.
Frühstück für amerikanische Verhältnisse sehr gut!
Ist zwar immer das Gleiche, aber die Auswahl passt.
Hotel ist empfehlenswert!
Passt zur Melia- Kette!

title: THIEVES
text: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!  I left my jewelry in the safe in the room (yes, I'm an idiot for not removing all my things upon leaving).  The safe was locked when I left the room.  I called the hotel on 4 different occasions and no one ever called me back.  I spoke to SA on one occasion and she assured me she would get to the bottom of it but nothing ever happened and NO ONE ever called me back.  She informed me the housekeeping staff would open the safe when they cleaned the room and put the jewelry in lost and found.  NO ONE EVER CALLED ME BACK THEREFORE THE JEWELRY WAS STOLEN!!!!!!  I was assured the Manager or someone would call me back but no one ever did.  MANAGEMENT IS A DISGRACE and the STAFF are THIEVES!

title: Weekend trip
text: Went to visit NYC for Christmas celebration. Hotel was in great location. Many stores around that were convenient. Hotel has bar/restaurant inside and it was always full of people every time I walked by it. Would recommend.

title: Loved it
text:
Great family trip. Atmosphere and location all a plus. People treated us well. Rooms were very nice and clean. Great bar!! 
Overall very happy. Extra special was the fact we have 4 girls and the rooms connected so we could have a family suite.

title: Found disgusting items in the room
text: Overall the hotel is nice, however my experience was not remotely pleasant. Inside the room I found lack of hygiene, no quality control, intimate personal items in the trash bins (from the previous guest), slimy texture over the surfaces of the room, was a nightmare... I will not stay or recommend to anyone.

title: Bij ander hotel slechte start - Super behandeling bij Innside
text: Nadat we eerst een ander hotel hadden bij Central Park, wat ondanks de beoordelingen en prijs een drama was heb ik ons overgeboekt naar Innside by Melia New York Nomad. Christina, Kimberly, Robert en Kit hebben ons op een bijzondere manier geholpen om de korte trip toch te laten slagen. Niets was te gek, service en klanttevredenheid stond bij hen voorop en daar hebben we super van genoten. We komen hier zeker weer bij een volgend bezoek aan New York terug

title: Péssimo Staff | Bad Staff
text:
Todas as noites, ao chegarmos cansados de volta ao hotel, tinhamos que ligar na Recepção e pedir reposição de toalhas e capsulas de café, pois a arrumadeira não repunha estes itens em nosso quarto.
Além disso, teve dias que não retiraram o lixo do banheiro e/ou não repuseram papel higiênico.

A cama é muito confortável, mas super mau arrumada - a pessoa que arruma a cama nem prende os lençóis, então se você levanta o travesseiro já ve o colchão.

Um dia acordamos e a plaquinha de "não perturbe" não estava mais em nossa porta, do lado de fora. Alguém tirou enquanto dormíamos.

Teve um dia que chegamos ao quarto e a porta estava apenas encostada (e não completamente fechada), ou seja, qualquer um poderia entrar em nosso quarto.

Os recepcionistas são terríveis. Eles não dão UM sorriso. Não te olham nos olhos. Parecem robôs. Quando cheguei (check-in) nem me deram oi. Me falaram que a taxa de facilidade (que eu teria que pagar após o check-in) era o dobro do que constava em minha confirmação de reserva (que no check-out, com muito custo, consegui que ajustassem de acordo com a confirmação - mas se é alguém que não fala o inglês tão bem já fica no prejuízo aqui). Quando eu ligava para pedir o relatado acima (para repor toalhas, etc) a recepcionista até bufava. Horrivel. Me sentia incomodando o staff, sendo que eu estava pagando bem caro para estar ali - que não entrega nem 30% do preço que cobram.

Recebi alguns pacotes durante a minha viagem e TODAS as vezes, sem exceção, eles não achavam meus pacotes. Eu tinha que ir na Recepção 2 ou 3x por dia para que eles conseguissem achar. Teve pacote que chegou em um dia e eles me entregaram somente 4 ou 5 dias depois, sendo que eu perguntava todos os dias. Qual a dificuldade? Por qual motivo não queriam entregar os meus pacotes? Isso me causou bastante transtorno pois muitas vezes eu tive que contatar os vendedores que ficavam desesperados pois já haviam entregado os pacotes há dias. Só me fez perder tempo e ter dor de cabeça. No último pacote que procurei, um dia antes do meu check-out, a recepcionista me disse que não haviam entregado e nem entregariam mais até 2a feira (isso foi na 6a feira e meu check-out era no sábado). Este mesmo pacote havia sido entregue na 5a feira ao 12h02. Por qual motivo esta recepcionista fez isso?

Várias vezes quando eu ligava na recepção (por qualquer um dos motivos acima) o staff me dizia que o hotel estava muito cheio e não conseguiriam me atender naquele momento e me retornariam em 15 minutos. Estou esperando até agora.

Teve teste de alarme de incêncio sem aviso aos hóspedes. Acho isso uma falta de educação, pois a sensação é horrível e, mais uma vez, se é alguém que não fala inglês para entender o que estão anunciando no viva voz dos quartos, ficará desesperado, ainda mais diantes desta situação de terror.

Me emprestaram um guarda chuva, sem custo, por 2 dias. 
E o restaurante, o único do hotel, embora fechado no período do jantar por dois dias seguidos da minha estada - sem aviso prévio - é muito bom! Não tem muita variedade, mas os itens que tem são maravilhosos e muito bem feitos. O staff do restaurante é agradável e solicito.

Each evening, when we got tired back to the hotel, we had to call Reception and ask for replacement of towels and coffee caps because the maid did not replace these items in our room.
In addition, there were days when they did not remove the trash from the bathroom and / or did not replace toilet paper.

The bed is very comfortable, but super badly made up - the person who makes the bed doesn't even hold the sheets, so if you lift the pillow you already see the mattress.

One day we woke up and the "do not disturb" sign was no longer on our door. Someone took it while we slept.

One day we got to the room and the door was just slammed (not completely closed), meaning anyone could enter our room.

The receptionists are terrible. They do not give a smile. They do not look you into your eyes. They look like robots. When I arrived (check in) they didn't even say hi. They said that the facility fee (which I would have to pay after check-in) was double what was on my booking confirmation (which at check-out costly I managed to adjust according to the confirmation - but if you are someone who does not speak English so well you are already at a loss here). When I called to ask for the above (to replace towels, etc.) the receptionist even snorted. Horrible. I was bothering the staff, and I was paying dearly to be there - that does not deliver even 30% of the price they charge.

I received some packages during my trip and EVERY time, without exception, they did not find my packages. I had to go to Reception 2 or 3x a day so they could find it. There was a package that arrived in one day and they only delivered it to me 4 or 5 days later, and I asked every day. What is the difficulty? Why didn't they want to deliver my packages? This caused me a lot of trouble because many times I had to contact the sellers who were desperate because they had delivered the packages for days. It just wasted my time and got a headache. In the last package I looked for, the day before my checkout, the receptionist told me they had not delivered and would not deliver until Monday (this was on Friday and my check-out was on Saturday). This same package had been delivered on Thursday at 12:02 pm. Why did this receptionist do this?

Several times when I called the front desk (for any of the above reasons) the staff would tell me that the hotel was too busy and could not answer me at that time and would return to me in 15 minutes. I'm waiting till now.

On the last day also had a fire alarm test without warning to guests. I think this is impolite, because the feeling is horrible and, once again, if you are someone who does not speak English to understand what they are announcing in the room voice, you will be desperate, even more in the face of this terror situation.

They lent me an umbrella, free of charge, for 2 days.
And the restaurant, the only one in the hotel, although closed at dinner for two straight days of my stay - unannounced - is very nice! It doesn't have much variety, but the items it has are wonderful and very well made. The restaurant staff is nice and solicitous.

title: Cobram uma taxa extra de 35 US$
text:
Hotel muito bom, porém alguns problemas:

- Check-in às 15h

- Cobrança de 35 DÓLARES mais impostos por quarto por noite será cobrada diretamente no hotel para incluir Wi-Fi de Alta Velocidade, Centro de Repouso Diário, Café Nespresso, Leitor de Imprensa on-demand, Chamadas dentro dos Estados Unidos, Business Center, acesso a Fitness Center e manuseio de Pacotes.

Acredito muito desonesto por parte do hotel omitir as taxas durante o processo de reserva em seu próprio site.

title: Poor overall.
text: Beds are not comfortable. Air ventilation is horrible. Don't buy breakfast. Totally wasted money and better to eat at many good places just next door. Location is reasonable although the street is a bit dodgy. Would think it is 3 stars and got misclassified!

title: BUEN HOTEL Y MUY BUENA LOCALIZACIÓN.
text: Hemos estado 8 días a principio de Diciembre. La localización del hotel es muy buena, se puede ir caminando a muchos sitios importantes. Tiene una boca de metro muy cerca. El hotel en general está muy bien, el único inconveniente es que la habitación es muy pequeña sobre todo si te alojas cuatro personas(dos adultos y dos niños) con poco sitio para guardar la ropa. La recepción es bonita y el sistema de reposición de  bebidas diarias resulta muy cómodo. El WIFI funciona muy bien. Volvería sin dudarlo y lo recomiendo totalmente.

title: Bad Experience
text: I spoke with the Manager on Duty to review my experience, and shared that I felt like I was being held hostage.  I voiced my disbelief that there was a mandatory Resort Fee.  I shared with the Manager on Duty that I would not review, good or bad.

title: relaxed atmosphere
Great staff!
text: I would to to share what a great staff the hotel reception has. They were  very friendly making the stay more enjoyable.  Special thanks to Yenni for her attention and professionalism while helping me solve a critical situation on my first might in NY  !

title: Sarah H.
text: It was the best trip ever. Jose was very helpful and patient with us, we really appreciate it. We will definitely visit again , they also had wonderful food and the hotel was beautiful. I will recommend to my friends.

title: Great location but overall not family/children-oriented
text: We ate breakfast which was too expensive for the quality of food and lack of variety of food available. I don’t recommend this hotel for families with little children. The location was within walking distance to shopping and restaurants.

title: Short n Sweet
text: I was in NY for high school reunion. I picked Inside Hotel because of a previous stay and the location. There is always very friendly staff, a clean room, and the restaurant/bar is great. I would book here again.

title: Boutique that operates like a box brand.
text: Will be back next month. The people, vibe, ambiance and restaurant all a win. The staff was fantastic. Will be back, as my concerns are small things that I’m certain will be improved soon. This won’t let me submit unless I write 200 characters.... here we go..............

title: Correcto pero esperaba más siendo un Melia
text: Hotel bien situado en NYC, para patear la ciudad. Suelo ir a muchos hoteles Melia y este me ha parecido muy impersonal, el trato correcto pero distante. Soy cliente platino y normalmente eso lo cuidan mucho, en este hotel no. El desayuno no lo recomiendo, un domingo a las 10 de la mañana ya no había Bagels y aunque pedí más no los traían, volví a preguntar y me dijeron que no había más, así directamente. No merece la pena pudiendo comprártelo en un Deli y tomarlo en la habitación.

title: Beautiful hotel, decent location.
text: The hotel itself is beautiful, the room and bathroom were spacious. The location is ok, a little bit of a walk to get to TImes Square but it is close to the Flatiron Building and Madison Square Garden's. It was close to coffee shops and some restaurants. Only negative was the faucet in the washroom was very loose and floppy. Great overall experience at this hotel! I would recommend.

title: unas malas vacaciones
text: alas cuatro de la noche tocan ha las puertas sin saber porque i ecima en ingles diciendo que fumamos en cima acen fotos ha las abitaciones me dijo la de rececion pides un cafe con leche te dan una taza de cafe en la pizrra ha fuera dicen que es el desayuno mas barato de nueva york nos tratan indiferentes entodos los apectos buelven atocar ha las abitaciones al dia siguiente la camareras se chivan no canvian las sabanas todos los dias todo para horrar para nos cobran 2600 euros 200 euros pòr fumar 2800 euros les decimos es un robo i mas cosas el libro de reclamaciones en ingles todo el personal ingles istalaciones malas

title: malas vacaciones con esta compañia
text: de este hotel no me gusto ni las habitataciones ni calidad ni el precio caro  por lo que es  el jabon poca calidad solo llegamos i no havian toallas las tubimos que padir las calles llenas de bolsas de basura

title: NYC Visit
text:
From the moment we arrived we were treated very well! They charge a daily facility fee, but it is so worth it!! We were able to buy our own liquor and they supplied us with Coke’s and waters and other drinks as we asked for them. Included in our fee!!  Christina Calderon was a fantastic hostess and I can’t wait to go back!! 
Everything was spotless and the rooms were huge for NYC! There was 4 of us in a 2-bed room and we had plenty of room. The subway was close by, little eatery’s within walking distance, and Time Square 1-2 subway stops away. The cleaning crew left our room spotless and when we ordered waters/cokes to our room, they were there within 5 minutes. there was a DJ on Saturday night in the lobby playing some nice tunes!!

title: Good Hotel - please respond to emails!
text:
Just returned from a long weekend in NYC. Arrived at the Hotel and was greeted by a very welcoming receptionist.  I was sharing a room with a friend and there was enough room for us both. Beds were comfortable, en suite clean. We had clean towels only once when we stayed but there is a drawer in the en suite full of towels. There is also complimentary shower gel, shampoo and conditioner. 

We didn't eat in the Hotel but I did have a couple of drinks in the bar. Again staff were very helpful. 

However on our departure date, my friend vacated the room early paying for us both and advised reception that I was still upstairs. When it came to me vacating, she told me that I owed for my stay as my friend hadn't paid. I confirmed that this had been sorted and she wouldn't let me go. At the end she shrugged and advised me that the credit card on file would be used for payment.

I am also waiting for the Hotel to reply to an email that I sent 3 days ago advising them I had lost a gold ring in the room and whether anyone had handed it in/cleaner had found it. I'm still waiting ...

title: Ehh
text: This definitely felt more like a 2 star hotel. I had to drag 4 bags inside, grab my own luggage cart, and load it. Once I got to the front counter after waiting for 15min I asked why they didnt have any bellmen to which she replied, “oh we do he just hangs out in the back until he’s needed.” Which makes no sense. I was confused. The WiFi in the rooms and gym blows, hard. The gym did have a cool outdoor terrace, but otherwise it’s tiny. There are lots of other gyms close by though. The way that the bathroom is setup makes no sense as all sides are glass and there’s no dimmer on the light switch or just single light over the toilet so if you had to use it at night or early morning it woke everyone else up by blinding them through their closed eyelids. The downstairs of the hotel is cute and newly remodeled with bar/restaurant and also outdoor seating. they have a really cute area out back too with some games and the hotel itself is in a great location, but this wouldn’t be my first choice unless I got a killer deal on it.

title: November Stay
text: Overall my experience was good. Room was small but efficient. Restrooms could be a little bigger. I had a package from Amazon delivered to the hotel which seemed to be difficult to locate by staff. Better care for those type of conditions should be met.

title: Excelente ubicacion, buenas instalaciones y buen trato del personal
text: Esta excelentemente bien situado. El hotel esta reformado, las habitaciones son de tamaño medio, el baño muy pequeño aunque la ducha es muy buena, son silenciosas (cosa muy de agradecer en USA), en definitiva funcionales y agradables. el hall del hotel es pequeño y siempre lleno, aunque cumple con su funcion, el desayuno es pobre y, bajo mi punto de vista, caro. El personal de recepcion es agradable y empatico. La limpieza mas que correcta. Nada de acuerdo con la taxa de 35$ por servicio (se convierte en 40,20$ con taxas, taxa sobre taxa) al dia que hay que sumar al precio de la habitacion): esta taxa es por el uso de wifi, gimnasio, minibar (un brik de agua y cuatro refrescos). En general el hotel esta bien, dado los hoteles y precios de Nueva York, y su ubicacion lo mejor.

title: Viaje con amigos fantástico
text: Las habitaciones estan bien de tamaño, limpias y cómodas. El hotel es tranquilo y con huen ambiente.  La unica pega que jo hablan español y no te ofrecen nimguna excursion o entradas. Las tuvimos que contratar en la calle y en la paguna web si que te la ofrecen pero luego en el hotel no saben nada. En todo lo demas muy bien. La ubicacion bien. Todo cerca y no hay ruidos. Experiencia muy positiva. Hay un rooftop a 200 metros que merece mucho la pena para tomar algo.

title: hôtel bien situé
text:
un hôtel bien situé pour visiter new york à pieds ( proche time square, rooftop, avec un peu de marche mais l'architecture est tellement belle la hit line )
 une vue légère sur l'empire state, 
hôtel au calme
métro proche donc celui venant de l'aéroport

title: Vacaciones NY Noviembre 2019
text: En estas vacaciones nos hospedamos en el Hotel Innside NoMad en Nueva York. La habitación que nos asignaron era en el piso 19   con vista espectacular a la Free Down Tower, la habitación amplia con frigobar incluido y café Nespresso , la limpieza muy buena. El hotel está ubicado cerca del Madison Square Garden el Empire y del Flatiron. Toda la atención recibida fue excelente y quiero destacar la amabilidad de Javier, Kimberly y Christina.

title: Best hotel in the area
text:
I’ve stayed at a lot of hotels in this area  (midtown west) near Penn Station.  Personally I don’t like the area but it’s close to everything (subways and central). The staff is super friendly - from the front desk to bartenders.  The hotel restaurant is very nice and makes great drinks and has a nice atmosphere.  
The room is a typical NYC room - small but clean with comfortable bedding and floor to ceiling windows.  I’m heading back to the hotel this week again as I have a work function and need to stay in the city.

title: Solo para juventud
text:
La verdad, no entiendo como MELIÁ, permitió que usen su nombre para semejante lugar, desastroso, la habitación sencilla, con una sola silla para 3 personas, limpieza y camareras muy buenas. Un Hostelero bueno, está al mismo nivel.
El restaurante un verdadero desastre, desayuno MALO y pobre, comida cara y escasa, tienen un lugar abajo tipo sótano, que no podes ir porque está alquilado a una empresa de computación, el lobby chico es poco, todo el mundo amontonado.la recepción se destacan Cristina y HUGO.
Alrededor no hay restaurantes buenos solo cadenas de hamburguesas o de Donnas
Y de noche zona Súper Oscura.

title: 2 nights in NY
text: This hotel is in a great location - walking distance from Penn Station and Times Square.  The staff were very friendly, the room was clean and efficient - bathroom is very small - room for one person but that works!  Beds were comfortable and clean - the ONE thing that is frustrating is the 'resort' fee - $50 per night for the coffee and non-alcoholic mini bar and use of gym.  We just wanted to have bottled water to drink and had to get house keeping to deliver some the second night.  (So with tip that night's 'resort fee' costs us $55!)

title: Big room for Manhattan
text: Stayed here for thanksgiving and was impressed by the size of the room. We were upgraded to a King which was nice! Room was very spacious for New York and had a modern feel. Hotel is in an excellent location, just a stones throw from MSG and the Empire State. The only thing I could fault is the lack of clarity on the room fees and taxes. We opted to pay these at the start of the holiday, but were told upon checkout that we had to pay an additional occupancy fee of 18 dollars, which I found particularly surprising giving we wanted to pay all fees at the beginning. Nonetheless, would recommend this hotel to others. J

title: Muy céntrico y comunicado
text:
Por una parte el personal muy amable y servicial y por otra parte lo céntrico y al mismo tiempo tranquilo es lo que más destacaría.
Lo que menos, el desayuno y la limpieza. Sin estar sucio, al contrario, se ve limpio, pero solo se ve. El mismo pelo dos días en el mismo sitio y el mismo papel tres días en el mismo sitio, aunque la verdad, es que parece estar limpio.
En cuanto al desayuno caro y cada día lo mismo, buffet de huevos revueltos, patatas asadas, salchichas (platos calientes), ensalada de frutas, yogurt y dos o tres embutidos (platos fríos), algo de bollería y café, zumo y agua, 35$ diarios por pax.

title: Yes, I am returning!
text: Melia exceeded my expectations with their polite, helpful, & accommodating staff, clean and gorgeous interior decorating, feather down comforter and pillows (made me oversleep, LOL!?!), PERFECT bathrobe, AND FREE BEVERAGES replenished daily!  Never was I ever awakened by errant noise or overzealous housekeeping.  Thank you for making this visit memorable!

title: Como en casa
text: Hotel muy céntrico, buenos servicios, muy completo y una atención por parte del personal aún mejor. Sobretodo quería agradecer la atención a Kimberly, Rafael y Cristian. Es un hotel que si vuelvo a NY, repetiré sin duda. Además dar las gracias al restaurante, sólo me sé el nombre de Ignacio, pero dar las gracias a todos, ya que fue el cumpleaños de mi mujer y le hicieron un postre-minitarta con dos velitas, esos detalles son los que fidelizan clientes. MUCHAS GRACIAS A TODOS.

title: Muy impersonal.
text:
Un Melia que no parece Melia. Personal poco cordial y muy distante, servicio de desayuno, lamentable sunpersonal y la variedad y cantidad pésima.
Las habitaciones aceptables cómodas y muy limpias , con un cuarto de Baño pequeño pero muy funcional.

title: Special break.
text: Booked this hotel as part of a twin break to Reykjavik and NY. The hotel location was really good, 15/20 mins walk to Times Square and 5th Avenue. We were upgraded to a King room on the 20th floor and it was very spacious. Free mini bar with water and soft drinks included as well as slippers. Toiletries were excellent and plentiful. We recieved a bottle of wine in our room as part of the upgrade too. The hotel has a lovely bar/ restaurant. All in all a very good hotel the only downside was the wifi which was rather poor especially in the room. Would recommend.

title: Comfortable, well designed, decent location
text:
This hotel has impressive hip design, smartly laid out rooms, and good soundproofing for sleeping. Rooms are small but designed for efficient space use in every way, so two of us, each with a large suitcase, didn't feel cramped. The lobby is comfortable if you need to chill for a bit. The gym has decent selection for a hotel in Manhattan and a great view. Well located for Chelsea and surrounding neighborhoods, which I like. Only issues were that laundry is expensive (but you can go to a laundromat nearby) and the restaurant was not well reviewed so we didn't try it. 
Overall I'd recommend this hotel to visitors to New York and would stay here again myself.

title: I had a wonderful birthday and interesting stay in New York
text: The atmosphere and cleanness of the hotel was excellent. The stay was very engaged with me as a visitor in their city. The room was bright, clean and had a great view of downtown. The shower drained a little onto the bathroom floor. I would have liked to see the price of room service, since I did not use it. And the hotel guests should have an incentive discount on the breakfast price, since I saved $25 by just eating a few steps away from the hotel. But my stay there was outstanding and next time I come to New York City, I will return here !

title: Buen hotel, mejor atención.
text:
Buen hotel con buen servicio. 
Lo mejor, la atencion del personal, especialmente Javier que nos atendio mas alla de sus obligaciones especificas. Nalwi, Kit, Hugo y Kimberly, muy amables y serviciales.
El desayuno seria muy mejorable. Gama de productos muy reducida y poco saludable.

title: BEST STAY!
text:
This Hotel is amazing!
The hotel is Very clean and service is great. 

Jose was very helpful in regards to giving me ideas to do around New York City And also giving me food recommendations, he definitely made this trip super amazing due to his recommendations

title: Ottimo hotel nel centro di Manhattan
text: Posizione eccellente (a 200 metri dalla metro) in un quartiere tranquillo. Stanza pulita e di dimensioni buone considerando gli standard di Manhattan. Apprezzato sia caffè Nespresso che il frigobar già inclusi nel prezzo pagato. Ottima Wii fi. Consigliatissimo.

title: Perfectas vacaciones 😊
text:
Hotel ubicado a 10 minutos de Times Square, con supermercados y bancos cerca. Parada de metro muy cercana.

Hacerle llegar a todos los departamentos como limpieza, restaurante de desayunos, recepción. Todos. Mi más sinceras felicitaciones.

Teneis gran calidad de empleados y eso es imprescindible para una estancia inolvidable.

Nombrar en especial a Kimberly de recepción, ella me aclaró todas las dudas que tuve y me ayudó en todo momento con una gran sonrisa y amabilidad.

Muchísimas gracias de corazón ❤

title: Wonderful
text: My wife and I were in town to celebrate our granddaughter’s second birthday and we have found the ideal place to stay while visiting. Good size room, very clean, great views, quiet street (for NYC) and very helpful staff. Thanks Kit/Javier for your extra special care and concern. Above and beyond and we do greatly appreciate it. See you again I hope on our next visit.

title: Muy buena situación
text:
Quiero destacar sobre todo la localización del hotel cerca de todos los atractivos de la ciudad o con una conexión en transporte muy cerca. 
Por otra parte, habitaciones amplias con decoración sencilla y funcional. 
Personal agradable

title: Service with a smile!
text: I have to praise the staff at INNside New York! They did an amazing job of making me and my husband feel very comfortable and special. Warm greetings in the elevator, wine and chocolates because I’m a repeat guest and a fun and lively restaurant/bar was a wonderful place to hang out during our stay. Big thank you to Hugo for going out of your way to make us happy customers!

title: Hotelazo un poco caro, con buenos servicios y buena ubicación. Muy moderno y bonito. Vale la pena!!!
text: Viajé del 2-9 Julio a NY y me instalé en este hotel en habitación de Luxe para 3 personas. El hotel está bien de precio y está nuevo, tiene zona fuera terraza chillout y terraza restaurante a pie de calle tbien. Todo muy bonito, y los precios, desorbitados, imposible comer allí, ensalada por 20 dólares, y así todo. La habitación, en fotos, parecía gigante, en la realidad, dos camas casi pegadas, una mesa esquina y todo muy hacinados pero muy bonito y moderno. Nevera con bebida gratuita, puedes pedir hasta 8 bebidas al día, que valiendo en quiosco calle, 2/3 dólares la botella de agua, vale la pena. Las camas, cómodas, pero no muy grandes, y se venden como para dos personas, no caben en ellas dos personas, y el baño, correcto, x apenas tiene cepillo o dientes u otras cosas importantes. Hotel silencioso y estupendamente ubicado. Personal atento, necesite clavija para cargar móvil y me dieron dos nuevas. Hasta aquí, todo muy bien. El último día, a la salida, me cobran 286 dólares en concepto de impuestos, importante tenerlo o en cuenta porque el viaje ya se encarece de manera importante. Fue un palo. Por lo demás, volvería a repetir, si pudiera permitírmelo.

title: good location but not work the $$s
text: Hotel is well located but average.  I was in an expensive suite - very basic furniture - mirror on a sliding door (??).  The sink was pretty clogged and was nasty - didn't happen overnight - bad management.  There was a light within the headboard that we tried to turn off but ultimately had to unplug it - was told at check out that it does not turn off - REALLY - DUH!!  - At least have a note about it.

title: Beware extra charges
text: I was charged an additional $40/night "Facilities Fee" upon check in. This was after agreeing to, and paying the published room rate per night directly through the hotels own website.  This is deceptive, if not fraudulent pricing/invoicing.  Otherwise the hotel was fine. Clean, modern, good location. Nothing extraordinary.

title: Perfecto
text:
Hotel muy bien situado y en zona muy tranquila , cerca de Penn Station o el Madison Square Garden.
Habitación muy limpia y con todo lo necesario, plancha, nespresso, minibar etc... El gimnasio estaba cerrado por reforma pero se puede utilizar el Planet Fitness justo a 2 minutos a pie el cual es más completo.
Personal muy amable y atento en especial Kimberley de recepción que resolvió de manera perfecta las dudas que nos surgieron.
Repetiré sin duda.

title: Great Hotel!
text: I loved my stay! Great amenities and location. The bedding was very comfortable. The hotel has a great vibe and was very comfortable. I would definitely stay there again for future trips to New York City.

title: Great hotel
text: Hotel was excellent the atmosphere was great!! Christina made us feel so welcome shes a great person. She found all the attractions for us and where to catch a subway. Her personality was so warm and very professional. Room was fantastic service was excellent. Shobna Kukadia

title: Fall weekend
text:
Love this charming, fun, upbeat hotel!  The service from check in to check out was fabulous!  Hugo in guest experince department was especially helpful when we asked for help finding our way around the city.  We enjoyed a delicious dinner at The Wilson on our last night.  The service and food were both amazing.  Thanku! 
Bekkah

title: Great hotel!! Loved it great front desk customer service!!
text: First time visiting New York and start time visiting Innside NY Nomad hotel. I had such amazing experience. Kimberly made my stay easy and Memorable she answered all my questions and also guide my to all great location around the city.. overall great staff will definitely return

title: EXCELENTE UBICACIÓN
text:
Hotel muy cómodo, agradable, buena ubicación que te permite ir andando a cualquier sitio y a la vez estar muy tranquilo 
Te reciben en español, el servicio es muy correcto, la recepción es perfecta y la habitación es amplia, cómoda, buen colchón y agradable 
Ha sido una excelente opción

title: un hotel 10 para tu visita a Nueva York
text: excelente ubicación, las habitaciones perfectas, sin moquetas ni cortinas de ducha, muy limpio y una tele grande. las tasas por habitación y día son caras pero a cambio tienes cafe nespresso y leche y la cafetera en la habitación y puedes consumir todo lo del minibar y no te lo cobran a parte. También tiene wifi y gimnasio incluidos en ese precio. las recepcionistas excepcionales, Kim y Cristina (esta última de habla hispana) nos solucionó todos los percances que tuvimos. En resumen , una estancia perfecta.

title: Good hotel bad restaurant
text:
Nice welcoming and environment.
Cool position, not far from the flatiron building, the fashion district and the amazing high-line.
Nice and quite clean room considering the NYC average.
I suggest to avoid the restaurant room service, the quality is very bad and the breakfast absolutely too expoensive considering the service offered.

title: cobro en mi tarjeta
text:
llegamos el dia 31 de octubre al hotel
al llegar me cargaron en mi tarjeta de credito 1345e cuando mi precio del hotel eran de 756 dolares mas 17500 puntos melia del cual soy miembro gold me dijeron que no tenia credito en mi tarjeta lo cual no era cierto 
despues de ingresar dinero en mi tarjeta me aceptaron en el hotel aparte de la verguenza que me hicieron pasar
al dia siguiente me dijeron que me lo iban a solucionar a dia de hoy tengo en la tarjeta cargos y abonos los cuales no corresponden al importe de la factura
he mandado emails y no me han contestado
es una verguenza que una cadena como melia tenga estos hoteles
las habitaciones correctas pero el trato al cliente por lo menos a mi fatal

title: Nice hotel - but things could be better
text: Nice hotel with excellent location. However, the beds are too small for sleeping two in (at least for teenagers). Only queen bed size are available - could be good if this is clearer on the website. No room servie of breakfast, the room was cleaned very late two/three days of our stay. The hotell charge a resort fee, not optional.

title: Great hotel with amazing staff
text:
We stayed for two nights and were very impressed! At check-in Christina and Robert were incredibly welcoming and accommodating. They greeted us like old friends, gave us a great room and later sent up champagne and truffles for my birthday. The room was very clean and bright and the small space was very well thought out. It was great to have a fridge in the room. We had a view of the Empire State Building, lots of light and a window that actually opens to hear the sounds of NYC. We got to know and appreciate Javier and Kim at the front desk as well and they were as nice and super helpful. Got a dinner recommendation from Robert for Momoya, a nearby Japanese restaurant that was excellent. 
Highly recommend InnSide and will return.

title: Terrific hotel in a super location!
text:
I just stayed here for the second time in 12 months.  We had a very quiet room on the 16th floor.  Rooms are very clean.  Beds and pillows are nice quality and comfortable. This hotel is located between a couple of fun areas for restaurants and isn't far from shopping areas if you don't mind a short walk, or a subway is close by.  

Best of all, the manager on duty offered spectacular personalized service when I made a special request, and he made a generous gesture that really touched me making my visit memorable.  In a city where everyone is in a hurry and often aloof, this manager is a gem of a find and seemed to genuinely care about my guest experience.  

Extra suggestions: If you like flea markets, there's a small one around the corner on the weekends.  Even going into Fairways around the corner or Eataly, a short walk, is a fun thing to do for foodies.  Brooklyn Bagels is a short walk and this is one of the best bagel spots ever!

title: Disfrutando de Chelsea !
text: Hotel bien ubicado en tranquilo barrio de Chelsea que lo están remodelándolo . Cerca de atracciones como el Empire Estate , el Flatiron , High Line que es muy recomendable , The Vessel en Hudson Yards , de impresionante  arquitectura y vistas que están al alcance de una caminata relativamente corta y agradable y con buenos lugares para comer cerca .

title: Estupendo
text:
Primero diré que el hotel está fenomenal...la atención es magnífica de todos sus empleados. Recepción, Cafeteria....se come muy bien. El desayuno un poquito escaso, pero muy agradable....
Solo tuvimos una mala experiencia, porque tuvimos que reclamar toallas, casi cada día!, y la limpieza del cuarto estuvo algún día bastante deficiente. Pero se tomaron mucho interés en resolver el tema. Lo recomiendo sin duda!

title: Great hotel with a modern vibe and decor.  The bar food was amazing!
text: Unlike a lot of hotels in NYC, this had a very modern decor with a great vibe. I would definitely recommend this hotel for those visiting for the first time as its close to tourist attractions and 1 min walk to one of the main  subways (Port Authority)

title: clean fresh mid town location
text:
one of the better hotels in mid town.  rooms in manhattan are generally small, but this was an adequate size.  
very central location, just a short stroll from Penn St station (trains direct to EWR & JFK) 
The most important things for me in a hotel are bed and bath. The bed here was comfortable. Not too hard, not too soft. Just right. 

Modern and contemporary hotel and certainly will stay again.  

People complain of the "service fee"   I feel the hotel should include this in the rate. It appear to be one of the cheaper options until you have to add on the fee's.  Although I would still stay here with the fee included.

title: Un hotel ideal ; cercano a todo
text:
una gran experiencia y un descubrimiento este hotel , cercano a todo y en medio de todo. 
la habitación muy moderna y la cama súper cómoda, no extrañé la mía y soy de mal dormir, 
Las recepcionistas que nos atendieron los diez días que estuvimos, Cristina y Kimberly un encanto, siempre atentas a nuestras preguntas y necesidades y siempre con una sonrisa en sus caras, y siempre intentando ayudarnos  y facilitar nuestra estancia en esa gran ciudad, la verdad es que no se puede pedir mas en una recepción siempre llena de clientes.Los servicios más que suficientes , buenas salas, gran recepción, buen restaurante y muy concurrido siempre, en fin para mi un sueño encontrar un hotel de cadena española,nuevo, moderno; y en plena calle 27 con la séptima a un paseo de todo. Volveré seguro❤️

title: Hotel en el centro de Manhattan
text:
Hemos estado mi mujer y yo en el mes de octubre,  lo primero decir que el hotel cumplió las expectativas, salvo el tema de las vistas a la ciudad,  ya que mi reserva era habitación cama King con vistas ciudad , pero en realidad no desmerece la habitación que era grande y cómoda la cama para descansar. Decir que NO nos parece bien que te cobren un extra de 35$ día por servicios que no utilizamos, me parece que debería ser opcional. 
El desayuno no me parece a la altura de los Melia que  he ido en España aparte de más caro.
El servicio de recepción muy bien, me resolvieron algún problema que tuve con el pago ya que en principio me decían que había algún problema con los puntos que había utilizado en la reserva y por ello me cobraron más de lo establecido en la reserva,  pero fue resuelto eficazmente y rectificaron la factura.
Mención especial para Christina de recepción que me ayudo mucho e incluso el día del cumpleaños de mi mujer tuvo el detalle de que nos llevaran un detalle a la habitación un 10 para ella.

title: Repetiré
text: Moderno, céntrico, limpio, con ambiente, con un restaurante en su hall, con vistas, con un excelente trato del personal (en especial de Cristina y Hugo) que hicieron nuestra estancia excepcional. Cuando vuelva a NYC volveré a repetir sin duda.

title: מלון חדש במיקום מצויין
text:
הייתי כשבוע במלון, המלון חדש , צעיר, אווירה מצויינת, מלא חברה צעירים בלובי ובמסעדה הצמודה .
החדרים מצויינים ומאובזרים, מיני בר, מכונת קפה ומקלחת מפנקת.
השהות היתה מצויינת למעט זה שלא היו קפסולות למכונת הקפה , לאחר שביקשנו נאמר לנו שאין קפסולות וזה בתהליך רכישה.
תשובה שלא מתאימה כלכך למלון ברמת מחיר כזאת.
סה״כ מלון מומלץ מאוד , המסעדה הצמודה קצת מאכזבת מבחינת אוכל ומחירים גבוהים.

title: My experience
text: INNSIDE hotel experience in my opinion:  welcoming staff, nice atmosphere, hallways need to be vacuumed more often, guest should be able to pick and choose if they want to use WiFi & Mini bar and not get charged for it whether or not they use it. Besides, as expensive as the room is the WiFi should be complementary.

title: Ticked All The Accommodation Boxes
text: Great hotel, perfectly placed to explore New York. Close to Times Square, but not that close, thankfully. Spotlessly clean room, good walk-in shower, comfy beds and efficient aircon. Nice touches like a Nespresso machine with free pods and free soda and water, all topped up daily. We didn't use the restaurant -The Wilson - but it seemed very lively, popular with locals and guests alike. The menu looked great - just a little bit beyond our budget for this trip. Reception staff were super friendly and efficient and we were given good tips on how to get to JFK on the subway and AirTrain - good to know especially if you're leaving during evening rush hour on a Friday. All in all, a great stay which helped make this, our first trip to New York, even more memorable.

title: INNSIDE - Great place to stay in Chelsea District Manhattan NYC
text: The hotel was very nicely decorated and updated, beautiful modern/eclectic vibe. The bar and restaurant were always busy, with a fun crowd enjoying the atmosphere, music, drinks and eats. Definitely a nice place to stay, very clean and within a short walk to subway, Madison Square Garden and more! Only two stops to Broadway to see a musical, play and Times Square - great location great stay! My only complaint was no ice buckets/machines on the actual floors, but if requested from the bar they were more than willing to oblige!

title: Great midtown option
text:
This  hotel  affords some outstanding views, is quiet, clean and pretty much anything most travellers will need. I was in town for business and the room was ample in size, particularly the  bathroom, which in my experience is a rarity in NYC.  Very  popular bar/restaurant by the lobby, great atmosphere yet not too loud to impact guests in rooms.  

Very clean, modern, comfortable and location is very convenient. This block of W27th is that attractive in itself but quiet and clean enough. 

Can't go wrong here.

title: Upscale Property Perfect for Meetings
text: This property is perfect for group bookings in the Manhattan area. The team here is very professional and give 5 star service to your attendees. Parking is a bit expensive, but it is Manhattan so that is to be expected. The meeting facilities here are ultra modern and have a fantastic AV set up. The rooms are also impressive regardless of the level you book at. I can safely say that my attendees were impressed with our company after attending our event at INNSIDE. The lobby scent system and cleanliness of the entire hotel add to the luxury vibe from the moment you enter the property. They also allowed outside F&B for our group which is unheard of in New York and was a huge selling point for us and anyone who is only doing a small meal or snacks for their event.

title: Recomendable sin duda en Nueva York
text:
Un referente en cuanto a situación y amabilidad de los empleados. Inmejorable
En el Midtown pero entre la 6ª y 7ª avenida que es una zona tranquila. La verdad que no me sorprendió porque Meliá nunca falla en cuanto a la calidad de sus hoteles

title: Over priced and rubbish WiFi and mini bar
text: The hotel was over priced mini bar was the worst I have ever seen WiFi was a joke. I would probably rate this hotel as a 2 3 star I have stayed in hundreds of hotel and I have always got my deposit back straight away I have never paid tax once getting to the hotel

title: Ok stay, poor wifi and unexpected fees at end of stay
text: My overall stay was fine, although at check in I was told there would be a $40 facility fee when I check out, on day of check out it was $160 for the wifi, gym facilities, bar etc. None of which I used or wanted to us, except the wifi which would have been a great service if it worked, got about an hour a day if I was lucky to connect with family back home as my mobile network charges a fortune for texting etc outside of the UK, having wifi was important to me and I don't think it is very fair to advice customers of a 40 dollar fee then advising at the end of stay it was per night.

title: A Gem in the middle of NYC!
text: Definitely a pleasant surprise! Hotel has a very good feel, it's very modern, great ambience! It has a very nice restaurant and bar. Location is great! Everything is within walking distance. The room is a decent size and very comfortable.

title: Nice hotel with problamatic elevators
text:
This was my second time staying at Innside. While the room is clean and the bar/restaurant is convenient I had a rough experience being stuck in their elevator. The only phone number I was able to secure sent me to a call center in Spain. They were able to connect me with the front desk but the loud music in the elevator prevented me from clearly hearing the discussion. After 55 minutes they were able to get the door open thankfully without incident. The entire experience was a bit frightening. 
Overall the hotel is quite nice for the price. My advice is to make sure you have your phone charged when you get on the elevator...

title: Parfait
text:
Service de l hôtel et du bar parfait.
Personnel avenant, disponible, adaptable et avec d excellents conseils sur la ville, les attractions et les bars.
Changement de chambre immédiat car bruit récurrent de goutte d eau qui tombe et eau tiède. Affaire réglée en 2 minutes.
Hôtel classe, sobre, calme (pas du tout bruyant) et propre (sans too much).
Vue agréable sur les buildings new yorkais.
